items.title: Software Engineer with ML skills @ AI Team
items.content:
We're looking for a person to join our AI team which is responsible for making credit limit decisions, processing invoices and handling collection. Your role will be to build up the software architecture for automation, observe the processes in operations and start migrating them to a machine assisted decision making algorithms. You'll be working in an autonomous team of 5-6 people.

This job is ideal for if you are interested in financial technology, machine learning and enjoy engineering systems and features at all levels of the stack. Here you can rapidly prototype and test ideas, experiment with new solutions and learn something new every day. Our stack includes Spring Boot and Aurelia Framework run on AWS. For machine learning algorithms, we use Python libraries.

*ABOUT INVESTLY*
Our vision is to create the first Narrow AI for providing working capital for businesses across the globe. As the speed of economic growth is not slowing down, we see that we have an important role to play by helping mankind in manufacturing, distributing and selling goods. With Investly, we provide business owners with the financial means that allow them to efficiently manage their growth.
Read more about the vision of the team you'll be working in: https://medium.com/@maivel/ai-assisted-credit-decisions-c04ada5ffc06

Our supercharged dev team consists of full stack engineers that have a knack for statistics, data science and machine learning algorithms. We are a fintech startup with offices in Tallinn, Estonia and London, UK.

*WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING*
* Designing, building and maintaining the invoice processing app
* Replicating the know-how of our analysis team in the invoice processing app
* Improving the decision-making models with machine learning techniques
* Working closely with customer support and sales teams to automate processes or develop new features
* Identifying and implementing solutions to customer issues
* Integrating third-party applications through APIs
* Prototyping and testing product ideas, experimenting with new solutions, presenting demos before pushing code out
* Making data-based decisions when evaluating yours or others ideas
* Constantly making your code better
* Learning new technologies as the need arises

*REQUIREMENTS*
* Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment
* Minimum 3 years of development experience, preferrably in Java and Javascript
* Experience with web frameworks
* English as a working language
* Ready to relocate to Estonia

Bonus points if you have:
* An interest in financial technology
* Been using Investly yourself
* Experience using Spring Boot or Aurelia or both
* Experience with AWS

*BENEFITS*
* A challenging job in a fast-growing venture capital funded fintech start-up
* Diverse organisation with highly motivated team members from Estonia, UK and Poland
* Your decisions matter and will make a change
* Dedication rewarded with options scheme
* Competitive salary

Be part of something that's going to make a difference!

items.title: Full-stack developer
items.content:
Expert Trades provides software and tech services to trades professionals, helping them to manage and grow their businesses. We also offer a range of services to larger clients throughout the UK construction industry. Bringing tech to a very traditional industry has its challenges, but also its opportunities. We are looking for developer support to help us push on from the strong platform we have established over the past 3 years.

You will join a young, ambitious team based in a lively and creative environment within central Birmingham. We’re a relatively small team so you will have responsibility and tangible input from the outset. As such, we are looking for someone who not only has brilliant technical skills, but can manage numerous projects simultaneously, communicate effectively and work well with other team members. You will get to see the positive impact your work has on our customers on a daily basis, but must also be able to react quickly and effectively to challenges as they arise.

*Please note that we are not looking to hire a remote developer, but are instead looking for someone who can join the team in our office in Birmingham.*

*Required Skills*

We are looking for someone with a passion for technology and innovation, as well as a keenness to always learn and develop.

*Essential*

* Minimum 2 years experience
* Modern PHP frameworks experience (ideally Symfony)
* Knowledge of RESTful APIs
* Very good understanding of OOP design and principles
* Understanding of TDD and DDD
* Unit and functional testing (PHPUnit)
* Experience with SQL & MySQL
* Experience with HTML5 & CSS3
* JavaScript with knowledge of AngularJS
* Experience setting up Unix servers using LAMP
* Ability to solve problems independently



*Beneficial*

* Knowledge of version control software such as Git
* Knowledge of Ionic & Cordova
* Knowledge of GCloud or AWS




If you feel like you’re a fit for this role and are up for a challenge in a fast growing startup then please get in touch, we would love to hear from you!

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
We are looking for a talented Software Engineer to work closely with our CTO to design and build our Java backend.

We are an early stage startup founded by an experienced team who have successfully built a similar business before. We have built the core of the platform and we are now looking to expand our team after our first round of funding.

Our goal is to make B2B orders as simple as shopping online. B2B commerce, and in particular international trade is still dominated by lots of paperwork, faxes and telephone calls. Our goal is to reinvent this world from the ground up using a drastically simplified model of B2B orders, REST APIs and potentially Blockchain.

We are committed to building a company that is open and culturally diverse. We believe that a completely flat, self-managed organization is the best way to stay agile and enjoy our work. With freedom also comes responsibility. We are looking for people that care and can work independently.

You will become an owner in the business and get the opportunity to shape a new platform from the start. You main responsibility will be development, architecture, and deployment, but you will also be involved in the end-to-end process from product ideas to operations.

We are looking for a Senior Developer. We use the latest Java 8 technology with the Spring framework, in an Agile environment.

We develop containerized Docker micro services deployed onto AWS. The services communicate with each other through REST APIs and we make extensive use of HATEOAS. We are considering extending into Blockchain to make order management open and secure.

The ideal candidate will have:

- Java 8

- Spring (Framework, Boot, Data, Batch, Security)

- Groovy

- Strong Agile experience

- Strong experience with Microservice architecture

- Experience with AWS and

- Experience with Docker

- Continuous Delivery methodologies and tools

The benefits of the role include:

- Share options

- A level of personal growth that you can’t get anywhere else, work with an experienced team and shape your own role as the company grows

- Be involved in company strategy, product and positioning

- Full internal transprancy on company performance

- Flexible location and working hours – we care about results, not facetime

- A close team with frequent team outings

- The opportunity to be the owner of a fast growing business

items.title: iOS Developer
items.content:
*iOS developer role for exciting Accelerator-backed start-up. Part-time pay to start, full salary and equity options TBD*

We are looking for someone with technical expertise to join our 2-man team at 1UP! 1UP aims to lower the barrier for aspiring athletes around the world to compete with eachother. They can compete at any time, any place and at any level simply by using their photos and videos.

*The role:* We currently have an iOS app and are looking for someone to help us continue improving the UX and UI. Technical work has been outsourced to date, but we now aim to start bringing it in house. As we scale the business and team there are options to transition this into a CTO role.

*Salary:* TBD based on experience, with potential for equity options and a full time position down the line.

*Why join 1UP?*

*Great traction:* A growing, engaged user base. Partnered with many brands, venues and events.

*Business validation:* On a reputable Accelerator program in Sweden at the moment.

*Cool area:* If you enjoy action and urban sports then this is for you. We live and breathe it everyday!

*Strong team:* 2 co-founders, both friends from Cambridge university, having studied engineering. We bring 20 years of business experience (in business consulting and corporate finance). We both left high paying jobs and have been fully immersed in building this for nearly a year because we truly believe in its prospects.

*Flexibility:* Ability to work around any other jobs you have and from home.

*Get in at the start:* Join something great right from the start!

*Requirements*

Strong objective C capabilities for iOS development

Prior experience building apps

Good feel for UI and UX

Committed to the project and good work ethic

Python experience for backend preferred but not essential

items.title: Lead Developer | Full-Stack
items.content:
We’re a revenue-making startup creating an online marketplace for on-demand photography services. Feel free to check out: Perfocal.com

*Keywords*: #Marketplace #SharingEconomy #OnDemand #Photography #ValidatedMarket

We launched a beta which has generated £25k+ sales in London, with over 300 photographers signed up on the supply side. We've also got huge fan base on social media all over the world (28k photographer followers on Instagram and still counting). Just raised a small angel round we now plan to iterate the product (hard and quick) and get it ready for further growth.

We are looking for a lead full-stack developer to join the team and take over the product development. The role is our first key hire so will be offered great share options and potential of becoming our new CTO. You'll be building our new product from end to end based on your choose of technology and frequently get involved in product decision making. If preferred we'd start with a relatively shorter term contract first (3-6 months).

*Role description in one line*: 50% back-end, 25% front-end, 25% product shaping & managing, start asap.

*WHAT WE OFFER*
* Decision making full-stack developer role.
* Good Salary
* Great Equity Pack (2-4%)
* Office in London
* Potential of taking over a CTO role

*WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR*
* Full-stack development skills, current stack on Laravel (php) framework (will consider to switch stack if truly necessary)
* Handy experience and track records in building complex platforms independently
* Familiarity with common SaaS tools and third party APIs (payment gateways, emails & SMS integrations, the "Cloud" such as AWS etc.)

If you’re interested in the market we’re targeting on, or are just looking for a new adventure, let’s have a chat! *To apply* please send a line with your CV or LinkedIn profile, your portfolio of previous projects and possible your GitHub and StackOverFlow profiles.

items.title: Lead Front-end Dev
items.content:
Lead Front-end Developer // Tailify

London, England, United Kingdom


DESCRIPTION

Tailify was coined "startup most likely to revolutionise the media industry" by Starcom MediaVest. Tailify is an end-to-end solution for Influencer Marketing, meaning we connect social media influencers and advertisers, so they can create high-impact campaigns together. We work in the fastest growing ad-segment and our customers include brands such as Coca-Cola, Disney, L'Oréal, Marc Jacobs, and many others. Tailify is also part of Founders Factory, Europe's best accelerator.


As our Lead Front-end Developer, you will be an integral part of the Tailify team, this means creating a beautiful products for the world’s largest brands and the most influential people on social media. We expect curiosity, creativity and quality, and will give you freedom to do your magic and make something unique!

You will be given immediate responsibilities and ownership of products.


REQUIREMENTS

You will be responsible for the front end development of our brand marketplace, as well as our mobile app for influencers. The role includes being part of product development, developing new user-facing features and ensuring technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.

Strong experience with React, React Native and AngularJS
Good experience with using REST APIs
Comfortable with using Git for source code management and workflows
Preferably previous start up experience
An eye for good design


BENEFITS

We're a team of entrepreneurs, we love what we do and it's reflected in the company culture. Apart from a competitive salary and opportunity to earn as you learn, you will also get to be part of our highly vibrant office culture. We sit in the Rolls Royce of office spaces, just next to Old Street roundabout.

No strict work hours, no fixed vacation days, just goals, getting things done.

You'll get all the shiny new tools you need, like your own macbook, 24' screen, Tailify goodies and whatever you need to excel in your position.

We also value time outside of the office and we believe it's important we have a fun together, which is why we arrange weekly Friday After Works with beer on the house! We also do company trips together. Next trip is planned for the Norwegian mountains - we'd love to bring you with us!

items.title: ★ iOS Team Lead ★
items.content:
Dubsmash is the global internet phenomenon that lets you be the internet. By adding a famous movie, television, and internet quotes to your camera, you can create fun, memorable, meaningful videos to share with the world.

With over 200 million installs, 3 billion videos, tens of thousands of daily downloads across 192 countries–including Jimmy Falcon, Rihanna (RIHANNA!), Cara Delevigne, and an unmanageable backlog of A-list celebrities creating dubs and showing the world who they are.

Dubsmash is redefining the relationship between people and the content they love. Oh, and it’s addictive as hell.

We are now searching for a passionate iOS Team Lead to join our team and help us take our company and product to the next level. We iterate fast, work hard, make pragmatic decisions and find new ways to solve fun, interesting, and meaningful challenges every day.

*What does a iOS Team Lead do at Dubsmash?*

The iOS team lead is a critical part of our product team. We want someone who has a mind of an engineer yet the soul of a product manager. Not only will you take full ownership of our code base, make architectural decisions to build readable, maintainable code quickly but also be responsible for leading and scaling a kick-ass iOS team, lead by example, collaborating with other engineers, designers and product managers as an active member of a cross-functional team.

We want YOU to be the heart and soul of our iOS team. This will be your baby. Drive it with passion. Help us build a fresh version of our product which is used by millions of users daily.

*What do we look for in our iOS Team Lead?*

- Hold a Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science, math, physics or other quantitative subjects
- Have at least 1-2 years leading an iOS team at a mobile-first company.
- Have a minimum of 3 years experience in iOS with a knowledge and interest on the latest trend.
- You must live, breathe and sweat *SWIFT*! (our juniors already do)
- Have worked in a startup before and knows what startups are all about.
- Excellent English skills

*What to expect:*

Our headquarters are located in the heart of Berlin, a vibrant city in one of Europe’s most innovative startup hubs. Benefits include:

- Competitive salary
- Stock Options
- Sponsorship and Relocation package
- Full healthcare package
- Free food and drinks all day long
- Cab ride and dinner on us if you end up working late
- A great work environment, in a cool office, working with some of the best engineers in town!

items.title: Unity Developer
items.content:
Sensible Object is a connected games company based in Somerset House, Central London. Our first game, Beasts of Balance, shipped to around 10,000 customers last year and our goal is to substantially grow our customer base in 2017. We're a small team with a love of games, toys and connecting people through play.

We're looking for a generalist programmer to join our team. You'll be working on maintaining Beasts of Balance, developing expansions and (eventually) new games. This will be done working closely within a small and collaborative team.

We're looking for someone:
- who can write C#
- knows their way around Unity
- has shipped a game before (even if free or small)
- comfortable working in small teams
- who has good opinions about game design and visual design

And it'd be lovely if you had some of the following:
- experience with mobile
- experience with boardgames, toys or alt-ctrl games
- experience writing native plugins for Unity
- experience doing stuff with Bluetooth

This role is full-time, based at our studio in London.

We specifically are looking to build a diverse team, so please please do apply, even if you're demographically underrepresented by the games industry. If you don’t tick all the boxes but think you can help us do amazing things then we still want to talk to you.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
*Who We Are*

"Administrate":http://www.getadministrate.com builds an online platform that helps training providers save time and money. Our mission is to make our customer’s training operations and training courses run better for less money.

We are a quickly growing, young, energetic company, with an established global customer base, a solid core team, and a clear vision. Oh, and we work a 4 day, 32 hour week, but we'll pay you a 5 day wage!


*Who You Are*

You're passionate about what you do. Always searching for a challenge, always looking to improve, you broke your first computer exploring what made it tick, then you rebuilt it, better than it was before. Better...stronger...faster.

You build your own great stuff for fun, but at work you choose standards and reuse, because teams are not just one person, and you don't reinvent the wheel. Do things once, if people think you're doing it twice, they are wrong, you scripted it weeks ago.

You're striving for perfection, but grounded in reality, getting the job done comes first, but it's never something to hide behind, because you don't do 'ok'. If something sucks you say why, and how to sort it, it doesn't matter who's being stupid. You're honest to a fault.

You love to work with smart people and hate mediocrity. Small teams, dynamic companies and flexible working environments are unparalleled. Bureaucracy is for someone else who likes wasting time and effort.

You have been around, learned the ropes and know how to keep your team from falling into the usual traps. You enjoy leading by example, encouraging and challenging other members of your team.

Work hard. Work smart. Work well.

*What You'll Do*

Work on business critical applications with real customers around the world. We aren't building better social todo lists here, we do real software with real engineering.

Develop solutions in a variety of languages and leading technologies. Our core system is PHP, but we use Python and even good old statically typed, complied languages where required.

Be a catalyst within the engineering team for cleaner code, better tests, more scalable solutions.

*What You'll Get*

Something to talk about. Real programmers have stories about code, we have a 7 year old codebase. You will have stories, good ones about defeating dragons, saving distressed peasants and founding cities that reach to the sky.

Real impact on our products. We are a team of equals, the best ideas win, whomever has them.

Paid, in real money, not promises, from an established company.

*Technologies We Use*

We use the following technologies each day:

PHP - used for legacy code base
Python - all new code
Flask
AngularJS
Bootstrap
jQuery
MySQL
Redis
Celery
Chef

*Where We Are*

We are located in the Edinburgh "CodeBase":http://www.thisiscodebase.com, at the heart of the Scottish startup scene.

*How to Apply*

Apply "here":https://careers.jobscore.com/careers/administrate/jobs/senior-software-engineer-bP1VkuXB0r5AhrdG1ZS6tF?ref=rss&sid=68!

items.title: Tech- Senior 3rd Line Support - MANCHESTER
items.content:
The Role: Senior 3rd Line Support

Here at TheLADbible Group our IT department are central to everything we do as they ensure our employees are armed with everything technical in order to do their job. As our Senior 3rd Line Support you will be working with an experienced, knowledgeable and dedicated team in providing expertise to the wider group regarding any issues with the IT function.

You will bring your experience and skills to the role to ensure all issues are resolved within set time frames, play an integral part in IT projects, communicate innovative IT-centric solutions and provide support to our 2nd Line support in developing their skills and knowledge. This role will also be responsible for software updates, customer desktop implementation and remaining proactive in ensuring we’re at the top of our game.

The Person:

Minimum experience of 5 years in a previous role working within a support environment
Working towards MCSE, MCP or CCNA.
Diploma qualified, or equivalent, within a relevant field
In depth server operating system and hardware knowledge (VMware or other virtualisation technology)
Microsoft 365 experience
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Possess the ability to build effective working relationships

It is also advantageous although not essential if you have experience in the following:

Working across with multiple sites
Experience within a corporate environment
Experience using Atlassian (JIRA or Confluence)

If you are looking for the next step in your career into a dynamic, passionate company where you are looking to expand your knowledge and experience whilst working with subject matter experts then we want to hear from you.

About us:
TheLADbible Group is at the forefront of digital publishing and social entertainment. With over 130 staff across our Manchester and London offices. Our people communicate with over 42M followers publishing over 5000 pieces of content per month. We are the 2nd largest publisher of video online in the world ahead of Disney and Time Warner.

TheLADbible Group builds communities across multiple channels including our websites, Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, Vine, Twitter, YouTube, AppleTV and our apps. We understand our audience and are on their side. Our community brings people together and we try to use our influence for good. We are the forefront of digital publishing and social entertainment. With over 110 staff across two key locations, Manchester and London, our brands include TheLADbible, TheSPORTbible, TheODDSbible, TheLENSbible, TheCONTENTbible, TheGAMINGbible, TheFOODbible, TheLADbibleOZ and Pretty52.

items.title: iOS Engineer - Manchester
items.content:
TheLADbible Group is at the forefront of digital publishing and social entertainment. Our people communicate with over 42 million followers, publish over 5000 pieces of content per month and our website is one of the largest visited sites in the UK accruing in excess 40 million site visits a month.

Working alongside industry leading experts you will work to ensure technology solutions are at all times aligned with business requirements, as well as implement innovative and creative solutions to deliver TheLADbible Group’s ambitious business vision.

We provide an environment where our staff are empowered with the right equipment and support to enable them to exceed at their role and because of this our tech team have produced a hit no1 award winning iOS Apple store app which has had over half a million downloads.

Everyone member of the team has the ability to change and drive the technical vision of the team and it’s products.

In return you get access to work with our partners latest and greatest technology and beta programmes. You will also get the opportunity to:

Participate in our Hackathons
Research and development into new platforms and languages
Enjoy a Friday inspiration session for exploring new ideas and tech
Enjoy a good social every month
Enjoy an even bigger social every quarter
Get access to tech resources to help progress your learning

The Person:

This is an amazing opportunity for problem solvers who are passionate about mobile applications, possessing an awareness of how to implement Agile/Scrum in an impact driven environment.

To ensure you succeed in the role we need you to demonstrate the following experience and technical knowledge with:

Previous experience creating and developing commercial mobile applications
Experience of using JIRA.
A passion to continually strive to be at the forefront of what we do
Continually strive to have an understanding of our audiences
A positive and can do approach to all work

About us:

TheLADbible Group is at the forefront of digital publishing and social entertainment. With over 110 staff across our Manchester and London offices. Our people communicate with over 42M followers publishing over 5000 pieces of content per month. We are the 2nd largest publisher of video online in the world ahead of Disney and Time Warner.

TheLADbible Group builds communities across multiple channels including our websites, Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, Vine, Twitter, YouTube, AppleTV and our apps. We understand our audience and are on their side. Our community brings people together and we try to use our influence for good. We are the forefront of digital publishing and social entertainment. With over 110 staff across two key locations, Manchester and London, our brands include TheLADbible, TheSPORTbible, TheODDSbible, TheLENSbible, TheCONTENTbible, TheGAMINGbible, TheFOODbible, TheLADbibleOZ and Pretty52.

items.title: Web Developer
items.content:
*About Yieldify*

Yieldify makes it easy for any marketer to deliver great experiences that engage and retain customers through a combination of smart and simple technology with expert services. In other words, the Yieldify Conversion Platform and its products deliver smart onsite and email messages based on visitor behaviour, while our teams of experts take the heavy lifting out of data-driven strategy.

Trusted by over 500 brands on more than 1,000 websites globally, we help marketers from both growing businesses and the world’s most recognisable brands, including Marks and Spencer, Domino’s Pizza, Omni Hotels and Anthropologie.

Established in 2013 and with offices in London, New York and Sydney, we’re over 100 digital experience enthusiasts backed by Google Ventures and SoftBank Capital, all on a journey to creating the future of marketing experiences.

Please visit "our website":http://www.yieldify.com for more information.

* Knowledge of React, Sass, Angular 2, Angular CLI, Typescript or Node.js a
bonus.

* Knowledge of Jasmine, Mocha, Chai or other JS testing frameworks a bonus.
* Understanding of component-based front-end architecture

*What we offer*

* We are an international, highly motivated and tech-enthusiastic team
* We offer an exciting and dynamic work environment
* You will take a leading role in the development of the technical infrastructure of a fast growing international company
* Competitive salary and equity

items.title: Frontend Developer
items.content:
Ever wanted to help build and improve a product that actually helps people do useful things? Here at Memrise we’re building the world’s most joyful language learning app, and you could be a part of it! We already have well over 15 million users, loads of accolades like Google Play App of the Year 2015 and 2016, as well as Self-Improvement App of 2016, and we have massive plans to scale and improve online and mobile learning for everyone.

We are looking for an experienced and passionate Frontend Developer to join us and take responsibility for making the Memrise website and web app as great an experience as our mobile apps are.

This opportunity presents the rare chance to join a startup as it scales from millions to tens of millions of active users, and in doing so make a meaningful impact on how people learn around the world.
REQUIREMENTS

You will be very experienced in frontend development, with a real passion for making user experience amazing. You will get to work with a very talented team of designers and product people, so communication skills are super important as well. As we are a language learning app, an interest in languages will score you loads of extra points!

Ideally this will sound like you:

* Deep knowledge of one or more modern JavaScript frameworks such as Mithril, React, EmberJS
* Lots of hands-on experience of CSS3
* A mobile first development mindset
* Impressive examples of fast, responsive sites/web apps you have built
* Experience with front end animation is a plus
* Enjoys working with multiple teams: product, UX, QA etc.
* A love of new technologies coupled with a pragmatic attitude to their application

If you aren’t completely confident that you fit our exact criteria, please get in touch immediately. Humility is a wonderful thing and we’re not interested in hiring ‘rockstars’ or ‘ninjas’. And we're at least as interested in character as in talent.

BENEFITS

Healthcare and pension, with a number of discounts and cashback on important stuff like Gym membership, opticians and dentists' fees. Fresh fruit; coffee and soft drinks. We keep you fuelled with a wide ever-changing variety of healthy and unhealthy snacks, breakfast materials and weekly team lunches. We have frequent team expeditions, the last one being a lovely canal cruise in the summer sunshine! We run a cycle to work scheme and a selection of useful perks and benefits. You'll get to work the people in this video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wORv8J1n0y8

Friday pizza

items.title: Senior Python Developer
items.content:
NO RECRUITERS OR AGENCIES PLEASE FOR THIS ROLE

Sportr is a UCL-based AI-powered content provision service that curates targeted third-party content for marketing teams, maximising content flow and cutting the large costs associated with producing content. Sportr pivoted from SportsFix, the first sports news summary app, voted top 10 out of 425 apps in a pan-European competition hosted by Facebook in partnership with Seedrs.

We are now looking for an experienced Python Developer to join our team. We are a small but fast moving team, working on challenging problems.

At Sportr you will be:
- Writing great Pythonic microservices
- Doing DevOps - deploy your own code
- Introducing new technologies and patterns - nothing is set in stone
- Reviewing other people's code - sharing knowledge and keeping quality high
- Using continuous integration
- Using TDD

A glance at our stack:
- Kafka and ZeroMQ
- Kubernetes
- Postgresql and Elasticsearch
- Python 3

It's good to have:
- An interest in Machine Learning - we apply Machine Learning for various problems
- Experience with web scraping
- Some frontend experience

Benefits:
Competitive salary
Part of a great team - with the freedom to get the job done
Flexible on where and when you work

items.title: Senior Java Engineer
items.content:
We are SpotQA, Quality Assurance evangelists, innovators and engineers with a real passion for developing game changing solutions and seamless digital experiences.

We change how things are done, playing with leading and bleeding edge technologies, building the next generation of products by applying Machine Learning and Robotic Process Automation techniques to help shape the future of digital QA.

We are looking for an ambitious Senior Java Developer, to join our product team, to work on our exciting and challenging new QA products and platforms.

Having experience and knowledge in these areas will ensure you make a big impact!

* Algorithms and Data Structures:
Time and complexity trade-offs of data structures as well implementing Hash tables and Priority Queues.
You should be proficient in implementing Tree, Graph and divide and conquer algorithms.

* Business Logic:
Proficient in developing in-memory caching mechanisms.
Knowledge in detail how garbage collection works and is able to monitor it and tune it as required.
Proficient in web socket programming and server-sent-events (SSE).

* Databases
Expert in NoSql databases such as MongoDB.
Expert in Relational databases such as MySql, PostgreSQL, Oracle.
Experience with in-memory database and matrix such as Hazelcast.

* Transversal competencies:
Strong Java language domain.
Proficient working in Linux based environments and be able to creates scripts to automate processes.
Proficient in container technology that mimics the production environment.
Collaborates and liaises with other teams easily.
Bring new ideas to the table to improve our products and teams.
Proficient in Version Control Systems such as Git and in Continuous Integration Servers such as Jenkins.

* Extra Points for:
Describe the browser’s high level architecture as well the page rendering process inside the browser.
Good skills with JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3.
Experience with Robotic process automation.
Testing frameworks like Selenium, TestNG.

BENEFITS
Cool, shared office space in old converted textile mill
Working on game changing, bleeding edge technologies
Working with a fast growing multinational startup which is shaping the future of Digital QA.

This is an opportunity to make a big impact on our E-commerce platform and help shape the new services we’re creating, as well as make a difference to the lives of millions of people around the world.

*Our Mission*
At Live Better With we are on a mission to make day-to-day life a little better for the 300m+ people across the world living with long term conditions. Our current focus is Cancer and we connect cancer patients with curated products and services recommended by patients, families, healthcare professionals, charities and our 30,000+ community to address the side effects and symptoms that reduce the quality of their day to day lives. * Pragmatic as well as opinionated, ability to objectively weigh up which tools are right for the job

* From a background of a few different sectors so you can bring a wealth of knowledge
* Embracing responsibility, everything you do will have an impact and we're data driven so we can measure the difference we make

items.title: Full-Stack Developer
items.content:
Felcana is an exciting early stage Pet Tech start-up with a mission to help owners more effectively listen to their pets. Using connected devices and powerful data analytics, we track the health, behaviour and activity of cats and dogs. Along with helping owners understand their pets, Felcana empowers vets with reliable insights to aid earlier and more accurate diagnosis.

But this is just the beginning of our journey. We are constantly looking to new technologies to rethink and revolutionise the care of animals, through the creation of meaningful connections.

At our core, we are a small, inventive and fast-paced team that is always striving to grow both professionally and personally. We believe in being constantly challenged and cultivate this attitude through autonomy, responsibility and open discussions. As we grow our team and move in new and exciting directions, we are seeking talented individuals that share our enthusiasm and drive.

Role

We are on the hunt for a Full-Stack Developer to lead the development of our powerful platform that can process large amounts of data and deliver powerful features to our users through our iOS and Android apps. Working alongside our technical team, you’ll be an all-round analytical genius. Your analysis and insight will inform our product roadmap. We’re a start-up and so our team structure is flat – you’ll work directly with James, our CEO.

Responsibilities

o Own and take responsibility for the development, testing and deployment of Felcana’s cloud services, API and apps
o Work with team members to define the functionality, specifications and features of our service
o Ensuring that our system is easy to use, has a high level of security and doesn’t contain bugs
o Maintaining a high standard of coding practice, with clear comments, good documentation and effective use of revision control
o Exploring new product opportunities through creativity, research and prototyping
o Immersing yourself in the tech scene to ensure Felcana remains at the cutting edge
o Communicate complex ideas effectively to the entire team

Qualifications

o A 2:1 bachelors or higher in a relevant analytical discipline awarded by a leading academic institution (e.g. Imperial College, UCL, Cambridge, Bristol, Edinburgh, etc.)
o Significant experience with deploying cloud services, creating databases (both relational and non-relational) and a suite of relevant web APIs
o Experience with app development, testing and deployment across iOS, Android and web
o Experience of consumer-facing deployment, incorporating collaboration with designers and demonstrating attention to usability and performance
o Strong programming skills in a collection of relevant languages, such as Java, PHP, .NET, Python, SQL, Objective-C, Javascript, etc
o Strong Linux and Bash skills
o Ambition, tenacity, and self-starting with the ability to identify creative new approaches

Benefits

o Competitive salary aligned with industry norms and prior experience
o 25 days’ annual holiday plus bank holidays
o World class team that includes experienced product designers, electronic engineers, and vets
o Fabulous office within Makerversity, Somerset House - a location full of designers, artists, scientists and entrepreneurs
o 20% discount across all the bars and restaurants in Somerset House
o Annual bonus to spend on anything pet related
o Opportunity to put your mark on a new brand

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
*About "Paddle":http://www.paddle.com*

Our mission is to make selling software easy; allowing developers to focus on building products they love. We handle all of the hard stuff (like payments, licensing, taxes, trials, in-app purchases, analytics & customer engagement), so they don't have to.

We are a dynamic and entrepreneurial venture backed team of 28 based in London. We’re scaling fast with ambitious plans for 2017 and we’re looking for someone to help bring cadence and their expertise to our engineering team’s evolution through the next phase of growth.


*What will you do*
*You’ll be developing and expanding our existing range of products
*Technical ownership of one (or more) areas of our codebase
*Provide engineering advice for team issues, including architectural, and be involved in wider technical decisions that impact other teams or the company at large
*Participate in deep-dive code reviews of work submitted by other team members
*Solve the majority of operational issues without escalation, including deployment, infrastructure, and debugging tasks
*Proactive in reducing technical debt
*Participate in the recruitment process for engineers, including conducting phone screens, sitting on interview panels, and reviewing technical tests
*Onboarding new team members and providing mentoring and coaching where appropriate

**Your experience + skills**
- Competent commercial experience developing applications or other software platforms
- A strong understanding of the development process from design through to deployment and maintenance and what that means for day-to-day development
- Laravel 4 or 5, or Symfony 2
- OOP PHP application development
- Git, including general repository management
- AWS exposure, covering SQS, SNS, EC2, S3, and IAM (AWS certified a bonus)
- SQL
- Experience with shell scripting
- PHPUnit (or unit-testing generally)
- Automated deployment with Capistrano, and provisioning with Chef (or similar, Puppet etc)
- Worked with message queues (RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ, SQS etc)
- LAMP stack administration
- Exposure to another language, e.g. Ruby, Java, Obj-C, C#
- Experience using of AWS (EC2, RDS etc.)
- Previous exposure to JIRA


*What’s in it for you?*
*Share options - everyone at Paddle is an owner in the business
*Excellent exposure to management, transparent company performance, input into company direction, ideas and growth
*The best possible equipment - whatever you need to increase your productivity
*We care about results, not face time - if you need some time to work from home and can maintain efficiency then that’s cool with us
*A close team with frequent team outings (food, drink, sports etc.)
*The opportunity to be part of a fast growing business, loved by an international base of clients

_Closing date:_ 27th April, 2017

_We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status._

items.title: Full Stack Web Developer for Established Music Startup
items.content:
Location: Chiswick, London, England. You must be legally allowed to work in the United Kingdom to apply. No telecommute or relocation offered. Start ASAP. NO AGENCIES PLEASE.

WhoSampled is the world's leading destination for fans of sample-based music, cover songs and remixes. The company is at an exciting stage of rapid growth, with major new products and partnerships in the pipeline.

The Role
We’re looking for a full stack web developer with between 2-5 years of professional experience. You will take on a central role in developing our products, with input into product management. This is your chance to focus on the fun part: writing beautiful front-end and back-end code for a music service that is enjoyed by millions around the world. Our small team is based in a unique and gorgeous office space in Chiswick.

Candidate Profile
• Passionate about coding beautiful, high performance web and mobile products
• Enthusiastic, dedicated, shows initiative and takes responsibility
• Demonstrates a can-do approach: no task is too large or small
• Fast moving and efficient with a great attention to detail
• Comfortable working in a flexible environment within a small team
• Big music fan like everyone else around here!

Required Experience
• Agile web development, ideally using Django and Python
• Deep understanding of JavaScript and how modern browsers work
• HTML5, CSS and preprocessors (ideally Stylus), responsive web design
• Relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred) and SQL
• Linux server administration and experience with shell scripting
Desirable Skills / Exposure
• E-Commerce
• Growth hacking and SEO
• Machine learning
• Digital signal processing
• Elasticsearch
• Redis
• Nginx
• Varnish or any other HTTP accelerator
• Docker

How to Apply
To apply, please send examples of previous work (websites, apps, Stack Overflow and Github profiles) along with your CV and any further supporting information. Please also state the top 3 music artists and/or albums you're currently into.

items.title: PHP Web Developer
items.content:
We’re looking for a bright and ambitious PHP web developer to join our growing team in London.

The role involves working as part of a dynamic, high-achieving team to achieve key digital business goals for our expansive lost of clients. You will be expected to communicate well with your fellow developers both in the studio in Kentish Town and those we work with remotely. You will also be working closely with design and marketing experts, so conversation and communication is key.

This is a wonderful opportunity to work with a London-based agency on projects from around the world and in various industries. The fast-paced nature of our work accommodates and nurtures even the most ambitious personal growth goals.

Our key requirements

- Working with our designers, developers and clients to bring their visions to reality
- Following and inputting to client technical specification documents
- Working with our project managers to plan ahead, set deadlines and deliver on time

Essential skills
- A knowledge of web application development and experience using object-orientated PHP 5

- Creating, working with and integrating APIs

- Basic Linux/Unix command line tools
- PHP unit testing
- Some digital marketing/SEO knowledge
- Java web/mobile development

items.title: Full Stack Developer - InsurTech IoT
items.content:
Concirrus creates revolutionary software products that are disrupting and transforming the Insurance industry. We are entering an exciting period of growth and are looking to hire a Full Stack Developer to focus on solutions for Motor Insurance.

Our company is growing, grow with us.

The role:

Joining a growing team in the London office the right candidates will be able to take leadership of key areas within the development of these disruptive systems. This opportunity will take a significant role in architectural design and technology choices.

The candidate:

We're looking for an individual who recognises that writing tests is not something you do after writing code. You believe that doing something twice is enough of a reason to script it for next time. You have experience in a range of new technologies through your current role but have also researched and engaged other new technologies in your own time because coding matters and to make the right decisions you need to be informed.

The projects:

We are working on a selection of exciting projects including an Internet of Things platform. Working closely with our growing team in London as well as our colleagues in India, you will be involved in supplying disruptive technology solutions to a range of industries.

Skills & Requirements

The important skills:

At least 3 years of solid commercial development experience
Proficient understanding of how web applications work. Strong coding skills combined with comprehension of responsive design, databases, API, security, UI/UX.
Understanding of different database technologies (MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra)
Proficient in coding across various languages (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, PHP, SQL)

Web services (REST, SOAP)

items.title: Junior Frontend Developer
items.content:
iwoca is building the tech-enabled future of small business finance and we want to make it beautiful.
That’s why we’re looking for a talented Front-End Developer to join our team. You’ll be working closely with both tech and product to build pixel-perfect UIs, marketing pages, email templates and more. The perfect candidate is fluent in web technologies and passionate about building great user experiences.

*What does the role involve?*
* Taking the lead in coding up the next version of our public website, having given input on the design and structure
* Working closely with the rest of the team to build intuitive interfaces for our signup process and account pages
* Producing engaging emails and marketing pages to the same high standards
* Helping to define the overall structure of our front-end code and ensuring our HTML and CSS is squeaky clean across the company
* Working end-to-end on features and having a customer centric attitude – we’re looking for someone who has great ideas on design and UX, not just coding

*Our tech and tech:*
There are just over 130 people at iwoca, almost all based in our London office. Our front-end team is a diverse group of four, and collectively speak seven languages: English, 'Northern', Russian, Latvian, Italian, Spanish and Javascript. Front-end sits within our Tech and Analytics team but also works closely with a growing product function.
We run our Django-powered site on AWS. Our customer facing application process is built using React and Redux and we use AngularJS for our internal product. Our development cycle is tight with Agile-ish processes that means features or projects go live in days or weeks, not months

*Our ideal candidate:*
* Is an expert in HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript. You should be very comfortably building fast, responsive sites with animation
* Has at least 1 - 3 years experience, ideally including on a SaaS product
* Gets a buzz from creating products that customers love
* Has a eye for design
* Is comfortable using Photoshop, Sketch or similar
* Sweats the details, ensuring that typos don’t make it into production, browser testing is conducted diligently and customers never see a 404 page

*Benefits*
You will always have a say in the business and have the opportunity to really make a difference. Joining our team means you will be working with some cool tech and get the opportunity to really make a difference to people’s lives. We also help all our employees become top performers and reward everyone in numerous different ways. Everyone at iwoca is smart, humble and motivated to do a good job so you are bound to love working here. We also have the following to all our employees:
* Pool and Ping Pong tables
* Great development programmes (paid conferences around Europe)
* Plenty of space to chill out
* Plenty of drinks and snack (healthy and unhealthy)
* Subsidised gym membership and restaurant discounts in Soho
* Cycle2Work scheme for great value bikes
* Various sports teams including football and climbing
* A super smart team of really nice people
* Company retreats to great destinations
* Ability to work from home occasionally

If you are interested in applying please send us your CV along with a cover letter. Make sure to include examples of any of your previous work and feel free to include a link to your Dribble page, Github profile or similar. Please also send us links to 2 - 3 websites that you love with a few lines explaining why you think they’re great examples of web design.

items.title: Backend Developer
items.content:
*Why iwoca?*

A flexible cash flow is critical to the success of any small or mid-sized business. Traditionally, banks have neglected the millions of European SMEs because their processes have been too slow, rigid and costly to serve them effectively. By using cutting-edge technology and harnessing more data, iwoca is rapidly reinventing business finance, developing new ways to provide fast and flexible access to credit, enabling our customers to flourish.

Chris and James launched iwoca in 2012; since then we’ve made tens of thousands of credit decisions and lent over £150m to ten thousand SMEs across UK, Poland, Germany and Spain. Along the way we built a high-tech platform from scratch, won numerous awards and grown a highly cosmopolitan, fun and vibrant team of 130 people based in London. We represent a diverse range of backgrounds and we’re united in our mission to make business finance simple, seamless, and powerful.

We’ve come a long way in the last five years, and yet are just at the start of a journey that promises many more exciting times ahead. We recently closed a £46m funding round, giving us the firepower to accelerate our development. To drive this growth we’re looking for people who are smart, motivated and humble, who want to develop themselves and push the boundaries of their own performance while building a business we can all be really proud of.


*About the role:*

At iwoca we are dedicated to building the smartest lending platform in the world as we believe that finance should be as simple, seamless and powerful as electricity. We like to work to an Agile-ish processes, which means features or projects go live in days or weeks rather than months or years.

We are very fortunate to have a passionate and dedicated CTO / Co-founder who ensures that Tech is always at the forefront of the business so the work you do is always valued. You could be doing anything from working on our REST API, asynchronous processing, automated testing patterns or contributing to our underwriting tools.
We could include a load of technical acronyms here and tell you about all the greenfield projects you could be working on, but ultimately it is important for you to know that the environment here is always exciting, challenging and fast-paced. We believe in investing in research to find the best possible outcome.

Therefore we are looking for passionate developers with an eagerness to work in a collaborative environment to build an awesome product that will help SME’s across the world.

We run our Django-powered site on AWS, use asynchronous tools (Twisted, Celery) for time-consuming tasks and scientific libraries (numpy, scipy, pandas) for risk aspects. Application orchestration is done with Docker and Ansible and our monitoring is set up using StatsD, Elasticsearch-Logstash-Kibana.

*We are looking for someone with:*

* Experience developing in Python (we use Python)*
* Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (ideally MongoDB and PostgreSQL)
* Knowledge of web frameworks (we use Django)
* Demonstrable experience creating robust, clever and scalable applications
* Experience doing it all: designing, developing, testing, deploying and maintaining
* Ability to manage projects, priorities, deadlines and deliverables (being autonomous is extremely important for us)

If you don’t know Python but are familiar with programming languages like Erlang, Haskell, Scala, Lisp, Clojure, or F#, we would still be keen to hear from you.

items.title: Junior Full Stack Developer - Full Time / Internship
items.content:
Hello from Team Switched,

Switched Energy automates the switching between energy providers, taking the hassle away from switching whilst ensuring our customers are on the best energy deal for the rest of their life. We’ve recently completed our first round of fund raising and are looking to bring on a junior developer, someone with (or about to complete) an excellent degree in computer science or related field.

The two co-founders of Switched are ex Newton Europe consultants (Cambridge and Durham alumni) with a great deal of experience and expertise in data analysis and operations. As well as programming, we are looking to involved the successful applicant in board meetings, business strategy decisions and brainstorms with our aim to up skill them as much as possible in business strategy and operations from our combined 8 years experience.

The third member and part-time CTO of Switched gained a first-class degree from Cambridge University in Computer Science. Though not full time, this individual is part of the business to provide technical mentorship, working alongside the successful applicant one a day a fortnight. We aim to offer a great deal of mentorship and development in this role and would love to discuss how we can tailor this to your career goals.

We'd ideally like a successful applicant to start in May and expect the role to last at least a year. However we can be flexible if we find the right person who is looking for a shorter term contract such as a summer internship or 6 month placement. All things going well, we would like to develop this person into the future CTO of our business with significant pay progression as our business scales. Our salary also comes with shares in the business.

The office is based in Paddington where we would ideally meet candidates for interview (Skype can also be arranged). We hope to find someone as passionate as we are about creating a disruptive tech business. We look forward to hearing from you.

All the best,
Team Switched (Tom and Llewellyn)

items.content:
We are a global organisation head-quartered in London and looking for a superstar Junior developer to join our friendly and energetic development team.

We are building a first of it’s kind online and offline social and professional network building connecting individuals and organisations across from the world to business, career and partnership opportunities with an initial focus on Africa! Think of a cross between Facebook, Linkedin and Tinder!

As we expand our service, we are adopting the very latest in development methodology, design, big data and intelligent computing to solve some of the world’s largest unsolved problems around connecting people and forming meaningful connections for mutual and broader macro-economic benefit.

Our multicultural and highly-motivated team is spread across four continents. You will be working alongside a talented, Agile development team in a relaxed creative environment, where you will be actively encouraged and supported to lead large areas of work beyond your years, exploit new technologies and approaches, and to follow your passions.

In summary we offer creative work with fresh, juicy technologies! We think fast, change fast and learn fast with a mission to positively shape the world by driving social and economic development in the places that need it most! You can be part of this movement!

**Role description:**

* You will develop front-end web and mobile services for our cross-platform application
* You will be involved in the full development lifecycle, from whiteboard to UI/UX wireframe to architecture and high-quality code
* You will be responsible for ensuring feasibility of UI/UX designs across browsers and device compatibility using the best RWD principles
* You will work with the latest web and mobile front-end technologies including: AngularJS, Ionic, NodeJS, Gulp, Bower, React
* You will also work closely with our back-end development team, interfacing via RESTful APIs
* You will play an integral part in building new front-end architecture and introduce improvements to existing solutions to deliver an attractive and engaging user experience
* You will also build UI for innovative internal tools and applications; e.g.tools to visualise big data analyses and manage complex workflows.
* You will have the opportunity to take ownership of our high-traffic, public-facing live website environment
* You will work directly with the founders and be involved in shaping current and future projects from a technical, functional and business perspective to make global impact

**Are you the one?**


**_Must-haves:_**
* Demonstrable experience with basic web development using HTML/CSS/JS and front-end frameworks such as Bootstrap / JQuery
* Basic knowledge of client-server protocol architecture
* High and obsessive attention to detail and quality with a strong eye for design
* Passionate about design, pixel perfect UI, interest in latest UX principles and practices and always willing to push the boundaries
* A problem-solver enthusiast, do'er and fixer
* Strong work ethic, solid team-worker /communicator and capable of setting own tasks and direction
* Passion for learning and keeping up-to-date with the latest technologies and industry trends
* Team player, keen to share knowledge and constantly improve


**_Desirables_**
* Experience with AngularJS
* Experience in working with RESTful API systems
* Experience managing front-end projects with: npm, Gulp/Grunt, Bower
* Experience with Cordova / ionic mobile development mobile development or native iOS/Android
* Awareness of new technologies like React and Angular2
* Creative approach for creating beautiful interactive and user-centred experience design
* Experience in improving and enhancing UX across mobile, tablet, desktop


**What do we offer:**
* Exposure to the latest mobile, web and back-end technologies
* A fantastic and supportive learning environment with access to senior developers to coach and mentor you
* Opportunity to deliver products which will have a big impact on the business and projects with global level impact
* Fast paced, entrepreneurial environment with various on-going projects spanning a number of continents
* An open and progressive environment where input is encouraged from everyone at all levels
* Opportunity to pursue areas of passion, develop your skills and CV
* Opportunity for direct mentorship and strong references / contacts from well-connected founder entrepreneurs with influential corporate backgrounds
* Opportunity to very quickly become a lead front-end developer to manage aspects of front-end development across Europe and Africa
* Fantastic office location in the heart of London

items.title: Junior Full-Stack Developer
items.content:
THE COMPANY
weseethrough is a tech-driven market research startup. We’re less than two years old, and we’ve already won large contracts from big-name clients like Unilever and we won the 2015 MRS award for innovation in research methodology. Business is booming.

We help our clients understand their consumers’ real behaviour: how they use their products, how they interact with advertising, how they perceive brands. Traditionally this has been done through surveys and focus groups, or sending researchers to participants’ homes as they use cleaning or food products etc. These approaches have major drawbacks:

Reported behaviour and actual behaviour can be very different. People might claim they only add one teaspoonful of salt, but they actually add three… or they think they take 20 minutes to clean a room, but actually take 40.

Sending a researcher to observe someone in their homes as they use a product is expensive, and it’s hard to get participants to relax and act naturally when there’s a stranger watching them!
We address these issues by giving participants wearable devices like Google Glass or GoPro to wear as they perform activities like cooking or cleaning. We use these devices to record hundreds of hours of first-person video. We then use our Haystack platform to find the 0.1% of the footage that’s insightful: the moments which help our clients better understand their customers.

We’ve conducted these studies in >20 countries across five continents; from Tokyo to Lagos to Moscow to Milan. To give an example, we had a client in Brazil who wanted to understand why their recently-launched house cleaning products were not selling well. To investigate, we got participants to clean their homes with Google Glass. As well as recording video and audio, our custom Glass software posed pre-recorded Portuguese interview questions as they went around their homes, using proximity beacons in each room to ask the right questions at the right time. We were able to use the recordings to write a report for a client giving deep insights into common behaviours, and a few quirks you wouldn’t think to ask about, like participants throwing buckets of undiluted bleach over their floors without moving furniture out of the way!
A more detailed example in this case study.

OUR PLATFORM
Our platform is all about how to mine video from market research studies for interesting, insightful content. Other platforms focus on interview videos, where someone describes their experiences with a product or service – as such, such platforms focus on transcribing the video.
Rather than reported behaviour from interviews, we focus on consumers’ actual behaviour using GoPros on chest- or headstraps, Google Glass, movement sensors, eye tracking glasses, and other biometric sensors. Like our competitors, we subtitle videos, but that’s not enough to understand participants’ behaviour. So our platform allows us to mark things that *happen* in the videos, like a stock cube being chopped in half or two cleaning products being mixed together, and things like the products that are seen on screen.
Much of our video analysis is done by the crowd at present – a key technical challenge for us is how to best leverage recent leaps and bounds in machine vision to automate video tagging.

THE ROLE
The role is twofold:

1. Devops.
Our platform is split between:
A pair of dedicated Linux servers (prod + test), running node.js, a lot of batch video processing with ffmpeg, and a bit of data in Redis
AWS
Also, often when we receive a lot of videos from a client for processing, the project managers need a helping hand organising it.

2. Full-stack dev and fix.
We’re looking to incrementally rewrite our platform, which currently uses Angular 1.3 and node.js. We have a variety of user types (end clients, researchers, crowd video taggers and transcribers, project managers, video uploaders…) that we want to migrate to a new platform we’re starting to build with ReactJS, one user type at a time. We’re going to have a relatively protracted transition period where both run in parallel, so part of the role will be about patching up the old, part of it will be about creating the new.

CULTURE

We’re a small startup, and it’s crucial that you’re comfortable with all that that means!
You’ll have a lot of responsibility early on, and if you do a good job you’ll see a real difference to how the company is doing.

We’re likely to ask you to go outside your comfort zone and perform tasks outside a narrow reading of your job specification.

Lateral thinking and problem solving for unfamiliar tasks are hugely valued here.
There’s no room for big egos here! In large companies, it’s possible for an individual to do well as the company flounders – here, we all make a success of the company, or… we don’t.
We want someone who is hungry to work in a startup in general, and our company in particular. Startups have a very different culture from large corporates and you should have a clear idea of this going in, even if you’ve not worked for a startup before.

REQUIRED SKILLSET
Linux system administration (we use Ubuntu)
HTML & CSS
Angular 1.x or React or both
ES5
Deep understanding of Chrome developer tools

NICE TO HAVE (can learn on the job)
ES2015 / ES6+
node.js
AWS – currently we use S3, CloudFront, EC2; may start using Elastic Transcoder and others in future
Build automation tooling (we’re using Bamboo)
git
Redis
ffmpeg / video processing
JIRA
Performance test experience

items.title: Front-end UI Web Developer (45,000-75,000)
items.content:
*This London based In-house role is waiting to be filled and started ASAP! So please get in touch!*

*What we do:*

After the rise of Uber and Lyft, it's easy to say the way we travel has changed quite a lot. We no longer have to wait and wonder who our taxi driver is or when they'll come to take us away!

However, a large portion of travellers, who spend a little bit more on security, safety and comfort, travelling all over the world for meetings, parties and even more important things to do - haven't benefited from the new way in which we now travel!

Whether it's a ride to the airport or to the office - we’re here to build on solid experienced foundations, an amazing network and great funding to further progress Affordable, Luxury Rides!

*Who we want:*

This is pretty much a greenfield project!

As you can see from our previous website, there's a lot to do. However, we’ve got most of the back-end sorted out! And now all we need is an amazing self-starting Web-Developer to unlock it's potential. We’re looking for a top-tier experienced professional with at least 2 years experience in web development and design, who is hungry, creative and ready for a hands on and fulfilling role. If you're interested in being part of a great challenge and passionate about voicing your opinion - this is all you.

*You are*, what N'golo Kante was to Leicester. Or at least…

* A baller in – HTML 5, CSS 3, Javascript, Angular
* Great at designing creating and coming up with creative solutions
* Comfortable with understanding the user flow and experience
* Finessed with PHP & MySQL
* Great experience of both UX/UI
* Some experience with design
* Hungry and not shy to learn and improve languages
* We're not clock-watchers, but we need someone who's not afraid of failure yet still obsessed and pushing themselves to do to achieve what it takes to get there!
* Someone who values above all having a voice and real impact where they work - "autonomy" 0_o

*Not required but great:*

* React
* Swift (if you want to get involved with the app)
* Back-end experience
* Knowledge of good restaurants, we tend to eat out somewhere fancy every now and then

If your up for working in a small team, having lots of control and ready to push yourself beyond what you know get in touch. We want to meet you *immediately and for you to start as soon as possible*. There’s no fixed term for this project, so if you’re looking for either short-term or long-term let us know! We're also offering a competitive salary of up to 45-75K dependant on experience and ambition!

If any of this sounds interesting, feel free to click on our 'website link'

items.title: Backend Python Engineer
items.content:
*CHECKRECIPIENT*

CheckRecipient uses advanced machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) to make it impossible for sensitive information to end up in the wrong hands. We protect enterprise networks against new and intelligent cyber threats by preventing breaches in real-time.

Founded by a team of Imperial College engineers, we’re backed by some of the world’s leading technology investors. We work with international clients in the financial, legal and professional services sectors who trust us to find the most intelligent ways to keep their data secure.

*CHECKRECIPIENT’S RECENT AWARDS*

Winner – WIRED Security 2016 Best Startup Award
Winner – LegalGeek Best Machine Intelligence Startup 2016
Winner – Info Security Product Guide’s Global Excellence Awards 2017 for the Best Security Startup

*ENGINEERING AT CHECKRECIPIENT*

Dealing with massive datasets at scale requires ingenuity and strong analytical skills. We build quickly and follow both agile and continuous delivery paradigms.

As a member of the CheckRecipient engineering team, you will have the autonomy to work on your own projects, and be a part of our regular round tables to bounce ideas around as a team. We believe in regular and continuous development and we will seek to create opportunities for you to evolve. You will work closely with our data science team building out new threat modules as well as re-architecting our application into microservices allowing us to scale horizontally.

Here are some of the technologies we’re working with / interested in:

* Python, Go, Ruby
* Kubernetes, Rancher, Docker
* Kafka
* Postgres, DynamoDB, Cassandra
* Redshift, Spark, AWS, Microservices architecture

*REQUIREMENTS*

You should apply if you:

* are a great problem solver who takes pride in their work
* are comfortable with the unknown and love to experiment
* can construct good arguments for methodologies or practices
* have a passion for learning new skills and technologies
* have good knowledge of Python (but ideally you’re language agnostic and will use the best tool for the job)
* are interested in working on a microservices architecture

*BENEFITS*

* Competitive salary and meaningful equity options
* Choose your own kit
* Central London office location
* Regular team socials and activities

We look forward to hearing from you!

*Important Notices:*

-We do not accept applications or résumés from 3rd party recruiters.
-We are currently unable to sponsor applicants who do not have a right to work in the UK

items.title: Engineers in Edinburgh
items.content:
# TRAVELNEST

## Us (The Company)

Travel Nest is a two year old startup in the Travel sector with a recently closed funding round that will give us the platform to launch our business internationally.


## US (The Blurb)

We’re looking to build a team to grow with us as we aim to develop the leading SAAS platform in our sector. We believe in a bottom up approach to management and giving our teams ownership of the way they work. Travel Nest is ideal for self motivated individuals looking to work in a fast paced environment with young tech focused colleagues.


## The Role

We are recruiting a whole new tech team under our CTO.

We purposefully haven't set a level of senior/junior or X years experience. We want developers/engineers/testers who buck that trend and who are defined on their own terms. We are hiring a team that have complimentary skills, not cookie cutter clones. So if you rock API design but don't do front-end? Thats awesome. Alternatively do you love end-to-end full stack development? Brilliant.

We're holding back on finalising some of our technology choices to ensure that we're setting the team up for success. Your opinion, skill set, knowledge and desire will be taken into account to ensure we create an environment where you will thrive.



## You (The Person)

* You understand that personality is more important than technical skills.
* You care about Quality, not just the end product.
* You are comfortable saying No, and explaining why.
* You are comfortable hearing No, and the explanation why.
* You are comfortable asking why.
* You want to be challenged.
* You are a really nice person.



## You (Requirements)

* You will write maintainable code, tests and documentation.
* You are capable of building robust web applications using n-tier architecture and/or micro-services.
* You have API experience, including integration and RESTful API design
* You understand server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Rails, Django, Synfony, Laravel etc)
* You are able to dig deep into business requirements and having a sense of ownership over your work
* You have a desire to learn and share new practices
* Mocking out a database design doesn't scare you.
* You have a good understanding of securing your application and API end points.
* You have good debugging skills - within IDEs, testing, and the browser.
* You follow a TDD approach, and understand the importance of automated testing
* You are happy using Rapid Application Development to get CRUD PoC's in front of the team quickly.
* You are comfortable with the basics of version control (e.g. Git)



## You (Bonus Points)

* You are comfortable with the use of task runners and automation.
* You feel comfortable with package managers.
* You have an opinion on tech trends.
* You have worked in a single-team environment before.
* You understand Open Source technologies and are an active participant in the Open Source community
* You have a broad interest and knowledge of multiple programming languages
* You don't think that any one JavaScript framework is going to save the world.
* You are comfortable in an Agile/Lean/Scrum/Kanban process
* You have come across virtualization technology (e.g. VMWare, Docker, Vagrant)
* You have come across software build and test solutions (e.g. Jenkins, Travis, Bamboo, TeamCity, CircleCI)
* You have experience in a startup environment


## Next Steps

No surprise here, we want to see your CV.

We'd also love to get a better idea of who you are by seeing your LinkedIn, personal website, GitHub (or equivalent), links to any cool work you're proud of. Feel free to share social accounts if it's relevant, but no worries if it's not.

A cover letter also goes a long way!

We'll be collecting CVs throughout March, and contacting people to start the rolling interview process weekly. There will be 3 rounds of interviews starting with phone/skype/hangouts.


## Recruiters

Thanks but no thanks. Seriously though, NO!
Any CV received will not be treated as an introduction.

items.title: Go(lang) / JavaScript Fullstack Engineer - Campaign Technology
items.content:
Go(lang) / JavaScript Fullstack Engineer - Campaign Technology

JustWatch is an international movie marketing startup based in Berlin. Founded in October 2014 by an experienced and successful team with world-class knowledge in marketing, product and AdTech we are constantly looking for passionate people to join our mission.

JustWatch offers data-driven movie marketing for the film industry. Based on user data from justwatch.com and our apps - by now the largest streaming search engine worldwide - we run data-driven digital marketing campaigns for Hollywood’s latest blockbusters as well as for independent movies.
Who we are looking for:

Curiosity, drive and passion are shared characteristics of all people at JustWatch and we are looking for these values in every person we are hiring. We only want people who are willing to constantly learn through challenging themselves and others. All of us also love to get things done and strongly believe in “done is better than perfect”. Dedication to software craftsmanship and a drive for elegant and simple solutions come in a close second.
In addition, for this particular role we are looking for:

Smart people with a desire to ship
All skill levels: Senior / Junior / Working Student / Trainee
At least a few months of deep familiarity of the Go(lang) language and solid JavaScript chops
Skills around the linux command line including basic networking and web technologies
Experience with some SQL data stores, preferably PostgreSQL
Familiarity with a modern Frontend development workflow, preferably with AngularJS
Solid code craftsmanship including great communication and writing code to be read by others
A practical view towards technology, sensibly choosing between cutting-edge tech and stable, boring solutions
Fluent in English, ability to work onsite in Berlin

Your responsibilities:

You will advance our internal campaign management systems, working directly with the people using it every day to make them more productive
You’re motivated more by results than technology, as some part of the job isn’t the shiniest tech in town - but you get a kick from working fast, with a lot of responsibility and together with some really smart colleagues on one of the most important topics in our company
You do care about clean craft, good tooling, metrics though to fit your solutions into our 12factor Kubernetes stack, deploying it with ChatOps, which is fun
You like wrangling data from all kinds of sources - JSON / CSV / ProtoBuf / REST / SOAP -> you’ve seen and debugged through your share of dirty and unreliable third party data
You have an eye for simplicity and constantly try to make complex things happening in the background easy and approachable to users, baking them into readable code
You will help design data models and schemas and can deal with modern SQL (CTEs, constraints, transactions)
You will excel in an international and internationalized environment, caring for the needs of all our internal users in Berlin and Los Angeles

Our promise:

You will become part of a passionate, professional and friendly team while getting first-hand experience in building a world-leading tech company
A steep learning curve: You will work directly with and learn from Dominik and his team who are leading experts in campaign technology, data orchestration and internal software engineering.
A challenging environment with an open feedback culture and a strong focus on personal development
Lots of room for personal development, freedom and responsibility
You will have access to an experienced founder team with an international track record in building successful tech companies

Sounds like you? Great, we’d like to meet you. Just send us a short mail that gives us an idea of what motivates you, why you want to work at JustWatch and how you think you will help us to achieve our goals. We are not interested in a perfect CV, or letters of recommendation. We just want to know who you are and who you want to become!
