items.title: Lead Full Stack Developer
items.content:
_Full stack engineers at Live Better With use combined skills to create & connect systems to deliver amazing customer experiences_

*Our Mission*
At Live Better With we are on a mission to make day-to-day life a little better for the 300m+ people across the world living with long term conditions. Our current focus is Cancer and we connect cancer patients with curated products and services recommended by patients, families, healthcare professionals, charities and our 30,000+ community to address the side effects and symptoms that reduce the quality of their day to day lives. Find us at https://livebetterwith.com/

We are well funded, operating in both in the US (New York) & the UK, scaling rapidly and we are looking for talented developers to join our expanding technology team. This is an opportunity for an ambitious candidate to make a big impact on our business, playing a leading role in technology to help shape the future of our products, services and customer experience to make a difference to the lives of millions of people around the world.


*You'll work on*
Projects spanning end-to-end systems and technologies, designing, testing and shipping high-quality code every day so that we continue to iterate and improve quickly. You’ll build the tools, integrations, processes, automation and experiences that underpin our platform and make our consumer and community experiences truly personalised, user-focused & world-class.


*You may be a good fit if you:*

* Enjoy working on both the frontend, backend and doing whatever it takes to get things done

* You are customer focused, enjoy solve problems and creating solutions that delight internal & external users and you’re hungry to grow with the role as the company expands

* Have good experience in Python & Django. We’ll consider strong candidates with good experience in other languages if you’re enthusiastic about learning Python.

* Are comfortable playing a leading role in a technology team with both frontend and backend developers

* Are comfortable working in an Agile development environment using continuous integration. We use Circle CI for continuous integration.

* Care about producing and shipping high-quality code, using best practices. You’re either using or keen to start using TDD and understand the importance of automated testing.

* Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders from across the business including product, design, marketing, operations and fulfilment to build mission critical features that power the platform

* Enjoy being part of a team and having fun!


*You’ll stand out if you have experience in:*
* Experience in React / modern front-end and JS frameworks
* Experience in Native mobile development (Android/iOS), scaling system architecture & machine learning
* Knowledge of a functional language such as Haskell, Erlang or Clojure
* You have an eye for user interface & interaction design
* You’ve working in a fast-growing startup, interacting with both technical and non-technical teams
* You’ve made Open source contributions


*Our Technology Stack*
* Python, React.js
* Django Oscar & Postgres
* ElasticSearch
* AWS, AWS Code deploy
* Docker, Ansible or other configuration management tools
* Circle CI for Continuous Integration
* New Relic & Sentry monitoring

We continually evaluate different languages and frameworks for new services and as part of our R&D.

*Benefits*
* Very competitive salary and options dependent on experience
* Join a growing, dynamic, motivated and fun team, where everyone is valued and really want to help people
* Make a big impact in a unique company
* Breakfast & team Pizza!
* Team social events (lunches, drinks after work, team outings)
* We’re modern and use modern SaaS tools! (Slack, CharlieHR, Google Apps)

*Location: Kings Cross, London, UK*

Website - https://livebetterwith.com/
FB - https://www.facebook.com/livebetterwith/

In the news:
Live Better With in Silicon Valley - http://bit.ly/291JzhA
Live Better With Top 100 Startups - http://bit.ly/291Kbnj

items.title: Back-End Developer
items.content:
We are looking for an mid level Back End/Server side Developer to join and lead our small team as one of our first engineering hires. Working alongisde our Front End Developer, you will be hands on within the technology and working towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges we face.

ABOUT STAFFABLY
Staffably is a platform designed to reduce the inefficiencies caused by job boards and agencies, by putting teachers directly in touch with schools and vice versa, providing transparency, efficiency and cost savings. We are changing the way schools are staffed by applying the latest technology and thinking to a keenly felt problem. Our web (and soon mobile) apps are used by teachers to create their profiles, set their preferences and apply for jobs that match their needs. Schools can create their profiles, have access to all the profiles of teachers on the platform, post employment opportunities and get in touch with teachers directly.

THE ROLE
We are looking for an experienced Back-End Developer to work alongside our Front End Developer. Your background will include:

A graduate with a solid understanding of Computer Science principles
Experience of developing fully featured web application servers
A good understanding of authentication in modern web applications
We would also be interested in someone with a Python, PHP, Ruby, Java or similar background who has experience in an equivalent web application framework and is interested in crossing over to NodeJS and Express
Experience or an interest in maintaining a good software development process, and making good use of automated build tools
Building RESTful APIs and exposing endpoints to be consumed by clients
Experience of working with relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL. Some experience or interest in schema design and maintenance.
Comfortable in operating within the AWS cloud environment with the ability to create, maintain and backup both EC2 compute and RDS database instances
Some experience or an interest in using the AWS SDK would be desirable
An interest or experience in monitoring, logging, and metrics, with a view to keeping the company's platform operational and performing well

SKILLS REQUIRED

NodeJS and Express experience
At least 3 years of development experience
Strong skills around back-end development
Someone with side-project interests or an active GitHub profile would be highly desirable
An interest in software engineering best practices, including version control and backup strategies
A desire to gain experience and develop your career in an agile, vibrant startup environment
A self-starter who's happy to absorb unfamiliar technologies and keen to refine their skillset
Someone who can operate with a degree of autonomy and organise their tasks, but keep an eye on the bigger picture.
A good communicator who's keen to be an active participant in the development and success of the Business.
Suited to an Agile environment. The ability to maintain team velocity while adapting to changeable business requirements.


We are a team of awesome people based in central london. Join us and be challenged on a daily basis, while having fun and solving the hardest problems with a hint of social good.

NO CONTRACTORS OR RECRUITERS PLEASE

items.title: Full stack Javascript developer
items.content:
We’re a startup based about to move in to the Alphabeta Building in Shoreditch, London. There are seven people working here. You would be numero eight. But we pack a punch, and with the background, skills and experience of the team, we’re taking on a big challenge: the ‘Housing Crisis’.

We believe that by using technology to crack open the land market like the claws of a prize winning lobster, we’re in the process of making a big business that will uncover the places on which more houses can be built, by a wider range of people. This vision is backed the same investors behind Love Film, TransferWise, Zoopla, Shazaam and Property Partner. Real issues, real tech, underpinned by a real economic opportunity.

We hold it in high importance to build a team. In working for us you’ll be in constant contact with the company founders, so you’ll be in environment where you can learn about the conception of and running of a startup company that is scaling up. More so, you’ll be invited into the vision. Goalposts move all the time, we need help from other bright people that can build on the firm foundations we’ve put in place. This isn’t the average tech role, this is a problem solving role. Adopt our (proverbial) child, and help to mould and grow it. In return, we’ll stretch you and give you the space to thrive.

*So who do we expect you to be?*
* You want to understand a start-up business, the challenges and be proactive in coming up with solutions
* You can work independently to get a project completed, working on all parts of the stack.
* You want to help us make a big business and own part of it

*Responsibilities*
* Plan. We work in an agile way, planning work in fortnightly sprints.
* Build. Build exciting new features based on our unique big property datasets. Create maps and slick interfaces to delight customers.
* Test. Be part of the team, test your own work and help others to ship quality code.
* Learn. We measure and learn from new features that are built.
* Support. We all support the sales team and customer support - goes without saying.
* Organise. Help organise 100 million+ property records so we can build the best property data platform.

*Skills*
* Javascript, front-end frameworks such as Angular, React, Vue
* Node.js & MongoDB
* HTML/CSS
* Test driven Development, unit tests
* Knowledge of git
* Excellent communication skills

*Bonus Points for*
* AWS experience – EB, EC2, SQS, S3.
* Strong knowledge of SQL, relational database experience
* Understanding of ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) data processes
* A computing related degree
* Knowledge of GIS, PostGIS, location based apps
* Knowledge of the property sector

*What we offer*
* A competitive salary
* Equity
* A fun, flexible and friendly working environment
* 25 holiday days per year
* The chance to tackle a problem that has deep social consequences

items.title: Senior Front End Developer
items.content:
ABOUT US
Want to work for one of the UK’s hottest FinTech companies?
MarketInvoice is shaking up the world of business finance. We help ambitious companies grow by providing funding when they need it most, instead of waiting up to 90 days for their customers to pay invoices.
We've funded against over £1 billion worth of invoices, helping thousands of businesses across the country to achieve their goals. Our platform provides a slick user experience and integrates with all the leading accounting software packages, so it's never been easier for businesses to take control of their cash flow.
At MarketInvoice you’ll be solving real life business problems, working with a team of smart and dedicated people. It’s a fast paced environment but it's also a lot of fun, and we’ll give you the support and training you need to thrive. As the company grows, your role will too.

THE ROLE:
The role is to join our team of full stack engineers but with a particular focus on driving forward our frontend technologies and mentoring other engineers modern javascript frameworks.
You will be working in autonomous teams that have the freedom to drive innovation themselves. We have a strong DevOps culture too and believe CI/CD/Testing are the only ways to innovate at scale. You will add value right away with coding, building, testing, deploying, monitoring.
When we say innovation we mean it; every engineer gets one day, every other week to investigate new technologies, expand their knowledge and prototype new ideas or features.

YOUR TECHNICAL ENVIRONMENT:
You’ll be working on our core platform allowing small business to access funding seamlessly through fantastic UX and automation of complex processing such as risk analysis and payment processing.
Our core platform is built in .Net C# and AngularJS (plus some React) but the choice of technology or language is continually evolving. As a Senior Front End Developer you'll take the lead on our Front End, and whilst there are no management responsibilities we would ideally like to see you mentor more junior developers.

REQUIREMENTS
Significant experience with Javascript frameworks such as Angular.js, or React required.
Experience working with C#, ASP .NET MVC
People person. You are energised by a high amount of contact with a wide range of people. You value diversity and are sensitive to different environments & cultures.
Experience mentoring more junior developers
Team ethic. You make change happen by working with & through others.
Can do” attitude - when faced with a business or technical obstacle you will not run and hide. You should be able to describe the issues you’ve encountered, your approach to solving them and your final solution.

BENEFITS
Not only will you have the opportunity to make a huge impact at one of the UK's hottest FinTech companies, you will also have access to:
Day off for your birthday.
25 days annual leave per year.
Enhanced maternity leave
Childcare vouchers
Best-in-class options scheme.
Innovation Days.
Private healthcare.
Half-price gym membership.

items.title: Technical Architect
items.content:
*Technical Architect*


_Want the environment of a start-up within a FTSE 75 company? Want to be led by hands-off management?_


Chances are you’ve tried to change supplier for your television, phone, broadband or energy services before.

Did you have a memorable experience as a consumer? We’re here to make it a ‘yes’



We're a high growth technology and retail business. We develop deal comparison SaaS for triple play: TV, Phone and Broadband. It's a complex industry with over 5,000 products, each with several variants - we're here to offer customers the right option.


*Right now, we’re in the midst of some big changes which we want you to be involved in, including:*

* Scaling up our technology teams

* Migration of our new and existing applications to AWS

* Planning and building out our new Omni-channel integration

* Integrating into Dixons Carphone



*What’s it like working here:*

Our Technical Architects report into our awesome Chief Architect – one of the nicest guys you’ll ever meet and someone who really knows his stuff. Working with him and our tech leads, you'll help to create software solutions and be a pro at articulating those ideas to the technology teams.


* We work in a collaborative, Agile team environment on a range of different projects from e-commerce websites, energy switching apps to SaaS enterprise solutions and tools.

* Our Architects work closely with the tech leads of each team, helping to clearly communicate ideas and solutions.

* Our architects can be involved in more than one product at a time.


*Sounds good? You’ll do great here if you:*

* Produce high quality technical documentation.

* Are the type to inspire technical innovation.

* You’re an advocate of best-breed practices including test-driven design, code reviews, continuous integration…..

* You’re a great communicator and can instinctively lead and inspire others.




*If that sounds like you, here's why you'll enjoy working here:*

* We aren't corporate and don't wear suits.

* We're backed by Dixons Carphone , a FTSE 75 company.

* Great team and company-wide events: Escape rooms, hackathons, junkyard golf, bowling, team lunches....

* We promote flexible working.

* Yearly bonus!

* We're hands-off managers

* Staff encouraged to stuff themselves with free fruit, velvet cake and takeaways...

* ... But we have a subsidised gym membership to counter that (we also have a free onsite gym at Acton HQ)



*A few of our awards include:*

- One of Europe's fastest growing technology businesses in the 2013 GP Bullhound Media Momentum Awards.

- We've been awarded the Sunday Times Tech Track 100

- The Deloitte Technology Fast 50 awards for the past three years in a row (2015, 2014 & 2013)

- Innovation in Analytics 2016

items.title: Backend Developer with NodeJS experience
items.content:
Do you want to join a tech startup riding a positive momentum and applying Machine learning in product development? We are currently expanding our technical team to reinforce our market leading position. Do you want to grow professionally and personally in a supportive and open culture? Then join us.

HelloUni is a young team from China, Italy, Spain, Greece and the UK. We are the official provider for the University of Glasgow and Coventry University HelloUni app for marketing and recruiting their prospective applicants. Our vision is to become the ‘go to’ app for anyone who is looking to apply to study abroad.

We are a company with a mission: to make studying abroad easier and more rewarding!

We are revenue generating and currently looking to expand market in China.

Essential:

- Equivalent 2:1 degree or above in Computer Science or related STEM subject.

- Experience using Amazon Web Services (e.g. S3, SNS, DynamoDB, CloudFront, Lambda)

- A good understanding of application layer protocols such as HTTP

- RESTful API development experience

- Experience using relational and nonrelational databases

- A strong will to learn and ability to problem-solve

- Able to work well as part of a team


Desirable:

- Knowledge of Javascript and HTML5

- A good understanding of other application layer protocols such as XMPP, RTMP

- Experienced in NodeJS backend development

- Comfortable using a Linux server and CLi

- Some knowledge about web scraping technology


ICAN Perks:

- Competitive salary and stock options

- Multicultural team, open and honest company culture

- Weekly team lunch/drinks

- Regular knowledge transfer sessions

- Opportunity for international travel

- Office in the heart of Glasgow or London and soon to be China

- Mentored by Microsoft Senior Machine Learning Engineers

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
We’re looking for an experienced full stack developer to join our development team at GrowthIntel to build the only machine learning marketing platform of its kind.
As a developer at GrowthIntel you’ll work on a range of cutting edge tech in a fast paced agile environment. As the 7th member of the dev team, you’ll have a real impact on the business - working on everything from data engineering to DevOps and web app development. You'll be involved in planning work to meet customer requirements which you yourself will have gathered. You'll contribute to the product roadmap and be encouraged to help improve and refine our agile methodology.

*Who are GrowthIntel?*
GrowthIntel is a VC-funded marketing technology company based in London. We’re the only UK company using machine learning and web-crawled data to build a B2B marketing recommendation system. We’re six years old, with a team of 11 people, including six on the development team. We’re a friendly bunch with a broad range of experience - we put emphasis on sharing knowledge and supporting each other in personal growth.

*Our tech*
Area’s you’ll be directly involved in:
* Frontend UI / UX
* Web app development
* DevOps
* Web crawling
* Machine learning systems
* Large scale data processing
Specific Technologies we work with:
* Python (incl. pandas, scikit-learn, flask, luigi)
* Javascript (ReactJS)
* AWS
* Apache Spark
* MySQL
* Elasticsearch

*What we're looking for:*
* 3+ years commercial experience in a dev team working in Python (ideally) or a core enterprise class language (ie C++, C#, Java, Scala)
* Interest and (ideally) commercial experience in other languages (e.g. Javascript) or programming paradigms
* Experience with data modelling - e.g. applications backed by relational databases
* A track record of delivering against business objectives
* First or Upper Second Class Degree in a numerate subject
* Native or fluent English speaker
* Based in / can relocate to London
*It'd be great if you:*
* Have experience with NoSQL databases
* Have independently managed & delivered projects
* Are engaged in the wider tech community (organising/presenting at meetups, tech conferences, contributions to open source)
* Have mentored more junior team members in best software development practice

*Perks*
* Meals, games, outings and parties with the team
* Hack-days every 6 weeks
* Trendy co-working office space in a converted book-binding factory
* Free breakfasts every fortnight
* Free drinks at our all-hands every two weeks
* Health and dental cover

items.title: Front End Lead
items.content:
goHenry is a digital banking solution based in London with a mission to make the next generation of young people better at managing money than the last. We have recently raised £4 million in a Crowdcube campaign making it the most equity raised from the crowd ever. To help with our growth we’re now looking for a Senior Front-End Web Developer to come on our journey with us.

*About the role*

We need an excellent Angular 2 Front-End Technical Lead to join our development team and help shape the future of an exciting, fast growing and dynamic application. Minimum 2/3 years Professional / Practical experience with developing and designing websites is required.

*The successful person will have:*

● Degree in Computer Science or related field
● Excellent knowledge of Angular 2, Typescript, Javascript
● Excellent knowledge of HTML5, CSS, LESS, SASS and Ajax
● Excellent knowledge of Responsive design and development
● Practical experience with JavaScript Libraries and MVC patterns
● Excellent knowledge/awareness of usability, accessibility, cross-browser issues and solutions
● Good knowledge of packages such as Photoshop and Illustrator
● Experience in developing with APIs (SOAP/REST, XML, JSON …)
● Experience of PHP / Back-End technologies is a nice to have
● Experience in WordPress
● Knowledge of GIT or other Source Code control systems

But most importantly, we’re looking for the right person. We are looking for someone who is looking for a challenge and who wants to be part of something special that is growing rapidly.

*We're looking for someone who will...*

• Be imaginative, creative and will have a knack for problem solving
• Be a natural leader: there is opportunity to grow and lead the team
• Have a proactive attitude and be willing to own problems and find solutions
• Be able to think holistically and long term about their code, taking into account future development of the application and scalability etc
• Be able to work with minimal direction, yet also to work in a team environment
• Be passionate about web technologies
• Have a desire be a part of something new, exciting and innovative

items.title: Technology Lead / Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Location: near Birmingham Airport (with UK and overseas travel)
Includes: Benefits – 10% bonus, pension, life assurance and corporate discounts
Salary: to £50k

We are Park-IT; a growing parking software company which works across the UK’s major airports helping to track over 1 million cars a year. Founded in 2014, we are a team of 14 talented and smart individuals reinventing the way operators view their parking assets and giving customers peace of mind whilst they are on holiday.

We’re an innovative and entrepreneurial start-up business with exciting expansion opportunities on the horizon. Backed by our parent company, Holiday Extras a Sunday Times Best Company to work our, Developers across the group have the opportunity to work on exciting challenges in the world of tech, whilst providing a fantastic environment in which to work.

Based at our Birmingham HQ, close to Birmingham Airport, we are looking for a talented Technical Lead to join our team and make a major contribution to our success.

What we’re offering…
You’ll lead our newly formed development team and will be responsible for delivering robust and performant solutions across our platform. You will have the freedom to deliver the best solution for the challenges the business puts in front of you and will be given the resources and time you need to get the job done.

Our stack consists of Javascript, NodeJS (Express), React, Sequelize and MySQL and we will continue to always use the best technologies for the purposes of our work.

Your Responsibilities:
* This is hands-on development role. The Technology Lead will be expected to delve into technical detail and act primarily in a development capacity while making time provisions to carry out necessary team management tasks
* Lead software delivery in a cross-functional team including matrix-organised reports within an agile product delivery environment
* Carry out recruitment for software engineers and maintain high level selection criteria
* Work with the Product Owner to establish a roadmap of concrete deliverables and make sure the roadmap is delivered
* Establish strong relationships with business stakeholders to understand business requirements
* Use best software engineering practices to ensure delivery on team commitments
* Frequently report on team delivery performance to senior management. Be transparent about team challenges and proactively communicate risks to all levels
* Encourage a supportive culture where people are allowed to make mistakes but also learn from them
* Promote the culture of autonomy and responsibility within the delivery team
* Keep strong ties with key senior technology staff in other group businesses and make sure communication is fluent and interactions are managed well and common goals are met
* Responsibility to design and execute of the technical architecture roadmap

What we’re looking for:
* Experience working as a senior software engineer in a technology business
* Strong knowledge of the technical architecture of SaaS applications, real-time data-management systems and software components such as data stores, application middleware, APIs, UIs, distributed caching and messaging
* Strong leadership capability with some exposure to management
* Extensive programming experience, ideally in Javascript/Node.js
* Experience of API design and shipping of HTTP Services.
* Demonstrated experience building highly scalable distributed web applications
* Github profile and (ideally) open source contributions.
* Examples of a pragmatic approach to software delivery, understanding the pros (and cons) of shipping early and often.

Desirable
* Experience with React (including native), Redux, Express, Sequelize, MySQL, AWS, Docker, Convox

items.title: Part-time Tech Lead in Travel Startup
items.content:
*About us:*
Solocal is a start-up embarking on seed funding. We work in an exciting place with a purpose to empower women to gain personal freedom via travelling solo. We are looking for a flexible team player who can think on their feet and want to be a part of our journey.

*The job:*
This is a freelance role, which requires ½ day to 1 day at the beginning. It may require more hours once we kick off our development. We will have review meetings once a week, rest of the time, you are free to work from wherever you like.
It will involve some travelling to meet with our agency, and to some investor’s meetings. All expenses will be covered by us. The salary will be £30-40 per hour depending on experience. The role has the potential to be a co-founder and CTO with share options (3-6%).
Responsibilities include:
* Create briefing document to our app development agency
* Build product development roadmap, and oversee the process.
* Quality and usability control
* Assist in data architecture and visualisation.

*About you:*
* Firstly, you will need to be passionate about our mission and can picture yourself being a part of the female empowerment movement.
* You will need to be a full stack mobile app developer proficient in native development for iOS and Android.
* You will have strong knowledge and experience of RESTful services and API
* You will be a confident leader who is at ease discussing requirements with rest of the team and agency.
* You will be flexible and comfortable with change: after all, we are a startup and we change all the time.
* You will be self-motivated, able to set priorities and manage time effectively, and have high attention to detail.
* Experience of developing mobile applications for travel and social sector would be beneficial.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer For Social Impact
items.content:
Are you a Senior Software Engineer who is interested in joining a successful start-up?

We are Worktu. The social impact venture that is changing the way schools hire teachers. Backed by Bethnal Green Ventures and recently being praised for our innovative solution by the Department for Education, we are disrupting the education recruitment industry and we are looking for our next hire, a software engineer.

You will play an important part in the company’s continued success. We’re looking for people who have experience in relational database structures and understand design patterns used in frameworks like React & Angular but you’re not tied to any one thing. If successful, you will be working from the co-working space in Central London with the option to work remotely when required.

You would have had previous experience or interest of working with the following modern stack and tools; Heroku, Codeship, AWS, Postgres, React, JIRA or Slack.

Working with customers and the tech team, you will be able to create products that are solving key problems in the education system and are making a huge social impact.

Technical Knowledge of at least two of the following:

AngularJS

Nodejs

Mongo DB

Relational Database Structures

React

Benefits:

Use of modern tools and training.

Offer flexible hours and remote working.

Share Options.

20 days holidays.

If you are ready to join our social impact venture and have at least 2 - 3 years industry experience then we would be glad to hear from you! Please provide a detailed covering letter and an up to date CV.

Skype interview followed by in-person interview. Job vacancy to commence end of April 2017.

items.title: Front-End Developer
items.content:
About The Gold Bug
The Gold Bug is a rental company for the owners of prestigious properties around in the world. The company founder has a long experience in the high end travel sector and has identified a gap in the market of high-end luxury accommodation rental and has funding to build the working solution. We are creating the initial core team to develop and deliver the solution, taking advantage of some amazing modern technologies and ideas.

About You
You are not a recruitment agency. You want to make a difference in a startup, and you want to be paid for it! Our Developers will lead the build of our solutions to make us a market leader in our field, producing a beautiful system that helps people communicate. You will look on your work at The Gold Bug and be excited about the technologies we have used, and the results we produce.
We are looking for part time to full time, maybe freelance front-end developers
No Agencies Please

About the CTO
A history of building great technology teams, and choosing the right candidates. And of not using recruitment agencies.

ROLE PROFILE
JOB TITLE: Front-end Developer -React, HTML/CSS
REPORTS TO: CTO
LOCATION: Work from Home (some regular meetings)
DATE: March 2017
EMPLOYMENT BASIS: Contract-to-perm or freelance or part time

PURPOSE
Working with the CTO of our funded startup, you will help build the ecosystem and website presence for our new startup platform, as a front-end creative developer. Contribute to the design and architecture of the solution provided, and come up with amazing ease-of-use solutions.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop massively useful and simple interfaces to help our customers rent properties without even noticing we are there
Work with our senior developer and our RESTful API to produce the right solutions
Optimise design, learning and teaching as you go.
Work in an Agile fashion to ensure that the new product and services are delivered to the appropriate levels of operational quality within the agreed sprint cycles
A flexible approach to working hours may be required, as this is a startup environment.

PERSONAL SPECIFICATION
Experience
1-100 years experience of React
2 years CSS / HTML, ideally with SASS/Less
Able to work with existing frameworks, and not want to reinvent the wheel too rapidly.
Exposure to Node helpful but not critical

Skills/knowledge
Innovative approach to problem-solving
Experience of working in an Agile environment (preferably Scrum)
Knowledge of some or all of the following: Node, React, CSS, HTML, Responsive websites, IAM.


Competencies
Excited by new technologies.
Independent problem solving skills
Good written and verbal skills, able to translate concepts into easily understood diagrams and visuals for both technical and non-technical people alike
Great eye for detail and quality, having common sense and being pragmatic. Be innovative
Flexible. Self-starter. Must be able to manage own time successfully. You would be working in a small team, so some flexibility is required.
You are averse to re-inventing the wheel

Additional Information
Must be eligible to work in the EU;
Good communication skills are a must.
Not being a recruitment agency is CRITICAL to the success of your application

items.title: Lead Developer at Car Quids
items.content:
Car Quids is looking for a full stack developer to join our team in London. This role will work directly with the founders and we’re looking for someone who’s up for a challenge, with a view to making them CTO in due course.

We are *funded by Seedcamp and Oxford University* and prominent angel investors from the marketing/advertising sector.

We work with brands such as *Just EAT, Papa Johns, JustPark, Bloom & Wild, Makers Academy, Travelex, eMoov, easyCar.*

We *crowd source advertising space by turning peoples’ cars into spaces that brands can advertise on*. Car owners get paid in return and they really like us!

*Our tech is the core reason brands choose us*. Using GPS we can show them a heatmap of where their branded fleet has been seen. Our planning algorithms mean our clients can estimate how many people will see their ads and how often with just a few clicks. The next stage of our technology will change the way outdoor advertising is bought and planned.

*Our tech is built on MEAN stack* (MongoDB, Express, Angular and Node.js). The ideal candidate will be able to quickly accustomise themselves with our existing tech as well as suggesting new technologies to use.

You will have a great deal of autonomy, even by startup standards. In addition to being a resourceful developer, we’d love it if you had an eye for design.

*Requirements:*
* Node.js
* Angularjs
* HTML 5/CSS 3
* Mongo DB
* Grunt/LESS
* Git

*Nice to haves:*
* Adobe CS experience, particularly Illustrator
* Responsive Web Design experience
* Big data experience
* AWS experience
* Bootstrap
* Likes cars!

_No recruiters / companies please. If you want to work with us, please get a recommendation through someone we both know_

items.title: Senior Frontend Engineer (React)
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

Festicket is transforming the way music fans discover and book tickets and travel packages for festivals around the world. Our platform revolutionises the music festival industry by offering an end-to-end experience for music travellers through an efficient two-sided marketplace for 900+ music festivals across 50 different countries! In three short years, we have become Europe's largest music festival platform.

YOUR ROLE

We are looking for senior level developers who specialise in ReactJS.

We've had a big funding round in the middle of last year and our technical team is growing rapidly (from 4 to 15 people so far). We need to bring up-to-date our technology to meet the business's ambitions for the next few years. This includes implementing a React SPA as our customer facing website (a green-field project).

We are a team of 15 looking to grow to over 20 immediately. To do this we need dedicated Senior Frontend Engineers to get work done on time, integrate many new team members into this rapidly growing team while working with the other senior developers to ensure that standards stay high and keep getting higher.

THE STACK

http://stackshare.io/festicket/festicket

METHODOLOGY

We work incrementally but do occasionally take on bigger projects to update our stack and offering. Our current methodology is agile kanban.
REQUIREMENTS

YOUR ATTITUDE

You’re someone who’s smart, organised, motivated and gets things done. You want to work in a startup environment, because you like the idea of doing a bit of everything and taking ownership of what you work on. You have ideas about everything, and you’re not afraid to argue your point (while respecting everyone else’s of course). You’re constantly thinking “how can we do this better?”.

You understand the hard work required to update and stabilise a large technical product and you are prepared to put this work into the project.

YOUR SKILL SET

To be considered for the role you must meet most of the following criteria:

* Ideally 5+ years (minimum 3+) years experience with JavaScript and 1.5+ years with ReactJS
* Familiar with Sass (would consider LESS or Stylus)
* More than comfortable with modern web development standards including HTML, CSS, Javascript and responsive design
* Fluent with the command line, you use git
* Have a computing or software engineering degree. In the absence of one we expect you to show that you've taken steps to fill this gap in your training/knowledge.
* E-commerce experience is a big plus but not a requirement

BENEFITS

We’re a team of 70 located in an amazing converted piano factory and recording studio in Camden (NW1 8LH) a short stroll from Camden market and Primrose Hill. By joining us you will be part of one of the fastest growing music / travel start-up companies in Europe, where you will have ample opportunity for career progression as we continue to grow.

We have a company culture which is very idea orientated and driven but also very social. It's entirely normal at 6pm on a Friday for half the company to be drinking together in the office and then planning to head out for a night out.

items.title: Co-Founder/Developer NEEDED
items.content:
Name yet to be decided...but this business is the Skyscanner of Food Tours!!! Or perhaps more accurately it's the Tripping.com of Food Tours!

Food Tourism is huge, it's growing, but it's fragmented. I want to build a website that pulls all the world's best food tours into one place and allows users to find the perfect culinary experience for their travels.

Contracting 1000's of individual operators is problematic as many suppliers are still too small, too independent, and not advanced technologically to incorporate API's or live booking.

However, the solution is to build a site similar to https://www.tripping.com/

We won't be transactional, but users will use us as a search tool and then click through to the supplier.

I'm looking for a developer/co-founder to assist with the design and build of the core website - a web crawler (but open to suggestions) that pulls key information regarding food tours from around the world and then displays it to users in a coherent, user-friendly and intuitive style.

Please get in touch if you're interested in the project - work to begin immediately!!!

items.title: Frontend Developer
items.content:
Hi, my name is Hugh Proctor and I'm the founder of LayrCake.

LayrCake is a one man band at the moment, only me, and I've written a framework in .Net C#. The aim was to reduce the development time of complex software and reduce maintenance.

I had started to use the framework to produce a large CRM / project management / 360 business tool, the aim was primarily to prove the framework, as well as hopefully get a return on my investment.

The project had to pivot slightly and now there are three projects,
The main project is the RAD, where one can design, build and publish your software. - "LayrCake RAD":http://rad.layrcake.com
---- There is also a Xamarin mobile app from which you can design, build and publish also.

The second is still a work in progress - the CRM - "LayrCake CRM":http://crm.layrcake.com
you can see the progress at the following:

"LayrCake RAD":http://rad.layrcake.com
"LayrCake CRM":http://crm.layrcake.com

(go to the data table diagram and wait a second)

I'm looking for some one cool, creative and with personal drive, e.g. Fast, to join and do AngularJs and Javascript with a background in C# and an interest in learning.
We'll also be doing some outsourcing work for companies.

I'm not going to talk to recruitment agencies, or outsourcing companies so please don't contact me.

This may be suitable for a freelancer, part timer or full time.

At the moment, you can work remotely but I'd like the company to get offices in Shoreditch once I've secured funding. (I live in West Ealing, so will also be commuting)

If this sound like something that you'd be passionate about and would like to get involved, it'll be great you have you join and make a team.

Cheers , Hugh

items.title: Python Developer
items.content:
*Python Developer*

Here at CrowdScores we have a fantastic team of people working on a product used by football fans worldwide. We make learning joyful and effortless whilst leveraging lots of brain science and plenty of humour in the process. The app itself has more than 2 million downloads, a 4.4-star rating and almost 1 million active users.

We are looking for a Python Developer to join our established and growing squad in our Blackfriars office. We create substantial new features every week alongside dealing with significant scaling challenges as CrowdScores continues to grow.

*At CrowdScores you will be:*
* Writing succinct, elegant Python, and perhaps one or two DSLs
* Writing systems that process large amounts of data real-time
* Working in a self-organising team of skilled Python developers
* Using Agile (we model our workflow on Scrum), TDD and some pair programming
* Doing DevOps – you will get to deploy (or at least write the single-step deployment scripts) and administer the servers as well as write the code for them
* Writing auto-scaling, parallelizable micro-services with small, well-defined roles in the wider architecture
* Influencing architectural and workflow decisions – these decisions are all made by the team as a group
* Able to introduce new technologies, patterns and libraries where appropriate – we have no dogmas
* Regularly assessing and improving anything that affects you, your team or the company through retrospectives
* Working with: nginx, RabbitMQ, Salt, Vagrant, AWS, Slack, PostgreSQL, redis, MongoDB, Linux (Ubuntu), ZeroMQ, Flask, Django (though much of our code doesn’t touch it), GitHub, Sentry, Travis – knowledge of these is not essential, they can be picked up when you get here
* Using continuous integration, frequent deployment and auto-scaling
* Reviewing other’s code to increase knowledge transfer

*The person we would like is:*
* Smart – either academically or otherwise
* Abhorred by code duplication
* In touch with the Zen of Python
* Prepared to roll up their sleeves and get stuck in
* Preferably a football fan, though this is not essential
* Any age, gender, race, religion, sexuality, disability or nationality, so long as you have the right to work in the UK

*Working with us, you will:*
* Be given the freedom to get your job done
* Face challenging, interesting and varied problems
* Be given your choice of top of the range laptop (OSX, Windows or Linux)
* Work in the centre of London in our offices just off Fleet Street
* Love working with microservices – they are great!
* Wear whatever you like to work
* Join an enthusiastic, collaborative team that cares deeply about the quality of code that they write
* Work in a relaxed, flexible tech-startup atmosphere, where the outcome matters more than anything else
* Share in the success of the company through share options
* Take part in hack days
* Have unlimited holidays
* Play far too much FIFA 17 (we have heard that the PS4 plays other games, but we haven’t tried yet)
* Be invited for picnics in the park in the summer, table tennis nights at Bounce and other social events

To apply for this role please email your CV and cover letter.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
SOMA Analytics is an investor-backed and award-winning start-up that develops pioneering mobile health technology. We are creating the world’s first smartphone-driven Mental Resilience programme, combining aspects from psychology and medicine with machine learning and hardware.

We are a tight-knit, international family that is passionate about building great products. From encouraging unconventional and lean thinking to advocating a healthy lifestyle, we treat our employees as our greatest asset. Join our rapidly expanding team and set your inner geek free with like-minded and awesome workmates.
We are looking for a talented Software Engineer who thrives in a lean start-up environment. Do you enjoy building great mobile products? Are you obsessed with writing efficient and readable code? If this is you, then join one of our mobile or back-end teams and help us improve and scale our main products, which are used by companies and individuals around the world.

*Benefits of Working at Soma Analytics*
* Challenging position in a growing early-stage company.
* Flat hierarchies and an opportunity to make a substantial impact quickly.
* Opportunity to learn about and contribute to SOMA’s innovative research findings.
* Create and deliver products that make a difference to people’s health.
* An office in the epicenter of Europe’s startup capital, London.
* Lots of fun team events (laser quest, get-away weekends, dinner/drinks).
* Competitive salary, stock option plan and private healthcare.

*Requirements*
* University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar.
* 7-10+ years’ relevant work experience.
* Understanding of computer science fundamentals.
* Fluent or familiar with at least 2 of the following: Native iOS development (Objective C, Swift), Native Android development (Java), Back-end development (Python, Django, MySQL).
* Keen to learn new languages and to work across multiple platforms.
* Experience with Agile software development processes.
* Desired: Experience with TDD and applying corresponding testing frameworks.
* Passionate about mobile health and healthy behaviour change.
* High aptitude and quick learner.

Interested? If you are just about to send us your CV and standard cover letter—STOP! You can send us your CV and cover letter (if you want), but *in addition* to this we would love to see some code – show us what you’re good at! We look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Senior Mobile Developer/Co-Founder - proptech
items.content:
*Us*

We are changing the search for a rental property into a thoroughly enjoyable experience and giving landlords more control and information than they have ever had before.

Currently bootstrapped and focused on building an MVP. To accelerate this and get to market smartly we want to find a talented mobile developer to come on as either Employee #1, consider a co-founder role or something in between.

At the present time we are happy to release on a single mobile platform for MVP and do not mind which one. We currently have a partial app in Android/Kotlin but are happy to move to iOS if we find the correct future-colleague to work with therefore the requirements below are equally served by someone who knows either Android or iOS, we do not expect to find an expert on both.

*You*

*MUST*
* Be committed to quality UX
* Be fluent in Agile practices
* Be pragmatic with respect to quality vs. delivery
* Want to work with smart people
* Enjoy being challenged
* Have extensive experience with either Android or iOS development

*SHOULD*
* Want to define and develop the entire user journey collaboratively
* Be interested in functional programming
* Want to develop in either Kotlin or Swift

*MAY*
* Hate Java
* Hate Objective C
* Long for world peace
* Be any colour, shape or size
* Have lead a team of developers before

*The Offer*

Full spectrum between fair market value salary for employee #1 to equity only for a full co-founder. We want to hear from awesome people regardless of their appetite for risk.

We are based in London and expect to be able to sit around and thrash ideas out as a team at least some of the week.

Happy to have people working from home (we are) but must be ready to transition into a more structured setup as we grow a team and leading becomes a requirement.

items.title: Back-End PHP Developer - Fintech
items.content:
Credit Ladder is an investment backed, national tenant credit rewarding and rent processing start-up. We're the first UK company to work with Experian by rewarding tenants with an improved credit score when they pay their rent on time.
 
We are looking for someone to build a modern financial product that has strong foundations already as a working MVP.
 
As a Back-End Developer, you will have solid experience with the full stack of web technologies. You will be hands on within the technology and work towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges that we face. What excites you is problem-solving and delivering innovative technology and products that create happy customers and delivers growth for the company.
 
As part of the Product team, you'll be making sure that the user journey is as precise and delightful as it can be. You'll be one of the joining members as part of a great team that is customer focussed to its core.
We hire engineers that empathise with our customer's problems, develop solutions and measure results. We want you to operate autonomously within the team, focussing relentlessly on our customers.
• Web Development: 3+ years ideally in the financial start-up sector.
• Passionate about technology and its relationship with business and user experience.
• Ability to work independently and plan your own solutions to problems.
• Experience using a back-end MVC Framework (preferably Yii 2.1 or Laravel)
• Experience developing in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (desired)
• Experience developing in a modern front end framework, Angular.js is preferred.
• Experience working with SQL databases, writing custom queries and designing schemas.
• Experience working with GIT.
• Experience developing REST based APIs.
• Server administration experience using Amazon AWS is preferred.
• Understanding of test driven development (TDD), the ability to structure your code so its testable, and the desire to write tests.
• Broad understanding of the concept of minimum viable product and conversion rates.
• Possess empathy for the user and able to build great code that drives fantastic user experience.
• Strong communication skills and ability to articulate complex and technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
• Be open, communicative, and fun to work with.
• Understanding of Scrum and Agile development
 
Job Type: Contract
Required: ASAP
 
Required experience:
• Web Development: 3 years
 
Contract length:
• Initial 3 months extendable upon review of performance

Location

• Manchester – Central

items.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (eCommerce)
items.content:
At NearSt we're looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our growing e-commerce team. You'll be helping build the technology used to deliver our mission: building the future of how people shop on high streets everywhere by creating a first class e-commerce experience for buying anything from local shops. NearSt makes it super simple for any store to connect their inventory to our platform and for nearby shoppers to browse and buy from them via our e-commerce app and website.


*ABOUT THE ROLE*

We’re looking for a developer to join as the second member of our growing e-commerce team helping us build the next phase of our mobile first local shopping site. You’ll be building the APIs that power the site as well as the interfaces that go with it, which are currently held together with Node.js, React/Redux, MySQL and a bit of wood glue. Building a local e-commerce platform presents unique challenges such as How do you design a simple shopping basket experience that may include items from shops with 5 different addresses?

As part of a small tight-knit development team you’ll be expected to help us make the decisions that build a better product for our users. Decisions like how we move from being a “mobile first” company to an “app first” company. Currently our iPhone app is written in Swift but we’re hoping that the e-commerce team will take the reins … should we transform it into a React Native app and deploy it across iOS and Android?


*ABOUT US*

At NearSt we're on a mission to get people back into local shops, and rejuvenate high streets around the world. At just over a year old our technology has already earned us backing led by retail investor TrueStart / True Capital, international awards, and invitations to speak at some of the industry's headline events, including WIRED Retail. Our platform is already the largest bookshop network in London and we’re well on our way with half a dozen more categories (from DIY to Health & Beauty).

We're currently moving out of our pilot phase, and into our scale-up phase. Connecting hundreds of new shops in multiple product verticals, and launching our NearLIVE technology platform, that will allow external developers to build location-aware e-commerce experiences.

We have a strong team with previous experience in other start-ups, digital innovation consultancy, and marketing. Learn more about us over at near.st.


*RESPONSIBILITIES*

* Work together with the CTO and e-commerce team to assess and input on product briefs, working with the wider team to estimate and prioritise work
* Build a product that you would love to use yourself, both as a developer and as a shopper
* Create components for our e-commerce site (and eventually our app) using React (React native for app) and Sass
* Develop an API and data store that drives customer’s interactions with our growing selection of local shops and their products
* Be an awesome person to work with


*REQUIREMENTS*

* An extensive background in building Node.js web apps
* Strong with both relational and non-relational data stores
* Knowledge of ES6 and Sass best practises
* Ability to learn new technologies and languages quickly
* Experience with UX principles and “putting the user first”
* Deployment best practices (we use AWS, Docker and Codeship for CI)
* Working knowledge of Webpack, React, Redux
* Hunger to grow with the role as the company expands


*PLUSSES*

* Experience building e-commerce applications
* Experience in applying TDD (using Mocha/Chai or equivalents)
* Exposure to RESTful microservice architectures
* Knowledge of security and data protection within e-commerce and marketplaces
* Experience building “isomorphic” web apps


*BENEFITS*

* Competitive salary
* Strong options package - truly get in on the first floor
* Awesome office in the heart of Tech City, surrounded by similar startups
* Super flexible hours and tools to suit your working style
* Free snacks, a ridiculous selection of teas, proper coffee, and a sweet monthly company wellness offer
* Work on a product with the potential to redefine how we all shop alongside a tight-knit team


_RECRUITERS / TECH OUTSOURCERS_

As a seed stage company we don’t work with recruiters, and neither do we outsource any of our technology development. Please do not get in touch trying to convince us otherwise. It wastes both your time and ours. Thank you for your understanding.

items.title: Ruby on Rails developer
items.content:
About us:
Provenance empowers brands to increase trust, using revolutionary technologies for greater supply chain transparency. Our software lets brands bring the origin and histories of products to the point of sale. At Provenance, we envision a future where every great product comes with accessible, verifiable information about its history and creation, helping us all make positive choices about what to buy.

Our culture:
We are committed to growing a diverse team with equal opportunities for all. A handful of us work remote from within the UK, and from other cities in Europe. The product team is a multi-disciplinary team of designers and developers working in sprints, and in close collaboration with the rest of the company.

Overview:
We are looking for a Ruby on Rails developer to help develop new features, improve usability and conversion, and help build a product that is useful to a range of consumer types. You’ll be supporting our designers and developers in providing an excellent user experience, and engaging new stakeholders in food and beverage, fashion and lifestyle, among other industries.

This is a brilliant opportunity for the right person to join an innovative startup in North London, where you’ll be contributing to building a business with a social mission.

The Role:
Ruby development experience (minimum 3 years) using Rails,
Experience building both full Rails apps and API,
RDBMS backed applications (Postgres, MySQL etc),
TDD / BDD using RSpec and Capybara,
Comfortable working with Javascript,
Interested in working with the blockchain (Ethereum),
Git/GitHub,
Working in sprints

Who we’re looking for:
A motivated team player who is eager to learn and apply new skills to the role;
As you'll be reporting to the CTO and working closely with our designers, front-end developer and blockchain developer, you’ll be comfortable working both autonomously and as part of a team;
Someone who shares our mission and is excited by what we're doing;
Someone collaborative and pragmatic;
Someone who is just as happy hacking something to test an idea as they are crafting a difficult solution that will provide users with the best possible experience;

How to apply:
Please tell us why you’d like to work at Provenance and share examples of your work. Email us with the subject line: Ruby Developer

items.title: ✮✮✮ Junior - Mid Level iOS Engineer ✮✮✮
items.content:
