items.title: Developer
items.content:
*Key Details*
Job Title: Developer
Type: Permanent
Dates: Full time (core hours 10-4 with a further 2 hours a day Monday to Friday) starting April 2017. Some degree of flexibility around working hours may be required during busier times.
Salary: Negotiable depending on experience
Deadline: Ongoing
Application Process: Applications will be received by the Chief Operating Officer, Adam Alton. Please note that the CEO and CTO will also have access to any applications and due to PCI-DSS requirements background checks (including criminal record check) will be required prior to final employment and any applicant will be informed if such a check is to take place.

*About Make it Social*
Make it Social are recruiting for a talented Developer to join our growing, passionate and innovative central Edinburgh based team. You will be a pivotal part of the team in the development of the business. Make it Social offers companies, within a range of industries including travel and event ticketing, a group booking solution that they can integrate with their existing systems via APIs. Once integrated it not only captures the organic social group booker but it also opens up a host of opportunities with regards to marketing towards a new demographic. For our users, we are developing a social network that enables more offline social interaction with friends and family.

*Main Duties and Responsibilities*
* Create client customised group booking areas to provided specifications.
* Help with the maintenance of current systems including bug tracking and fixing, primarily this will revolve around the frontend of the systems, however backend development may also be required from time to time.
* Plan and implement new features with the rest of the team.
* Contribute to the development of new and existing ideas.
* Act as a contact for support matters should clients have questions.
* Contribute to the ongoing development of our developer area where clients can find documentation on our systems.


*Essential Skills*
* Javascript ES6
* Proficient in Polymer or at least 2 other popular frameworks
* Web Components
* HTML5 and CSS3
* NPM
* Redux
* Implementing designs in HTML / CSS
* Sensitive approach to data protection and handling confidential information
* Attention to detail and ability to produce work to a high degree of accuracy
* Ability to plan and prioritise
* Ability to integrate and operate well in a team environment

*Desirable Skills*
* Experience of unit testing
* Experience of Amazon Web Services
* Experience of cloud-based systems
* Babel, Gulp, Grunt scripting
* GoLang
* MySQL / MongoDB
* Writing S.O.L.I.D code
* Good email manner

*General Skills*
* Able to cope with stressful situations with a mature and calm disposition at all times
* Initiative
* Innovative
* Self-motivated
* A strong commitment to delivering a genuinely world class product
* A willingness to learn new skills as required and undertake appropriate training
* Enthusiastic
* Ambitious
* A very positive attitude towards, and a desire for, working in a startup environment

*Key Relationships*
Internal: Developers and Designers
External: Clients and External Developers

items.title: Mid-level Software Engineer to build products for users around the world
items.content:
"D4":http://weared4.com is a software studio in Birmingham, with customers all over the UK and further afield.

We currently deliver software projects and offer consultancy in product design, UX and performance optimisation.

*We’re now searching for a full-time Mid-level Software Engineer to join our growing team.*

You might be just starting out or looking for your second job - either way you’ll have built or contributed to a few different projects and can demonstrate that.

*D4 now and in the future*

Over the next few years we’ll be moving from a client/agency model into being a multiple SaaS product provider, where products we’ve built will account for a majority of our revenue. We recently hired a marketer as we position ourselves to grow in the future. Exciting times!

That means you’ll work on software projects for clients and our own in-house products:

*"QueryTree":http://querytreeapp.com - a visual reporting tool for startups and agencies
*"SQLizer":http://sqlizer.io - a database migration tool for developers (currently at ~10,000 unique customers per month)
*Secret New Thing - a new product we’re launching in the coming months

We aim to be a top provider of tools for startups and developers around the world.

*Tools*

Client work can come to us in any language & framework, but typically: .Net (C# MVC), Javascript, Go, and Python.

For our own projects and products you’re free to use the best tool for the job, but typically that means: C#, Go, and Python. These are our ‘go-to’ languages.

We use multiple cloud hosting solutions including AWS, GAE and Azure — this isn’t a DevOps role, but a working knowledge of these services would be helpful.

*Process*

Our ‘secret sauce’ is the carefully refined process we’ve developed in over 20 years of building for the web.

We constantly iterate and improve this process which covers the end-to-end project lifecycle from sales to support.

Don’t think ‘red tape’, it’s more like ‘paved roads’ that help you get things done more quickly and to a higher quality.

*The role*

*Develop new features for products, making sure your code stacks up to our standards
*Test any code changes you make, minimising bugs (and headaches)
*Give non-techies a hand every now and then through support tickets (we all do this)
*Nothing stays the same forever so you need to be willing to continually learn about new tools, techniques and technologies and apply them to this role
*Have ideas and don’t be afraid to share them!

As well as being able to write good, clean code you’ll need to be able to solve problems on a daily basis using your own initiative.

*Where you’ll work*

D4 is located in a beautiful listed building in the Jewellery Quarter, close to the city centre but with plenty of quirky places nearby to shop & eat.

We operate a flexible working policy where the whole team has the option to work remotely for a proportion of their time and it’s not unusual for the office to be empty some days.

We use Slack & Hangouts to stay in touch during the day.

If you’re good, and you can prove yourself then even 100% remote is no problem.

*Apply*

If you’re smart, friendly and ❤️ building software — we want to hear from you.

Apply: with your CV & Github link (if available).

Recruiters: No recruiters please, we do not work with recruitment agencies. Thank you.

items.title: Back end Developer (funded startup on Techstars accelerator)
items.content:
Simudyne’s mission ( "WIRED article":http://www.wired.co.uk/article/war-simulations ) is to ensure that "all decisions of consequence are simulated first":https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/how-screw-up-justin-lyon .

We are an engineering led company looking to hire a PAID back end developer intern (w/ view to make you a full time offer after 2-3 months)

Perks: Full time developer opportunity. Join us on the Barclays TechStars accelerator (we were selected from a very large applicant pool), learn from the best simulation experts and join one of the hottest (funded) AI startups. Mac / PC + iPhone. Competitive salary plus stock options available for the right candidate.


*Essential:*

• Knowledge of or ability to rapidly learn Java and Scala
• Ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment
• Take on significant responsibility early by working on a bleeding edge technology platform that puts you in the position of creating features for some of the world’s best modellers and programmers

*Preferred:*

• Energetic, hungry computer engineers looking to make their mark.
• Java / Scala expertise
• Knowledge of the Hadoop ecosystem (esp. Spark)
• Passion for AI (esp. deep reinforcement learning)
• Excellent modeller (esp. agent-based models)
• Platform developer
• Comfortable anywhere in the tech stack
• Interest in distributed computation
• Drive to work on deep fundamental technology


N.B. Many of our best engineers had no knowledge of the “preferred” attributes before they arrived. We can provide the mentorship, guidance and network to get you up to speed if you have the aptitude.
We need to move quickly. We will hire ASAP. We will wait for the right people but the earlier the start, the better.

The best talent rarely has the time to do 5 rounds of interviews and spend 8 hours on a developer test. Send us your CV, and an example project / code contribution. Be prepared for a review of your work, and more importantly the reasoning and rationale for what you’ve created or changed. The best examples should explain functionality, setup, toolset, etc. If you are not able to discuss or share an existing project, we do ask for you to complete an open-ended development task.

*About us:*

Our technology uses the power of the cloud to run models of the real world that can scale infinitely. Think simulations with billions of moving parts, millions of people interacting and the ability to decide the best course of action. They are artificially intelligent simulations. To date, our technology has been used by the Bank of England, Burgan and Gulf Bank, several research institutions, a super major oil company, and the list is growing.  

Simudyne "joined":http://www.techstars.com/content/accelerators/announcing-barclays-techstars-london-class-2017/?utm_source=Twitter&utm_medium=social%20media&utm_campaign=Barclays%20Techstars%20London%20Class%20for%202017 the Barclays TechStars 2017 cohort, and while we’re here we want to "introduce global banks to our value proposition":https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/artificially-intelligent-simulations-financial-justin-lyon. We are based in the heart of Shoreditch in the new Barclays Rise building, together with London’s other top FinTech startups.

Check out our "global webinar with Cloudera":http://providence.ai/ and core Spark committer on our website http://providence.ai/

items.title: ** Full Stack Web Developer **
items.content:
Are you someone who cares about writing great code as well as working with big data, cool visualisations and graphics? Then please read on!

*About Squawka*
Squawka is the award winning digital companion for football fans that uses real-time data visualisations to explain the game. Since launching in June 2012, Squawka has been used by over 8 million mobile & web football fans around the world to understand more about the game that they love.

In addition to this, Squawka have pioneered the use of data, technology and second-screen for football fans. Over 200 million people around the World are exposed to Squawka content every month, be it from our leading editorial team, social media, videos, images or our ground-breaking real-time stats tools.

Our investors include FremantleMedia (producers of The X-Factor, Britain’s Got Talent, The Apprentice etc.), ad agency BBH (part of Publicis Groupe), Forward Internet Group (and founder Neil Hutchinson), Spark Ventures chairman Tom Teichman, Sir John Hegarty and Doyen Global – a sports & entertainment marketing agency working with Neymar, David Beckham, Xavi, Usain Bolt, Boris Becker and Liam Payne.

*The Role*
As a Web Developer your focus will be on putting your care and attention to writing clean, test-driven front-end and back-end code to deliver high quality features for our website rebuild and future products.

You care about performance, code standards and maintainability.

An ability to learn new things, share your knowledge with others and communicate in a fast-paced agile environment is essential.

You will be responsible for:
* Developing new products on the Squawka platform, which can include either working on our REST API, micro-services or building front-end components
* Working with other developers, designers and the product manager to ship products within specified timelines
* Ensuring that products are developed to be robust, stable and scalable
* Contributing to the architectural design and technology selection processes

*What we are looking for*
* Solid experience with PHP 5+
* Experience working in MVC frameworks such as Symfony2, Zend or Laravel
* The ability to work with complex MySQL databases
* Strong Javascript experience
* Proven commercial experience working in an agile environment, building consumer facing, responsive websites
* Experience working with services using both internal and external APIs
* Automated/Unit Testing and Continuous Integration environments
* An overall great team player!

*The icing on the cake*
* Experience with ReactJS & Redux or similar framework/library, or a keen interest to learn
* Experience working with message brokers such as RabbitMQ, Kafka, ActiveMQ
* Experience of working with javascript task runners and build tools such as Webpack, Grunt and Gulp
* A passion for football and big sports data

*What we offer*
* A competitive salary (£45k - £55k based on experience and suitability to the role)
* 24 days annual leave plus bank holidays, with the ability to carry over unused days
* A pool table, ping-pong table and video games to play when you need a break
* Fresh fruit, tea and coffee to keep you going
* Team social events (5-a-side football, parties for big events e.g. World Cup, Christmas, completion of big projects etc)

If all this sounds interesting to you then please apply!

items.title: Junior Web Developer
items.content:
Junior Web Developer wanted for exciting Aviation startup. Autoflight is the world’s most innovative electronic logbook for pilots. The concept behind our new product is a first of its kind, revolutionising the pilot logbook industry.

THE PROJECT
To redesign the website with a more fresh look and feel for our customers. You can work from home with hours that suit you, provided that a minimum number of hours is fulfilled. Full details and specification will be provided upon commencement of the project.

WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Creative, fun, driven and passionate people looking to gain essential experience to move their career forward quickly. You should have knowledge and/or experience with HTML5, CSS3, PHP and AJAX.

WHAT WE OFFER
We understand this may be completed around your studies. We recognise that you will want to gain experience to enhance your graduate CV, therefore Autoflight will provide you with a competitive package whilst you study. Equity offers will be made to exceptional candidates.

Kickstart your career now by gaining invaluable experience. To apply or ask a question, email a CV and covering letter.

items.title: UX Expert
items.content:
**** Please No Recruitment Agencies *****

Gamar is the world's first 3D augmented reality platform which allows anyone to create their own games and fun tours that interact with the world around us. We are creating an epic disruption in the culture, tourism and leisure industries where it has increased engagement over 100 times and thus encouraged higher footfall.

Our clients include top brands like Merlin Entertainment, DHX Media, The British Museum and many other brands, theme parks, castles, museums and sports stadiums. Join Gamar to change the way people engage in the local attractions, whilst creating great memories!

We are looking for a talented User Experience Manger who is an expert in branding, messaging, web and app world.

*Our Challenges:*
* Gamar's biggest challenge is, we are a B2B2C company and this is posing us a lot of challenges in terms of messaging and branding
* Our technology is pretty new and unique and this has to be explained easily and in simple words
* We created a platform and ecosystem and not a product
* Our platform is interacting with the real world around us, so, it is not just another digital app

*We need someone who has solved such complex challenges already!*

*Essential Requirements:*
* Highly talented UX designer with 5+ years agency experience
* Outstanding portfolio showcasing high-impact user experience design across multi-platforms for desktop, mobile, tablet and apps
* Bring lots of inspiration to the team through innovative design approaches
* Well versed in design research, user experience design processes and methodology, its value and how to integrate it into work
* Be able to work across a diverse number of projects and keep within tight deadlines
* Expert at developing and crafting wireframes, user flows, experience maps and prototypes
* Responsible for maintaining quality right through all phases of design process

*Competitive package offered depending on the experience. This is a 6-month contract with a possibility to become full time.*
*You should be available immediately to start.*
*Apply now!*

items.title: Junior App Developer
items.content:
Junior App Developer wanted for exciting Aviation startup. Autoflight is the world’s most innovative electronic logbook for pilots. The concept behind our new product is a first of its kind, revolutionising the pilot logbook industry.

THE PROJECT
Design a location based app for our members. You can work from home with hours that suit you, provided that a minimum number of hours is fulfilled. Full details and app specification will be provided upon commencement of the project.

WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Creative, fun, driven and passionate people looking to gain essential experience to move their career forward quickly. You should have knowledge and/or experience with Apple Xcode.

WHAT WE OFFER
This is a paid position and we understand this may be completed around your studies. We recognise that you will want to gain experience to enhance your graduate CV, therefore Autoflight will provide you with a competitive package whilst you study. Equity offers will be made to exceptional candidates.

Kickstart your career now by gaining invaluable experience. To apply or ask a question, email a CV and covering letter.

items.title: UX Lead
items.content:
*About goHenry*

At goHenry we want to make the next generation smarter at managing money than the last. We offer a pre-paid card and app for kids age 6 to 18. Parents can set safe spending limits, children get independence and to start learning about managing money.

goHenry is growing fast. Having completed one of the most successful crowdfunding campaigns in the world (where we raised £3.9 million) we are looking to expand our team. We have a growing customer base of close to half a million users and we need someone to help us ensure that the customer experience we deliver is of the highest standard.

*About the role*

This role reports into the Product Director/CPO. We’re looking for a senior UX designer who displays expert-level skill and experience conceptualising and designing engaging user experiences to join our team. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem-solving skills. You should excel at providing both highly analytical as well as highly creative ideas when it comes to designing customer journeys and experiences. A thorough understanding of contemporary user-centred design methodologies is a must. This is a new role in the business. We’ve never employed a UX Designer before but now is the right time for us to take someone on full time, there is plenty to get involved in.

*Key Responsibilities*

• Understand user experience and user centred design best practices and apply those practices to achieve user goals across multiple platforms (Web, iOS and Android)

• Deliver solutions that balance business goals and user needs to provide unique and engaging experiences

• Create elegant information design solutions and supporting documentation including: usability testing reports (test plans scripts, surveys and other documentation, interview scripts, test reports and recommendations), best practice recommendations, experience concepts, sitemaps and user flow diagrams, user stories and wireframes and interactive prototypes.

• Research and stay abreast of user experience, User-Centered Design, and interaction design trends across platforms

• Share new research, industry trends and insights with team members

• Design documentation in the form of specifications and guidelines (global templates, components and element behaviour)

• Interaction and interface design


*Skills and Qualifications*

• Familiar with the tools of the trade, from pro-typing tools like InVision to usability testing platforms.

• 5+ years of experience applying User Centered Design methodologies for web and mobile applications that leverage emergent technologies, consumer electronics and/or mobile devices

• A strong portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating responsive and user-centered design solutions

• Working knowledge of web and mobile app design best practices, focusing on responsive, adaptive and fluid design across multiple devices and screen types

• Working knowledge of customer journey mapping.

• Fluent in creating information architecture documentation including sitemaps, user flow diagrams, wireframes, and prototypes

• Expert-level understanding of user interface design patterns and standard User Centred Design methodologies.

• Applied facilitation, brainstorming and collaboration exercise skills

• Ability to convey your ideas via strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills

• Ability to manage projects along with a proven ability to multi-task, meet deadlines and thrive in a fast-paced environment, and react quickly to changes in direction

• Experience conducting and facilitating user research

• Strong understanding of modern software and application development processes and methodologies

items.title: Performance Marketing Lead
items.content:
Who are we?

Sell Sprint is the most convenient way for busy people to sell their unwanted luxury fashion goods.

Our premium offering is tailored to suit those who are time-poor, and our clients expect only the best user experience around.

You can expect to work directly with luxury brands, high net worth individuals and high-end retailers.

Why join us?

1) This is an excellent opportunity to work in a hands-on role with a funded start-up which is rapidly growing. You can expect quick career progression as we scale if you’re able to deliver results.
2) We have an award-winning founder and team, and our investors have built some of the biggest brands on the planet.
3) We have featured in numerous publications and on television – you can expect great exposure whilst you’re with us.
4) We have been through three incubator and accelerator programs; the last of which is recognised as being one of Europe’s top three.
5) Most importantly, we’re an exciting place to work. We like to mix-in drinks and laughs with hard-work and results. There is never a dull moment in our office!

What’s the role?

We’re looking for someone to head-up our performance marketing. You’ll be key to our growth efforts.

You will be a technical problem-solver who can use analytical insights to enhance on-site performance and average order value.

This is a brilliant opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of luxury, and to lead a growing brand with international ambitions on the front-line. You will be solving a genuine problem for people who lack time, in a way that no business has been able to before.

What responsibilities can you expect?

• Produce insights on the fashion re-sale market, competitors, market share and opportunities to drive key strategic decisions.
• Based on your research, planning budget allocation across key digital channels.
• Defining and executing against KPIs
• Creating and managing campaigns; both acquisition and retention.
• Reporting strategic insights and key metrics (e.g. CAC, CPL, LTV) to the CEO and advisors.

What skills and qualities do we require?

• Relevant work experience in a marketing role, having ideally had some experience in the luxury and/or fashion spaces.
• Experience with paid search, social media and retargeting. We’re keen to see evidence of past successes.
• Analytically-minded. Experience with CRO, LTV Optimisation, campaign planning and execution.
• Autonomous in approach, competitive, hard-working and enthusiastic.
• Strong communication skills and able to effectively convey our brand image. A high standard of written and spoken English is essential.

What can you expect?

• A competitive salary.
• Shares in the business.
• A very sociable and interactive office environment.
• Regular team activities and away-days.
• Highly qualified and ambitious teammates.

How can I apply?

Please send us your CV along with a covering email explaining why you’d like to come and work with us!

items.title: Digital Marketing Lead at Award-Winning Startup (Funded)
items.content:
HowNow is a global platform that enables experts to teach learners anywhere in the world over live, interactive video chat. There are millions of people with expertise around the world that could be teaching and millions more who do not have access to high quality teaching. Backed by Mark Pearson (Founder of MyVoucherCodes) and Tennis Star Andy Murray, HowNow are bringing these people together, beyond borders, and changing the way the world learns.

We’re looking for a creative, ambitious and data-driven digital marketing extraordinaire with expertise and experience in user acquisition and growth hacking.

*What you’ll be doing*

• User Acquisition – Hack our customer and supplier growth using innovative and lean strategies. This involves planning, creating and implementing marketing campaigns across various acquisition channels.
• Reporting – You love data and making sense of it is your forte. From Cohort Analysis to Database Segmentation, you’ll be able to continuously test, report and optimise your campaigns.
• Paid Advertising – Creating, managing and optimising PPC and Social Media advertising campaigns.
• Working with Designer and Community Manager to create artwork, engage the customers and develop new business.
• Setting up and managing Brand Ambassador programs
• Affiliate marketing

*What skills you need*

• You’ve got experience and expertise in user acquisition, growth hacking as well as strong analytical and numerical skills to be able to extract insights from data.
• You have a great understanding of CPO, CPA, CPC, CPM, CTR and everything else in between, with the ability to report clearly and concisely.
• You know how to manage paid advertising across channels such as Facebook, Google Adwords, etc.
• Email management and optimisation
• A good understanding and experience of successful SEO
• Marketplace and Edtech experience as well as graphic design skills would be a bonus
• Highly motivated, autonomous with entrepreneurial flair
• A history of working hard and getting results.
• A love for trying new experiences is a MUST HAVE!

*What you get*

• A competitive salary with commission
• Work directly with the founders who have built a startup that has been awarded Business of the Year, named Top 100 Startup in the UK and have been recognised by Virgin Media Business as one of the most innovative founders in the UK.
• Generous perks and holidays
• Consideration for share options
• Work with a passionate team of hustlers changing the way the world learns.
• The satisfaction of building something that matters and spending your time in a meaningful way.

If reading this post has got your excited, send us a message with your CV, a bit about yourself and why you’re applying.

items.title: Community Development Intern
items.content:
Sport Heroes Group is looking for a Community Development Intern for Running Heroes UK in its London Office.

Who we are

Established in 2014, Sport Heroes Group is a fast growing company whose mission is to reinvent sports and create new digital experiences. We are a team of 40 passionate runners and cyclist based in Paris, London and Sydney.
Through our media brands Running Heroes (runningheroes.com) and Cycling Heroes (cyclingheroes.com) we count 500,000 members worldwide and are partnering with more than 200 brands including Nike, adidas, ASICS, Mizuno, Polar, Uber, Spotify and Bose.
Since its creation, Running Heroes has become the number one running media in France and aims to hold a similar position in the UK. The UK platform was opened in 2015 and has a fast growing community with more than 70,000 members after one and half year of operations.
You will be working in a team of three passionate people, who are able to move fast. We offer a challenging work environment in a cool shared office near the magic roundabout in Old Street.

Your Job

Your activities will include:
• Animating the UK community for Running & Cycling Heroes;
• Managing the community communication: weekly newsletter, social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram), customer service support;
• Creating and publishing offers/challenges online and working with clients in this process;
• Handling the external communication: public relations, clients and media management;
• Supporting the business development team;
• Continues improvement of user acquisition. Finding the right channels / growth hack opportunities. Forecasting and managing an annual budget;
• Be the face of Running Heroes during races and events.
Benefits
• Be part of a small dynamic team;
• Work and network in a super dynamic environment at WeWork in Old Street;
• The internship could lead to a full-time job;
• Train every day and race on the weekend with your teammates.

Who we are looking for

Sport Heroes Group is looking for a Community Development Intern to manage the Running Heroes and Cycling Heroes communities in the UK.
We are looking for a passionate runner or cyclist looking for his/her next exciting challenge!
We are looking for someone who:
• Is passionate about sport, ideally running and/or cycling;
• Is autonomous, has start-up mindset and can-do attitude;
• Has excellent English communication skills (native English level) and a good knowledge of the UK lifestyle;
• Can plan accurately and be proactive;
• Loves to interact with people;
• Is comfortable with digital design tools (i.e. Photoshop) to create visuals or refine images;
• Ideally has experience optimising Facebook Ads;
• Has a sharp focus on his/her goals and is a keen communicator;
• Is rigorous and has a strong attention to detail;
• Has strong interest in all things digital, especially social media;
• Has a good sense of humour;
• Has full working rights in the UK (sponsorship not available).

How to apply:

Please send us your CV and a few words to describe (1) what you like about Running Heroes, (2) why you think you are a good fit for this Community Development role, and (3) what your passion is (even if it is not related to sport).
Please don't send a copy-pasted cover letter.

items.title: Production Lead - China and Vietnam
items.content:
The Production team is focused on getting our beautifully designed furniture products from our workshops to the UK in pristine quality and on time.

You are our eyes and ears on the ground, working closely with our suppliers in China and Vietnam as well as Production, Buying and Design teams in London.

You are an excellent communicator are happy to work independently and remotely. Once your training is complete in London, you'll spend the majority of your time in Asia with quarterly trips back to the UK.

You are an excellent Production Lead and work tirelessly to ensure Swoons distinctive furniture is delivered with exceptional quality.

You'll be extremely pro-active in communicating the status of every container in production and ensure pre-production meetings and QC schedules facilitate on-time delivery.

Your responsibility doesn't end with the product. Packaging needs to be thoroughly spec'd to avoid damage in transit, with accurate information and branding on the box and in assembly kits and instructions

NOTE: This position is only open to candidates with the right to work in the UK. Accommodation is provided in Vietnam for this role

RESPONSIBILITIES
* Hold monthly Performance and Pre Production meetings with each supplier
* Develop production transparency to enhance understanding of our supply chain
* Ensure product development timelines and original ex-factory dates are met
* Hold Quality Control Audits and review Swoon products on the production line, post production and packaged - to ensure product accuracy and product quality
* Enforce a zero tolerance policy for any items that do not meet Swoon quality expectation
* Feed in product quality learnings and proactively problem solve future batch improvement
* Perform packaging drop tests and revise packaging specifications to reduce transit issues
* Work closely with the Design and Buying team to ensure all products meet technical, safety and legal requirements
* Develop and maintain Supplier Manuals, Defect Classification list and other QC reference docs
* Source new suppliers for Swoon to work with in the region and complete the onboarding process in advance of order placement

REQUIREMENTS
* You have an impressive eye for detail
* You have knowledge of product technologies relevant to the furniture sector
* You are quick to react to production changes and take appropriate action
* You are a fast learner and enjoy a challenge
* You are process orientated
* You revel in a fast paced environment
* You have a positive attitude

items.title: Interviewers: Deep Tech Project
items.content:
Aisatsu, this is Project Voyager @ houzen.co!
Project Voyager is the deep tech exploration project at houzen, which aims to explore the deep tech 'space' and identify applied solutions for the residential real estate world.

We are looking to bring A+ research/masters interns on a (paid) freelance basis who have a strong interest in Deeper tech solutions (AI/Big Data/Blockchain etc.). We are open to students in their Undergrad/Masters/PHD/MBA from top universities, who have a bit of time to help out in conducting these interviews.

The project has a strong team of 5 - who come from VC/Investment Banking/RE Private Equity/Data science backgrounds.

Task:
We are conducting 100 + interviews (10 already done since last 2 weeks), across industries to figure out what deep tech really means and its application across industries. We already have 2 interviewers from the current team, however due to excessive workload we're now looking to bring 1-2 more interviewers in to help reach out to some senior industry (deep tech) leaders and interview them.
The project is extremely (intellectually) stimulating as you get to talk to a wide variety of people from across industries and offers a steep learning curve in the deep tech space. There will be a strong possibility for full time roles after the end of the project as well, as we aim to start building a deep tech team shortly after.

We've also been commissioned by RICS (a leading Real Estate publication) to write an insights paper through project voyager which will be published across national media etc. We're also in talks with several other leading research publications to collaborate on project voyager.


A bit more about the core business (houzen.co):

Founding team:
(i) Senior Partner level at Private Equity/Venture Capital Consulting firm with extensive network within PE/VC space (LinkedIn:http://bit.ly/1q2No7X);
(ii) classmate from Oxford MBA + LSE + 5 years expanding Groupon UK,
(iii) classmate from Oxford MBA + LSE + ex-CEO Donati group + Goldman Sachs + Ralph Lauren.

Tech: Tech co-leads from IIT (India’s top & globally renowned Engg schools) + 3 more kick-ass developers (one more from IIT).

EIRs: 4 young and very entrepreneurial EIRs who are juggling sales, ops, strategy, customer service and teaching us all a thing or two about hustling and running a successful business.

Mentors: from large PE funds, corporates, and product heads/co-founders from London based unicorns.

The business: houzen is a hyperlocal marketplace for Residential Real Estate. We aim to disrupt the entire Real Estate value chain by introducing exciting product features.

items.title: Acquisition Specialist
items.content:
*About Route1*

Route1, an award winning app that provides a quick and easy alternative to recruiters and job boards and costs companies significantly less. We are focussing on legal recruitment before expanding in to other verticals. 

Launched in the UK in May 2016 and Australia in September 2016, we work alongside some of the world's largest law firms, including Clifford Chance, Linklaters, DLA Piper, Herbert Smith Freehills and Norton Rose Fulbright, and currently have over 7,000 lawyers using the app.

We're a small team at the start of a long journey, we have big ambitions to permanently change the way people hire and get hired. Find out more about us at www.route1.co

*The Job*

We are looking to add an outgoing and engaging team member to be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with our rapidly growing candidate and employer networks.  Existing, strong, recruitment-based relationships with London law firms and in-house legal departments is required. 

This exciting new role is flexible in terms of both work schedule and location and is available for an immediate start. Remuneration is commission-based and includes options.

items.title: Customer Care Team Lead
items.content:
Our Customer Care team are at the heart of our business and the first port of call for our customers. Whether they’re looking for advice on the perfect piece, or seeking to help with a delivery that’s gone wrong, you’ll be the face (and voice) of Swoon Editions to each and every enquiry we receive – over the phone, email and on social media.

In the Customer Care Team Lead role, you’ll not just manage and resolve customer enquiries but also play a pivotal role in helping to design innovative solutions to prevent them, working with all areas of our business.

Reporting to the Head of Care, you’ll be managing a growing team, digging into customer data and identifying opportunities to improve the systems and processes that drive truly great customer experiences.

RESPONSIBILITIES

* Day to day operational and performance management of the customer service team against agreed KPIs and SLAs
* Designing innovative tech-led solutions and processes to improve and drive continual improvement within the customer service experience
* Resolving and managing the volume of customer issues and complaints, including timely follow-ups and customer escalations
* Providing timely and regular reporting on all appropriate elements of the team performance and customer contacts
* Assisting the Head of Care with the recruitment and training of new hires, identifying any knowledge gaps.
* Organising the team - ensuring rotas, annual leave, training and coaching are all planned in advance
* Leading effective performance management of the team and ongoing skills development, through 121s, weekly team meetings and training sessions
* Learning about (and selling!) our Editions

REQUIREMENTS

* You’re a natural leader with a passion for brilliant customer service and possess a positive can- do attitude
* You are a self-starter who has experience of working in customer service (desirable)
* You have a graduate degree in any discipline (desirable)
* You understand how to manage and motivate a team of care advisers to deliver a next level of customer service and ensure they have the skills and confidence to take ownership of every customer interaction
* You have exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* You are results focused with the ability to identify route of a problem and how to solve
* You are an analytical thinker with the ability to work independently using your own initiative
* You understand how to analyse and interpret customer data and reports, as well as to present and summarise findings

items.title: Business Development Internship
items.content:
ABOUT US

Festicket is transforming the way music fans discover and book tickets and travel packages for festivals around the world. Our platform revolutionises the music festival industry by offering an end-to-end experience for music travellers through an efficient two-sided marketplace for 500+ music festivals across 40 different countries! In three short years, we have become Europe's largest music festival platform.

Furthermore, we've announced Series B funding - https://techcrunch.com/2016/06/30/festicket-let-it... - and now we're looking to grow the Festicket Family!

YOUR ROLE
Festicket is looking for talented Business Development Intern to support our commercial / business development team. You will be responsible for maintaining our event / music festivals client database as well as supporting the development of new businesses. You will be supporting the Business Development Managers, in day to day work and taking care of all the administrative takes of the ‘extras’ team which are responsible for the additional products/services Festicket offers 

This is a great opportunity to learn in a fast-paced environment, and a chance to building strong analytical and commercial skills.

REQUIREMENTS
* Experience / interest in sales, business development, partnerships or commercial development
* Have a confident telephone manner
* Demonstrate an ability to manage projects, focus on achieving objectives, adjust priorities, manage time and follow up on actions
* Show an ability to work autonomously and be able to take responsibility beyond scope of role
* Actively look for new solutions and create new ideas regarding the on-going commercial development.
* Be aware of and take responsibility for implications of decisions
* Have the ability to cope in a high-pressure environment

DESIRABLE
* Experience in Travel, Leisure, or Tourism, with a desire to learn more about the industry
* Experience in Ticketing in live events/music, with a desire to learn more about the industry
* Speak an additional European languages (e.g. French, Italian, and Spanish)
* Competent with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Photoshop, HTML, Adobe Pro and Keynotes
* Outgoing, enthusiastic and highly motivated

BENEFITS

We’re a team of 70 located in an amazing converted piano factory in Camden (NW1 8LH) a short stroll from Camden market and Primrose Hill. By joining us you will be part of one of the fastest growing music / travel start-up companies in Europe, where you will have ample opportunity for career progression as we continue to grow.

We have a company culture which is very idea orientated and driven but also very social. It's entirely normal at 6pm on a Friday for half the company to be drinking together in the office and then planning to head out for a night out.

items.title: SaaS Business Development Exec (English, German or Dutch speaking)
items.content:
About us
We are an established SME, which has strengthened during 2016 and we are now expanding after a period of planning. Get ready for a phase of fast growth. We provide both software-as-a-service and supporting services such as digital marketing. We work with accommodation owners and operators and specialize in the serviced apartment sector.

See our core SaaS business at this website: http://elinapms.com/
25 days of holiday per year, in addition to the 8 statutory bank holidays
Salary open to discussion depending on experience.

The role
The role is to work as part of the ElinaPMS, driving client acquisition to grow the German or Dutch markets, and support on UK market. Reporting into the Commercial Director, who leads the sales and marketing team, and supports on sales.

1. Contact prospects outbound. Contact serviced apartment businesses in Germany to gauge interest in ElinaPMS. We have clients already there and we believe this market can be expanded.
2. Support on inbound leads for the sales team. Give demo’s on ElinaPMS. Know the product really well. Be able to give a fantastic demo. Then follow up to close the sale with price negotiation and contract.
3. Manage the CRM. Keep the CRM up to date with prospects, leads and opportunities. Manage your pipeline and work with your team.
4. Give great feedback. Share what is and isn’t working. Help the team build better sales pitches, case studies, sales documents, and pricing strategies. We always evaluate how we can do better when we have great people.

Success looks like signing 4 or more new clients for the company each month after training, in the German or other markets. Although, we have excellent feedback that the product is a good fit for the German market.

Requirements – 2+ years in a sales role

 You have conducted outbound calls with success
 You know how to learn and pitch products
 You believe sales follow up is important
 You like working with a solid basic, but excellent bonus
 You can negotiate
 You have used sales CRM to manage your leads and opportunities
 Beneficial if you have experience in hospitality, but not essential,
 Degree educated
 Languages: Written and spoken English. Spoken and written Dutch / or German
 Must hold a UK work and residence visa

items.title: Business Development Lead at Funded Edtech Startup
items.content:
HowNow is a global platform that enables experts to teach learners anywhere in the world over live, interactive video chat. There are millions of people with expertise around the world that could be teaching and millions more who do not have access to high quality teaching. Backed by Mark Pearson (Founder of MyVoucherCodes) and Tennis Star Andy Murray, HowNow are bringing these people together, beyond borders, and changing the way the world learns.

We’re looking for a sales extraordinaire with entrepreneurial flair, brilliant communication skills and the passion to build a startup from the ground up. This is a really exciting opportunity, as we are building out the sales team from scratch. It’s exactly the right time to join a well funded, startup and grow with the company. The first people who come into the team will have the opportunity to set up the structures and processes, shape the team, and become the future leaders for sales at HowNow.

*What you’ll be doing*

• Proactively source, pitch and rapidly grow the number of experts/teachers around the world, using HowNow to teach online
• Create and implement a target-focused business development strategy
• Own the sales process: Client research, pitch management, pipeline management, sales optimisation and reporting
• Work with clients from demo to onboarding to account management
• Work with the team to create sales campaigns contributing to top line goals.
• Create and engage a community of experts/teachers.

*What you need*

• The ability to sell and hit targets
• Creativity, passion and an entrepreneurial flair
• Exceptional communication and presentation skills
• Highly motivated, autonomous and determined to succeed
• Data-driven with strong analytical skills, comfortable with Excel
• 1+ year experience in B2B sales
• Experience of online learning as a consumer is a must
• A history of working hard and getting results.
• Experience in sales for a marketplace or in the education sector will be a bonus

*What you get*

• A competitive salary with uncapped commission
• Work directly with the founders who have built a startup that has been awarded Business of the Year, named Top 100 Startup in the UK and have been recognised by Virgin Media Business as one of the most innovative founders in the UK.
• Generous perks and holidays
• Consideration for share options
• Work with a passionate team of hustlers changing the way the world learns.
• The satisfaction of building something that matters and spending your time in a meaningful way.

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER -- REMOTE OK. Open Source developer on Open edX (OpenCraft - Remote/worldwide company based in Berlin)
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER -- REMOTE OK. Open Source developer on Open edX (OpenCraft - Remote/worldwide company based in Berlin)

Development specialized on the free software project Open edX, used by many universities and companies to run online courses. See edx.org, stanford.edu or fun-mooc.fr for examples of Open edX instances. We are a team of ten developers, working remotely from Europe, North America, Asia, Russia & Australia. The company is not affiliated with edX, but contributing and working with them on various projects. This is a full time position, were you would be able to work remotely from where you want, as long as you have a good internet connexion. : )

It's a large Python/Django codebase, with good code standards and architecture (a lot of the edX engineers come from MIT). You would work on different clients contracts using the platform. The clients list/references include Harvard, edX themselves, the French government, and various startups & universities currently running their own instances, or looking to create one. Tasks are varied, from developing developing core platform features, custom exercises and tools for specific courses (XBlocks), customizing and deploying instances, working on both client/server sides, etc.

Most of your work is published as free software (Open edX is released under the AGPL license, which requires clients to release modifications under the same license), and you would also contribute to the free software project, pushing some of your developments upstream through pull requests, contributing features, documentation or help on mailing-lists.

Stack: Python/Django, Ansible, AWS/OpenStack, Debian/Ubuntu, JS, HTML/CSS, MySQL, MongoDB

Interview process: a 15 minutes (simple) coding exercise & a 30 minutes Hangout.

To apply, fill this form: http://opencraft.com/jobs/open-source-developer/

items.title: SEEIKING WORK - iOS, Android App and Unity Game Development.
items.content:
SEEIKING WORK - iOS, Android App and Unity Game Development.

Hello, we are an 8 years old team of mobile app and game developers, currently looking for new assignments in terms of mobile apps, or games or web apps.We can work on both native and cross platform technologies of app; and our skills are iOS, swift, objective-C, Android, Java, react native, cordova, Unity with C#, PHP, Laravel.

Contact me at sudeep@agicent.com, or see our portfolio at http://www.agicent.com.

items.title: Atlas | Full Stack Developer | PHX, MSP, DC, NYC, SF | $90-130k + benefits | Full-time, REMOTE or ONSITE | http://atlas-x.com/careers Small ...
items.content:
Atlas | Full Stack Developer | PHX, MSP, DC, NYC, SF | $90-130k + benefits | Full-time, REMOTE or ONSITE | http://atlas-x.com/careers

Small businesses have come to expect intuitive, fast, and beautiful software in their personal lives yet deal with old, slow, and clunky software in their business lives. We are changing that.

We need talented full stack developers who have empathy for users and love making thoughtful and simple solutions to complex problems; developers who want to see their software used daily and witness a visible improvement in the daily lives of employees, families, and businesses. We need developers to help us transition and build our experiences and codebase into scalable products.

Our favorite tools include Node, C#, Angular, Kendo, and React. items.content2:
*********** scalesolved ***********
Kudos for listing your salary, I've given you an upvote and hope you float to the top and get lots of attention!


*********** stefek99 ***********
Unlimited vacation :) Can I start now?


*********** foepys ***********
Unlimited vacation comes down to placing the burden of taking time off on the employee. It's mostly there to deter employees from taking time off and to keep a competitive environment. "X left for 30 days last year, Y only 15. Y seems to be more invested in their work."

Don't let this fool you, it's more often a trap than it's not.


*********** stefek99 ***********
"deter employees from taking time off"

How come?

My understanding is - communicate with the team - know the release dates - be working in critical moments...

Personally I would love to work 6 months a year or 3-4 days a week... To travel and to develop my side projects. Treating job as a way to pay bills in expensive city like London.

Unless - my personal incentives are aligned with the company - very often it's not the case.


*********** foepys ***********
You need to ask yourself: Why does the company do this? Why does the company not grant everybody 50 vacation days by default and encourage employees to work more by paying out small bonuses (like $500) for not taking more than 50% of their vacation days?

It's because they want the employees to not take any days off. Peer-pressure is insanely strong in those environments. You are supposed to feel bad to letting your colleagues do the work, while you voluntarily (!) take time off. Especially at start-ups there is always something for you to work on.

As an employee it's easier to agree on like 25 vacation days/year beforehand because then it's in the contract and both parties can point to it when there are problems. If a colleague has a problem with someone taking more vacations days, it comes down to their own inability to negotiate more days for themselves; not to some "backstabber" leaving their colleague behind for some fun.

As I said, there are cases where unlimited vacation days work out but I would say those are the lucky 1%.


*********** loumf ***********
Your understanding of what unlimited vacation means is not correct. It means: "more vacation than most jobs, probably" -- let's say about 5-6 weeks with stray days here and there.


*********** kafkaesq ***********
Well, that's what they want you to think it means. The reality is that it means something quite different.

But either way -- just by calling it "unlimited vacation", they're f-ing with you from the very start.


*********** gourabmi ***********
This is the most comprehensive reply on this post today. Kudos for the transparency!


*********** drodil ***********
Best reply this far.

*********** sonthonax ***********
Just saying 40-70k is pretty low. Is that all the BBC has to spend on it's hiring budget?


*********** systemtest ***********
You get a lot of job securities in the UK. That usually results in a lower wage (risk mitigation costs money).


*********** sonthonax ***********
I'm from the UK, I know this first hand.


*********** jrimbault ***********
Why does this conversation always comes back ? Yes salaries aren't the same both side of the Atlantic. But the laws and taxes and advantages and etc etc aren't the same either.


*********** johnnyfaehell ***********
To be fair Facebook come in at 70k in London.


*********** pyb ***********
I've heard that Google pay less in London than they do in any of their US offices.


*********** taurath ***********
70k in London is like 70k in SF. Pretty incredible if you ask me. Must be a cost center.


*********** jerednel ***********
That's still pretty high for a London wage though. While living costs are the same, salaries are about half across the board in London. Just moved back from there.


*********** taurath ***********
I suspect that the finance industry doesn't have that problem in London. Someone's buying up all the 2mil quid houses (other than oil wealthy investors).


*********** expertentipp ***********
If the salaries are half, is the recruiting process accordingly easier in London?


*********** kkhire ***********
how do people get by with 70K in london?


*********** Ended ***********
People get by with a lot less. The median household income in London was £39k in 2013 [1]

[1] https://data.london.gov.uk/apps_and_analysis/gla-household-i...


*********** Wintamute ***********
Dude ... you can "get by" on £70K in London. Most people get by on MUCH less. £70K would get you a nice rental flat, eating out anytime you like and still saving about £20-30K a year. And that's if you're single, if you're sharing expenses you could save more.


*********** mino ***********
"get by", seriously?

The median salary for London is £34,473 (2015 data).


*********** SirHound ***********
With that salary you could easily save £1500 a month


*********** sjg007 ***********
It's $85k usd. So yes low.


*********** pleasecalllater ***********
As I was looking for some remote job in UK, Ireland, and USA, I noticed that the salaries in Europe are generally lower than in the US. No much lower, but there is a noticeable difference between $120k in US, and $80k in Europe for the same position, similar company, and contract in both cases.


*********** jcadam ***********
And I'm also assuming that remote positions in Europe aren't going to include any medical insurance. Which makes those jobs a total no-go for an American.


*********** rullopat ***********
For London is not that low at all. And... in the rest of Europe is generally lower.


*********** nikon ***********
This is a lead position. 70k is low.


*********** drodil ***********
True, in Finland it's very good if you get 50k. Most SW engineers work for 25-40k salaries.

True it's relative. I think transparency is an approach. An approach that helps create a healthy workplace and contributes to more productive and happier people.(Also we have not stated that we are fully transparent. Transparency is hard, but I strongly believe in the approach)

items.content:
Automattic (WordPress.com, Jetpack, WooCommerce, .blog, Polldaddy, Gravatar) | Search Wrangler | Full Time | REMOTE

We're a distributed company with employees in >50 countries. Help us influence search and recommendations for the 27% of the Web that runs on WordPress.

We're looking to take our search infrastructure up a few notches. A bit on what we're working on:

- We have some good distributed systems deployed that we are constantly improving: https://data.blog/2016/05/03/state-of-wordpress-com-elastics...

- Various versions of search, related posts, and recommendations have been launched over the years, but we've only recently had good enough tracking to easily test algorithm changes at our scale. Lot's of new data available for improving search relevancy.

- Billion plus unique users of our search systems each month, searching in every language that humans use.

- Search is not just about the algorithm. We're working to build great user interfaces and product integrations that engage users.

No walls around the garden. Make the Open Web a smarter place.

items.title: ConvertKit | Senior Rails Engineer | REMOTE ConvertKit is looking for Senior Rails Engineers.
items.content:
ConvertKit | Senior Rails Engineer | REMOTEConvertKit is looking for Senior Rails Engineers.

  * We are a 100% remote company, scattered across 8 states and 4 countries. There is no central office.  * Bootstrapped, profitable, and growing very quickly (See for yourself! https://convertkit.baremetrics.com)  * We put a high emphasis on work / life balance, and we value and strive for 40 hour work weeks.  * We have a positive, vibrant, and genuine culture. (see https://charlimarie.com/2017/02/06/finding-my-place)

We're facing real (fun) scaling challenges because of our incredible growth. Ideally you've been there, done that before.We're also looking for someone who cares deeply about writing clean, maintainable, well-tested code, and generally tends to leave code in a better state than when they encountered it.

About youYou’re a perfect fit for this role if you’ve got experience developing software, love pragmatic OO design for its long-term cost benefits, and testing. Clean code is not just a phrase for you. Given our high rate of growth, you'll need to have strong knowledge of scaling Rails applications up.

Benefits:

  * 3 weeks paid vacation, 7 paid holidays, and 3 sick days / year. 4 weeks paid vacation after a year of employment.  * The team gathers twice a year in-person for fantastic team retreats (https://youtu.be/1L0en33hfqI)  * Excellent Health benefits.  * 8 weeks paid maternity / 4 weeks paid paternity leave.  * $2500 equipment allowance given every 2 years.  * 4% matching 401k.  * Conference credit.  * $1,000 yearly vacation bonus.  * Profit sharing!
Apply here: https://convertkit.workable.com/jobs/466250

We are not the type of organisation that has fully-specified product definitions and just need engineers to put their head down & churn out code. As with any early-stage startup, we are product focused, looking to get quick feedback from potential customers with short development iterations.

items.title: Viking Education | Course Mentor | Remote | Part Time | http://www.vikingcodeschool.com
items.content:
Viking Education | Course Mentor | Remote | Part Time | http://www.vikingcodeschool.com

Viking Code School is a 100% online development bootcamp driven by the mission of launching a million high-growth careers around the world regardless of a student’s location, prior experience or economic standing.

Our mentor-led Flex Program pairs students with industry veterans who perform weekly code reviews as part of the learning process. It is a great chance to pass on your knowledge without leaving your day job (or your house). As a mentor, you work with your mentee(s) during their full time in the course, which typically takes between 6-12 months to finish. You meet with your mentee 1-3 times per week for code review and can work with anywhere from 1 to 10+ students, depending on desire and ability.

Our back end has two tracks (Ruby/Rails or Node/Express) and our front end covers JavaScript/React/Redux. As a mentor, you have access to the course materials so you can get up to speed on anything you aren't firm on.

Check-ins are compensated.

Requirements:

* 4+ years of professional development experience as part of an engineering team.

* Strong grounding in CS fundamentals like Data Structures and Algorithms.

* Relevant experience with CS, Ruby/Rails, SQL, JavaScript/React etc.

Email careers@vikingcodeschool.com with your CV, links and anything else that would prove your development or teaching ability and general awesomeness.

items.content:
Cloudcraft | Senior Software Engineer | New York (NYC) | REMOTE, FULL-TIME or CONTRACT https://cloudcraft.co

We're looking for Senior Software Engineers with significant JavaScript and React experience, preferably full-stack.

At Cloudcraft we provide tools for software development teams, currently focusing on products that help teams working with AWS. Join our small, 100% remote, product engineering team and you'll have the chance to make a big impact and take significant ownership of our software and your own work.

Today our stack consists of JavaScript (100% ES6+), with React on the frontend and Node.js on the backend, PostgreSQL, Redis, Ansible, and literally every single AWS service due to our product's unique nature. You'll be doing a lot of learning and experimenting on the job!

Our ideal candidate is self-motived, has excellent written and verbal communication skills, is interested in UX and has a sense of aesthetics, and is always looking to improve and learn. Experience with AWS services, graphics programming or SVG rendering, existing contributions to open source or personal github projects are a huge plus.

We're bootstrapped, profitable and growing. Competitive salary and serious about work-life balance.

To apply, please email jobs@cloudcraft.co, include "HN - Cloudcraft" in the subject line. No recruiters, please.

items.title: Honeycomb | London, UK | Software Engineer | Remote first, London office, https://honeycomb.tv/
items.content:
Honeycomb | London, UK | Software Engineer | Remote first, London office, https://honeycomb.tv/

Hi, I'm Louis! I'm one of the engineers here at Honeycomb. There are 12 of us on the engineering team right now, and we're looking to grow!

Honeycomb are building a next generation Ad Delivery network for Broadcast and Online publishers. Our platform is enabling faster, cheaper delivery of ads from creative agencies and post houses.

Our tech stack is largely Ruby on Rails, though we are breaking out into services and believe in using the right tool for the job (currently we have one service in Node, and another in Go). We use Ansible, Docker, CircleCI and Jenkins to deploy to Linux (and some Windows) on AWS and Azure. We believe in TDD, CI/CD, pair programming, and agile practices.

We work remote first, though those of us that live in England tend to meet at the London office once a week.

Honeycomb is a place of equal opportunity, we believe that the best teams are ones with a diverse background. We are on a journey to make our team “diverse by construction” and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, gender and ethnicity.

Would you like to join us? Reach out to me on louis.pilfold@honeycomb.tv :)

items.content:
Portchain | Full stack software engineer | Copenhagen, DK | REMOTE, Full time, https://www.port-chain.com

Stack:React/mobX, Electron, Node.js, PostgreSQL

90% of all goods are transported in containers. The largest container vessels can take on 20,000 containers at a time. The industry is struggling like never before, and is fundamentally inefficient: 50% of all container vessels globally are delayed coming into port, most communication is conducted through phone and even fax, paper is still used in abundance, there can be over 15 process handovers moving a container, and there are large regional differences in performance among players.

We want to change that, and bring the industry into the digital age. Portchain (www.port-chain.com) is a Danish startup founded by 3 McKinsey alums in February 2017 that aims to significantly reduce operational cost and complexity for all players while providing industry leading customer experience. From our office in Bredgade next to Amalienborg, we are ramping up our team from five people to ten over the next four months. As such we are hiring only the highest caliber developers to join our team, and help reshape shipping.

items.title: Silicon Valley Bank | API Banking Engineer | San Francisco, CA | Full-Time | Onsite / Remote (US) http://docs.svbplatform.com Enable the ...
items.content:
Silicon Valley Bank | API Banking Engineer | San Francisco, CA | Full-Time | Onsite / Remote (US) http://docs.svbplatform.com

Enable the world of FinTech by building public APIs for commercial banking. We're using clojure & postgres to expose brand new, easy to use, well documented RESTful interfaces for clients. Among other projects we work on, our small team created the technical integration with Stripe that powers Atlas (https://stripe.com/atlas). Our team consists of former Facebook, Disqus, and Standard Treasury (YC S13) engineers; startups are in our DNA.

With an aggressive roadmap of new products we'd like to launch in 2017, we're looking to expand our team to help deliver new APIs. While we don't currently have any full time remote employees on our team, we are open to remote US-based engineers helping us become a fully-distributed team.

Our interview process is designed to be respectful of your time; we have a short (~1h quiz) to get a baseline assessment of your technical skills, followed by a broader parsing problem (~4h project) to understand how you solve technical problems in a more realistic scenario. Both steps can be submitted on your schedule. These code samples avoid complications with whiteboard interviews and establish a consistent sample for all applicants.

Unfortunately, we're not able to provide detailed feedback on individual submissions, and we can't sponsor visas at this time.

Contact Mike at api-jobs@svb.com for more information and to apply.

http://docs.svbplatform.com/jobs/api-engineer.html

items.title: Inductive Automation | https://www.inductiveautomation.com | Software Engineer | Folsom, CA
items.content:
Inductive Automation | https://www.inductiveautomation.com | Software Engineer | Folsom, CA

Come help develop the future of software used in industrial automation. In this position, you would join our core product development team. Together, we work to build our primary product, Ignition.

This position is focused on implementing and maintaining network protocols for communicating with industrial controllers (PLCs, RTUs, etc…) as well as the system responsible for bridging data from those implementations into the Ignition platform. Responsibilities include new feature and protocol development as well as the maintenance and enhancement of existing functionality.

We are a tight-knit team of developers working every day to delight customers worldwide with a product they actually need. If this sounds like something you’d like to be part of we look forward to talking to you.

Requirements

- B.S. in Computer Science, or equivalent experience- Minimum 5 years of programming experience- Strong Java 8 skills- Experience writing server and networking code- Experience writing highly concurrent multithreaded code- Modern toolchain and source control familiarity, e.g. Maven/Gradle and Git/HgSkills Not Required, But a Plus- Experience with OPC Classic or OPC UA- Experience with industrial automation fieldbuses or protocols such as Modbus, EtherNet/IP, Omron FINS, Siemens S7, Emerson/Fisher ROC, ABB Totalflow (DB/DB2), etc- Experience with PLCs and/or PLC programming- Any other relevant experience in industrial automation

https://inductiveautomation.com/about/careers/senior-softwar...

You can also contact me at my email address in my profile.

items.title: REMOTE (Worldwide) - Open Source Developer on Open edX - Python/Django, Javascript (OpenCraft - Remote/worldwide company based in Berlin)
items.content:
REMOTE (Worldwide) - Open Source Developer on Open edX - Python/Django, Javascript (OpenCraft - Remote/worldwide company based in Berlin)

Development specialized on the free software project Open edX, used by many universities and companies to run online courses. See edx.org, stanford.edu or fun-mooc.fr for examples of Open edX instances. We are a team of ten senior developers, working remotely from Europe, North America, Asia, Russia & Australia. The company is not affiliated with edX, but contributing and working with them on various projects. This is a full time position, were you would be able to work remotely from where you want, as long as you have a good internet connexion. : )

It's a large Python/Django codebase, with good code standards and architecture (a lot of the edX engineers come from MIT). You would work on different clients contracts using the platform. The clients list/references include Harvard, edX themselves, the French government, and various startups & universities currently running their own instances, or looking to create one. Tasks are varied, from developing developing core platform features, custom exercises and tools for specific courses (XBlocks), customizing and deploying instances, working on both client/server sides, etc.

Most of your work is published as free software (Open edX is released under the AGPL license, which requires clients to release modifications under the same license), and you would also contribute to the free software project, pushing some of your developments upstream through pull requests, contributing features, documentation or help on mailing-lists.

Stack: Python/Django, Ansible, AWS/OpenStack, Debian/Ubuntu, JS, HTML/CSS, MySQL, MongoDB

Interview process: a 15 minutes (simple) coding exercise & a 30 minutes Hangout.

To apply, fill this form: http://opencraft.com/jobs/open-source-developer/

items.content:
GE Power | Sr. Secrurity Engineer (Programmer) | Atlanta, GA USA | http://www.ge.com/careers/opportunities?keyword=2749772

About us:We're a new team of software engineers focused on helping the business build secure software on GE's Predix platform (predix.io).

About the role:

We build security tools for development teams (CI/CD security plugins, platform scanners, log aggregators), security focused libraries (2 factor authentication, OAuth wrappers, encryption wrappers), and anything else that might help our teams be more secure.

We also embed directly with product teams as security focused developers - ensuring user stories around security are being implemented, teaching developers about secure coding, and building the most sensitive parts of our critical applications.

Technology focus areas:GE is a big company, and we support teams that use all sorts of languages, frameworks, and technologies. The most frequent technologies we work with are:

* Java with SpringBoot * Angular * Polymer * Node

Other languages I am seeing more of: Python, Ruby, Elixer, GoWhen we build internal tooling, we pick the best tools for the job.

What we look for:Great programmers who love security and understand secure coding. Experience with the technologies listed above, CI/CD, TDD, and general development best practices is key.

If you love to code, understand how to find, exploit, and fix vulnerabilities in web apps, and want to help us build security tooling and improve app, I'd love to chat!

ApplyYou can find the full job posting at http://www.ge.com/careers/opportunities?keyword=2749772, or go to ge.com/careers and search for job number 2749772

You can also just reach out to me with questions!

items.title: TuneIn | All types of software engineer and ops jobs | San Francisco, CA and Los Angeles, CA | Full-time, ONSITE, ...
items.content:
TuneIn | All types of software engineer and ops jobs | San Francisco, CA and Los Angeles, CA | Full-time, ONSITE, http://tunein.com

San Francisco, CA - close to Caltrain, across the street from AT&T ParkLos Angeles, CA - Venice Beach, 2 blocks from Venice Beach Boardwalk

Onsite preferred though we've hired remote folks before. Visa transfers ok and we support new green cards. New visas only if straightforward.

Experienced backend, devops, Android, iOS, and data engineering are our priorities right now. Always looking for full stack and/or web devs as well.

http://tunein.com/careers/

TuneIn’s mission is to deliver the world’s best listening experiences. We achieve this by being the most popular way to listen to streaming audio from around the world with more than 60 million monthly active users. Our free service combines over 100,000 free radio stations and more than 5.7 million on-demand programs stemming from every continent, so our users can listen to the world’s sports, music, news and talk from wherever they are. TuneIn Premium encompasses all of that as well as exclusive content, streaming sports from every major league in the US (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL...), TuneIn Owned and Operated stations including curated content, audiobooks, and over 600 commercial free music stations. Our users cover iOS, Android, Web, and dozens of connected platforms.

Our stacks are built on MySQL, HBase, MSSQL, Redis, DynamoDB, Golang, .NET, React.js, es6, Swift, and a few more. We believe in using the right tool for the job.

We value being a top-notch engineering organization, and have the same high standards with our code and our people. We hire well-rounded, full-formed, communicative people whom we can envision being friends with and trusting. We make time for quality, are pragmatic, strive to keep it simple, are data driven, and love getting better. Our projects tend to be 1-2 engineers, so trust and accountability are required for us to work - and helps us keep processes & overhead to a minimum. We've built a robust team and are always striving to be the best place to work we can be.

Check out our projects and principles on Github here: https://github.com/tunein/engineering/

items.title: Wisdom | Cryptocurrency Applied to APIs | Moraga, CA | REMOTE/ONSITE | Founder
items.content:
Wisdom | Cryptocurrency Applied to APIs | Moraga, CA | REMOTE/ONSITE | Founder

Wisdom is a project-in-progress I have been working on for a few years which applies cryptopayments to API method calls to implement the 402 Payment Required response code for HTTP based requests using Bitcoin or other cyptocurrencies, which will eventually add support for the Lightning Protocol. A PoC of an early version of the idea was featured here on HN 3 years ago: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=8069386. Time has passed since then and the idea, and technologies required for building it, have evolved. It is my belief the time for this idea, from a market-perspective, has arrived.

The service will be designed to improve the process of integrating a company's API product with channel partners, either on-prem or in a hosted manner, with the intent to increase pass-through revenue on the API calls a company provides, while providing a simple federated layer based on blochchain backed data structures. This idea is in pre-funding, so I'm explicitly stating anyone interested in my idea should consider their founder-level involvement as purely self-choice driven. Influencing, making or removing choice for you in this regard is illogical and irrational, given the state of the company (non-existent) and funding (also non-existent). However, if you hold the view that the existing methods for securing the Internet's infrastructure are woefully inadequate and you feel applying cryptocurrency to APIs could make companies more money by securing them against use by limiting calls with payments, then you should contact me and we should have a conversation about it.

Expertise in building scalable API calls with microservices-based architecture is desired, but a more general gift in development is also welcome. I code in Python, Javascript and C++, and am decently good at running infrastructure, given my history. My primary function is strategy, operations and architecture. I do not visualize, so I tend to communicate differently.

My email address is in my profile here on HN. Happy to just discuss the idea, if you are interested, as opposed to any expectation of finding someone this early on to join me.

If you've read this far, I appreciate you. I will note that this idea can be applied to AI in a less than obvious way. This reason is the primary purpose of the project, but making revenue in other ways first remains important.
