items.title: Android SDK engineer - Aol - Remote, OR
items.content:
Android SDK engineer
Aol -Remote, OR
Job Description

Android SDK Engineer
We are looking to expand our SDK and Ad Formats team with engineers that value collaboration, strong communication skills, and have a strong desire to create quality products. The primary focus of this team is building SDKs which publishers (app developers) use to show ads and creating new ad experiences which enable compelling advertising on our mobile advertising platform. It also creates mobile applications and tooling to support our internal teams in building advanced mobile ads.
Technologies
We have three main technology focuses: Android, iOS, and Full-stack Development. Any given day you have the opportunity to work with many technologies, including Java, C/C++ Objective-C, Ruby, Javascript, HTML, CSS, PHP, SQL, NoSQL. We use Git via Github for managing our projects, JIRA for tracking, and TeamCity as our automated build platform.
Experience
We looking for people that have demonstrated proficiency in at least one technology, but most importantly we’re looking for people who’ve demonstrated that they can adapt to new technologies and have a passion for it. You might be a full-stack developer looking to break into mobile, mobile looking to expand into full-stack, or improving your chops in your specialty. Our environment provides opportunities for all.
Our ideal candidate has a platform specialty which is ideally one of iOS, Android, or Full-stack development, and the desire to add sub-specialties as needed to deliver quality software. Remote work is possible. Qualifications

Required Skills
Demonstrated expertise in Java and at least one scripting language Ruby, Python, or Javascript
Experience using or building RESTful web services
Experience writing with Behavior Driven or Test Driven Development, mobile platform experience a plus
SQL Database experience: MySQL, SQLite, Core Data, or other
Experience writing concurrent programs, preferably in a mobile environment
Deep understanding of software design patterns and architectural principles
HTML, CSS, and Javascript development skills a plus
Strong engineering background with source control, testing, and quality software production
Must understand process is important to produce quality software
Education/ Experience
2+ years of object-oriented programming experience
1+ years building complex applications for Android
Must have experience leading and mentoring other developers
Strong background computer science fundamentals in algorithms, data structures, and discrete mathematics, BS or MS in Computer Science a plus
Open source contributions a plus

Additional Information

Aol is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Aol employees are rewarded competitively and are entitled to a wide range of benefits that encourage a positive lifestyle. Our recruitment team will always welcome any conversations about flexible working requirements.
We do not accept resumes from placement agencies, headhunters or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with you.

items.title: Remote Java Software Engineer (Microservices Architecture) - Contract - Conexess Group, LLC - Work at Home
items.content:
Remote Java Software Engineer (Microservices Architecture) - Contract
Conexess Group, LLC -Work at Home
Contract
Title: Remote Java Software Engineer (Microservices Architecture)

Our History:
From our start in 2009, Conexess has established itself in 3 markets, employing nearly 150+ individuals nation-wide. Operating in over 15 states, our client base ranges from Fortune 500/1000 companies, to mid-small range companies. For the majority of the mid-small range companies, we are exclusively used due to our outstanding staffing track record

Who We Are:
Conexess is a full-service staffing firm offering contract, contract-to hire, and direct placements. We have a wide range of recruiting capabilities extending from help desk technicians to CIOs. We are also capable of offering project based work.

Job Description

Conexess Group is seeking a Java Software Engineer to join our team. This position may require up to 15% travel and occasional overnight or extended hours as business needs dictate.

As a Java Software Engineer with Conexess, you’ll get the chance to make a real, positive impact on people’s lives. Our mission is to give people the best possible experience they can have with their finances. We’re doing this by re-imagining the online banking ecosystem and building products that empower and delight. The Java Software Engineer, under moderate supervision, participates in the technical design and implementation of new products or enhancements. Additionally, they will participate in all phases of the development cycle: concept, technical design, prototype, code development, testing, release to QA and implementation.

About our team

We are committed to creativity, thoughtfulness, culture, and openness—the perfect place to make phenomenal products that have a big impact on peoples lives. Our work environment echoes a modern tech startup but we have the security and benefits of a large, publicly traded company. With an engineering team of less than 100, we place high value on continued education. You’ll get the chance to contribute to products that are used by thousands of people.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • 3 years of technical experience in software development building java applications
  • 3 years of experience using technologies: Eclipse, Bootstrap Spring Core, Spring Boot, Spring MVC
  • 3 years of experience using Microservices architecture
PREFERRED SKILLS
  • Data related skills: Postgresql, Elasticsearch, MongoDB
  • Experience with the Atlassian tool suite (JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo)
  • Experience with Spring Integration, Spring Security
  • Experience with HTML5, AngularJS, jQuery
  • Experience with RabbitMQ is a plus
  • Experience using modern build tools such as Maven, Jenkins a plus.
  • Cloud ETL experience is a plus. Ex. Clover Engine
  • Pivotal Cloud Foundry experience is a plus
  • Proficiency with Git source control systems
  • Good working knowledge of SOA, Web Services methodologies using RESTful or SOAP based API’s
  • Ability to work as a member of dynamic team using Agile Scrum and Kanban development methodology
  • Firm commitment to unit tests, automated testing and continuous integration
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (CS), Software Engineering (SE)
  • Excellent written, verbal, and listening communication skills.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
  • Completes product technical design and prototyping, software development, bug verification and resolution.
  • Performs system analysis and programming activities which may require extensive research and analysis.
  • Provides technical/engineering support for new and existing applications from code delivery until the retirement of the application.
  • Provides both individual and budget-level tasks and product effort estimates/costs.
  • Ensures timely, effective, and quality delivery of software into production, both at an individual and team level.
  • Develops and tests applications based on business requirements and industry best practices.
  • Creates required technical documentation.
  • Adheres to documented departmental and corporate standards. Participates in the definition and documentation of standards.
  • Collaboratively works with QA team to ensure timely delivery of high-quality products.
  • Collaboratively works with customer support team to resolve or diagnose defects.
  • Performs release validation testing and beta support for projects.
  • Researches problems and develops solutions to the problems.
  • Conducts unit testing and integration testing for functionality and limits.
  • Assists in training and mentoring less experienced peers.
  • May contribute to product architecture.
  • May assist less experienced peers.

Haybrook IT Resourcing Ltd acts as an employment agency and an employment business.

• Fabrique (Amsterdam, The Netherlands)

    • Developer

    We’re looking for a creative developer who sees programming as an art form

    Revitalising. Making the difference. At Fabrique we create work that means something. For ourselves, our customers and also, whenever possible, for society. We call this ‘work with impact’. What do you bring to make this possible?

    You

    are a developer with a university degree (preferably computer science or AI) and at least 4 years of work experience. Thanks to your solid insights into web-related problems you understand that innovation is technology driven. You’re proficient in at least one server-side programming language and are familiar with, or curious about, frameworks like React and Angular. You get bonus points if you have *NIX skills and experience with app building (Android / iOS). And we just love Django! A vast knowledge of front-end development, JavaScript and SASS isn’t required, but an understanding of these will set you on the right track to create award-winning work with our designers. And if you’re willing to learn Dutch, we’ll be very pleased.

    We

    are a strategic design agency, specialized in service design, app development, e-commerce and website design. We can offer you an inspiring work environment and a superior tech team in which you can bring out the best in yourself. You’ll get to work on projects that push boundaries. Think about the Van Gogh multimedia tour, National Military Museum interactives, the Wolfgang-app, the Heijmans website and other work for national and international A-brand clients.

items.title: Senior ReactJS Developer - Netlify - (San Francisco, Remote) - FullTime
items.content:
• Netlify (San Francisco, Remote)
  • Fulltime Job

    • Senior ReactJS Developer

    We’re looking for an experienced front-end developer who loves working on open-source projects, enjoys interacting with a community, and is capable of being the driving force behind some of our key open-source projects at Netlify.

    You should love building tools for other developers, and enjoy the balance between polishing every little piece of UI on the one hand, and shipping at startup speed on the other.

    Our core tools at Netlify are React and Redux with a dash of Webpack and a whiff of Babel, but it’s more important that you have a solid foundation as a developer and a good sense of architecture and clean code. Frameworks and tools come and go, but the fundamentals stay the same.

    Our Ideal Candidate

    • Has a strong grasp of multiple programming languages, with a focus on modern JavaScript and its ecosystem
    • Has experience with React and Redux
    • Loves a Git-centric workflow with continuous deployment and solid tooling
    • Understands the internals of Git (how trees, commits, blobs, and references work and relate to one another)
    • Is unafraid of digging into new tools, frameworks, and platforms
    • Thrives in an environment where experimentation and failure are celebrated
    • Gives and receives feedback with regard for both emotional and technical concerns

    We Offer

    • Equity
    • Competitive salary
    • Benefits for you and your dependents
    • Lunch, snacks, and drinks at the office
    • Your choice of equipment
    • A strong founding team with backgrounds at GitHub, Docker, Yelp, and more
    • A great office space in San Francisco’s Dogpatch
    • The opportunity to help us change the fundamental way sites have been made for the last 15 years

    About the Company

    The traditional approach to making websites is being disrupted by new technologies. Static site generators, build automation tools, and Git are leading the way.

    Netlify has rolled all the services needed to take your code, build it, and host it on our CDN into a single automated platform. Creating modern, high-performance websites and applications is simpler, cheaper, and more secure than ever.

    We are devoted to building a team of people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We eagerly invite applications from people of all kinds. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, race, citizenship, pregnancy status, or any other differences whatsoever that folks imagine discriminating against one another. If you have a disability, please do let us know what we can do to better accommodate you in our hiring process.

    We’re based in San Francisco and are looking for someone local, but we’re also open to remote employment for the right candidate.

items.title: Software Engineering Manager @ Collage.com
items.content:
Software Engineering Manager @ Collage.com

2017-03-29 02:07

Description

About Collage.com

Collage.com's mission is to make custom products easy for everyone. We strive to do this by providing superior software and excellent customer service. We sell an expanding variety of photo and home products, including photo blankets, photo books, canvases, pillows, and more. Our company has been featured on the TODAY Show, The View, and Good Morning America many times. We are a profitable, 100% employee-owned company that has rapidly grown to 50 employees and $22M annual revenue over the past five years.

As a remote company, our development team is set up to empower individuals. The less time developers spend dealing with cumbersome processes and inefficient systems, the more time they have to solve problems and make an impact. We believe in staying at the forefront of best practices so that we can focus on work that matters. We pass almost all of The Joel Test (we only fix high-priority bugs before writing new code, but hey, we're a start-up), follow the best practices for continuous deployment (anything that is merged following a pull request goes straight to production), and have implemented a declarative unidirectional data flow system (like Flux, but on steroids) for our most complex logic. Difficult projects with extensive cascading data dependencies take days instead of months, allowing us to provide best-in-class design tools and iterate more quickly than our competitors with much larger development teams.

We are seeking an ambitious and nice engineering leader who shares our passion for building a great software company. As a 100% remote organization (read about our remote workplace at remote.co), this is a unique opportunity to define how a software team should communicate, have fun, and produce results without being confined to an office. You will join a team of managers who are excited about improving best practices, teaching developers, and delivering a great product. Our goal is to continue our fast pace of growth while creating the best possible work environment for engineers to be happy, productive, and grow professionally.

Learn more about working and developing software at Collage.com.

Responsibilities

  • Be the people manager for several engineers of varying skill levels, teaching them to communicate effectively, write excellent code, and test it well through code reviews, performance reviews, and regular one-on-one feedback.
  • Assign work, help developers overcome roadblocks, and oversee testing to ship high-quality software on schedule.
  • Develop software hands-on at all points in the stack, walking others through their most difficult tasks and pushing projects to completion by working on areas where you have expertise.
  • Balance product work with eliminating technical debt, establishing processes, and adjusting responsibilities to maximize your team's efficiency and plan for the future.
  • Work closely with product managers to establish our product roadmap. Specify technical solutions to customer needs and define our code architecture.

Required Qualifications

  • Excellent full-stack developer with several years of coding experience who can write clean, well-structured web applications and push others to do the same. Must be familiar with MV* Javascript frameworks, PHP, and SQL.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage and grow a team of software developers.
  • Passion for teaching - You prioritize helping others to become autonomous above stepping in and doing things yourself.
  • Strong writer who can clearly explain technical issues to a non-technical audience.
  • Exceptionally meticulous and organized - With several direct reports working on different projects and no physical office space, you will have to juggle many responsibilities at once.
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent work experience.

Benefits and Perks

  • Working from home makes it easier to focus on results and develop professionally while spending less time commuting. (See our opinion piece on perks and work-life balance at mlive.com.)
  • 401(k) plan, home internet reimbursement, and $3,000 / year in free Collage.com products plus employee discount for friends and family.
  • Collage.com pays 100% of the premium for full health, vision and dental insurance coverage for you and your family in a high-quality Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO plan.
  • Flexible work schedule and unlimited vacation policy (work hard and take time when you need it).
  • We'll pay for any computer and home office equipment (within reason) that will help you work better.

The Interview Process

We strive to provide a transparent interview process that maximizes the chances of success for qualified candidates. Like all new members of our engineering team, you will start with a brief phone screening interview that tests basic Javascript coding ability. After that, you will speak with another software engineering manager for an hour to assess your qualifications, make sure there is a mutual cultural fit, and answer any questions you have about the position.

After we have verified your background, experience, and basic coding ability, we will give you a take-home assignment. The goal of this series of assignments is to simulate real on-the-job work at Collage.com as closely as possible and assess your performance. The first part, which we also give to non-management engineering applicants, involves implementing a basic UI from scratch in Javascript. The second part is a code review test where we ask you to provide feedback on a sample pull request for adherence to general best practices like object-oriented design patterns, avoiding repetition, etc. Finally, we ask you to write a technical specification that tells a developer how to structure code given a set of high-level requirements. The whole test is about four hours long and takes the place of an on-site technical interview.

Following the take-home test, you will have phone calls with a developer you will be managing, a non-technical product manager, and both founders of the company. The goal of these interviews is to develop a mutual understanding of what it would be like to work together and assess strengths and weaknesses not captured by earlier parts of the interview process. While we only plan to hire one candidate for this position, we will make an offer as early as possible after the final interview.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Intelligent Routing API @ Twilio
items.content:
Sr. Software Engineer - Intelligent Routing API @ Twilio

2017-03-23 11:33

Description

TaskRouter is at the heart of Twilio’s biggest and most complex customer deployments. In 2017 it will be Twilio’s fastest growing product, growing at least 1000%. From major enterprises like ING to multi-billion dollar software companies like Zillow, TaskRouter powers the core logic of their customer experience. We're looking for a Sr. Software Engineer/Lead to join our team and help us architect and scale the system in excess of that growth rate while maintaining a highly available mission critical service.

About the job:

You will be a key member of the TaskRouter team working with the senior leads on the team to evolve and scale existing services with points of presence globally. In addition you will also work on the creation of new services that would provide powerful additional capabilities to developers on top of existing API’s and will require experience working with distributed SQL, NoSQL databases and caches.

Responsibilities:

  • Join a small, high-impact, multi-talented engineering team with preference of San Francisco, CA but open to Mountain View or Remote.
  • Write high quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage.
  • Own, operate, and maintain your team’s services in a distributed production environment. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.
  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems you can face developing highly available services in a distributed cloud environment that needs to scale.
  • Excel as an engineer and be a productive member of the team where leadership is a behavioral trait, not a title.

Requirements:

The TaskRouter team believes in versatility and complementing proficiencies being key to forming the best team. We are looking for senior-level talent with a variety of skills and specializations. You should have at least 3 to 4 of the proficiencies below to be considered for the role:

  1. Java. You are a rock-solid backend Java developer and use it regularly. You know and apply OO and best practices in Java and know how to build scalable REST services. This is a key language for the team.
  2. Internet-scale services. You understand scalability challenges and performance of server-side code in an environment where load sometimes more than doubles month over month. You can design and develop horizontally scalable, resilient and high performance REST services. You’re familiar with distributed datagrids like Hazelcast.
  3. Databases. You’re comfortable with SQL databases and replication schemes to enable high availability with failover. You have expert level experience with traditional RDBMS databases.
  4. Cloud. You are proficient in cloud technologies and are hands-on in at least one cloud platform: AWS, Azure or GCC. You are able to both design and develop cloud-based systems and operate them in an automated fashion.
  5. Testing. You are passionate about quality and can engineer it at all stages of software development. You are able to design and develop a quality pipeline requiring as little human intervention as possible.
  6. Security. You are able to design secure distributed systems and assure operational processes around security. You understand fitness for purpose of security techniques.
  7. Agile. You are an expert in practical aspects of running Scrum (or other agile methodologies) within a team and in a distributed cross-team environment. You know how to ship rapidly and frequently.

Bonus points:

  • Sound understanding of CI/CD build and deployment toolchains.
  • Experience working with Dropwizard.
  • Experience working with Node/React framework.
  • Experience with NoSQL databases.
  • Experience working in a DevOps environment.

About us:

Twilio's mission is to fuel the future of communications. Developers and businesses use Twilio to make communications relevant and contextual by embedding messaging, voice and video capabilities directly into their software applications. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 650 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Country

Anywhere

Description

About EMEX

EMEX, a rapidly growing online energy broker, helps customers procure the best electricity and natural gas rates. We're building a revolutionary platform that is changing the way energy is bought and sold in the US. Our unparalleled broker management system powers our internal operations, as well as that of our many partners.

We are looking for a full-time senior software engineer with a focus on Ruby and RoR. We would prefer a candidate near Houston, TX or Portland, OR, but are also open to remote work anywhere in the US for the right person.

Our Team

Our development team works on a variety of systems, all part of our auction platform and broker management system. There is no shortage of challenging problems to tackle, and team members have broad experience across the platform.

We care first and foremost about delivering value in a sustainable way. Quality is incredibly important to us, and we strive for excellence.

Our process revolves around a Kanban board and Github PRs. In a typical day, our developers talk with the business team, write code, review & discuss pull requests with other devs, and deploy to the live site (usually several times a day.) We have evolved a development process that enables us to respond quickly to market opportunities.

Our team is split between onsite and remote. Throughout the day, we primarily communicate over Slack and Google Hangouts. At least once a year, we gather as a full team in the Houston office.

Tech Stack

  • Ruby, Rails
  • MySQL, Redis & ElasticSearch
  • React and Redux
  • RSpec, Capybara and Continuous Integration
  • Chef for infrastructure automation

Why work for us?

What we're looking for in you:

  • The ability to see projects through to completion

This position is only open to individuals with the ability to take a full-time position. No agencies, please.

Our team creates innovative solutions that work well under pressure allowing for new business models to tested rapidly in any market.


We’re looking for A-players, and part of that involves autonomy. You will be assigned tasks, both small and large, and a general time frame, but given the autonomy and freedom to schedule your own daily tasks as long as you complete what needs to get done. We understand and respect that you know development better than we do and it’s not our place to call unnecessarily strict or irrational deadlines and ways of completing tasks. This may be a good place to add that you should, when applying, mention your favorite food and, if you’re feeling ambitious, include a picture: this is to weed out applicants who mindlessly apply en masse to listings.


Given the above mentioned autonomy and freedom, you will be expected to debrief with a daily summary of what was accomplished, problems you ran into, what’s planned for the coming days, and maybe a joke or two. :)


We are a fun, friendly, and closely knit team, and although geographically distant, we have a strong work ethos and communicate regularly allowing for a very friendly and efficient work environment. Being a part of a new division within an established company, you get the best of both worlds in terms of job security and company culture. We work hard and expect the same from all of our team members.


We work hard, but we also play hard. You should come with a great sense of humor and a smile on your face, because you’ll have a few laughs and enjoy your time working with us. We reward hard work with a variety of perks incorporated in our flexible working environment.

items.title: Senior Ruby Engineer
items.content:
HotDoc is venture backed by AirTree Ventures. Check out their newest opportunity below!


HotDoc is a Series-A funded software startup that helps promote better health outcomes for all Australians by improving the way that patients and doctors communicate. We’re passionate about building products that have real impact on patient health outcomes and delivering services that support the sustainability of Australian healthcare.

Over the past twelve months, our team has tripled in size, and we’re really excited about the growth that is still ahead of us. We’re on the lookout for a Senior Ruby Engineer who will contribute to HotDoc’s platform that helps hundreds of thousands Australians every year gain better access to healthcare.

A day in your life as a member of our Melbourne-based team will involve developing key new features from inception to production and integrating them with cutting edge health technologies. You’ll also have the opportunity to take ownership of new products and actively turning ambitious ideas into elegant tools that directly impact patient outcomes across the country.

In return, you’ll have the chance to work as part of a results-driven team that recognises great work, offers flexible work hours, encourages ongoing learning, and provides plenty of development opportunities on projects that actually excite you. You’ll also be joining an early stage Australian startup that has the potential to grow into something huge within the SaaS industry, work within an amazing culture that values collaboration, a sense of humour, and loves to celebrate success.

items.title: Full-stack Javascript / Node.js Developer
items.content:
Full-stack Javascript / Node.js developer (remote possible)
#NodeJS #Javascript #MongoDB
So far, weÃ¢Â Â ve built a helpful software product that is used by some of the most advanced Social Media Teams in germany and europe. Now we want to move forward and expand our dev team to make our software more scalable and to enrich it with a lot of great features that will help our customers to work better as a team. If you are looking for a job in an growing SaaS startup and you love to work with latest technologies like node.js and mongoDB, this could be it.

Similar Job openings:

Front-End Developer (React, Backbone & Fully Remote)
About SocialHub
WeÃ¢Â Â re an internet startup located in Ingolstadt, Germany and our team of 20 has invented a software which companies like the Deutsche Bahn, Rossmann or Media-Saturn use to manage their Facebook and Twitter profiles (SocialHub). Now weÃ¢Â Â re expanding our team and are looking for people that help us pushing our software to the next level.

Remote Work possible
Working together face2face is great, but we discovered that the best way to attract great people to our team is to offer everybody the freedom to work from wherever they want. That's why we hire onsite in our office in Ingolstadt and remotely. It's your choice. Pick the place that works best for you.
What our clients say about SocialHub
Excerpts from client quotations

Does this sound like you?
  • You love to work with the latest Web-technologies
  • YouÃ¢Â Â ve been making your way through the nodejs/iojs world for at least 3 years, have developed a good bunch of applications and have a good overview on the available modules to aid you in your tasks
  • You know your pal mongoDB and what makes him cranky (performance wise)
  • You like your automated tests finished before you even start the main coding
  • You love to see your users happy. Therefore you donÃ¢Â Â t hesitate to help clients if the need arises for solving bugs.
  • Using a DVCS like git comes natural to you

Experience you should have
  • Working experience in developing scalable webapps
  • Experience in working in a software development team
  • Knowledge of the Social Network APIÃ¢Â Â s from Facebook, Twitter, Ã¢Â Â¦
  • At least 3 years of experience

What we have to offer
  • a really nice team and a relaxed, productive working atmosphere
  • the possibility of working partly or completely from home (Remote)
  • regular outlandish team events
  • Slack channels that will make you smile :-)
One thing is very important to us: that our dev team has fun at work and that they let future clients feel that. In return, our team is completely free and can choose where and when they work (one day on the office, the next from the home office or completely remotely). We only employ full time staff in the dev team.

Sounds interesting?
If that sounds like a dream job to you then send us your application. Application can be as short as you like it do be. DoesnÃ¢Â Â t have to be formal. We like to know what you have done so far, what you love to do and some links to projects youÃ¢Â Â ve done (f.e github link or similar).

We look forward to meeting you!

Your SocialHub-Team

Tags: Full-stack Developer, Javascript Development, Coder Jobs, Job developer homeoffice, Remote dev job, Node.JS developer

To apply: https://socialhub.breezy.hr/p/357376b951fb-full-stack-javascript--node-js-developer--remote-possible?source=weworkremotely

items.title: Software Engineering Manager
items.content: <html><head></head><body>__About Collage.com__Collage.com's mission is to make custom products easy for everyone. We strive to do this by providing superior software and excellent customer service. We sell an expanding variety of photo and home products, including photo blankets, photo books, canvases, pillows, and more. Our company has been featured on the [TODAY Show](http://blog.collage.com/2013/10/25/total-request-collage-blanket-for-carson-daly/), [The View](http://blog.collage.com/2015/10/05/collage-com-on-abcs-the-view/), and [Good Morning America](http://blog.collage.com/2015/08/06/collage-com-on-good-morning-america-with-up-to-76-off-gallery-wrap-canvases/) many times. We are a profitable, 100% employee-owned company that has rapidly grown to 50 employees and $22M annual revenue over the past five years.As a remote company, our development team is set up to empower individuals. The less time developers spend dealing with cumbersome processes and inefficient systems, the more time they have to solve problems and make an impact. We believe in staying at the forefront of best practices so that we can focus on work that matters. We pass almost all of [The Joel Test](https://www.joelonsoftware.com/2000/08/09/the-joel-test-12-steps-to-better-code/) (we only fix high-priority bugs before writing new code, but hey, we're a start-up), follow the best practices for continuous deployment (anything that is merged following a pull request goes straight to production), and have implemented a declarative unidirectional data flow system (like [Flux](https://facebook.github.io/flux/), but on steroids) for our most complex logic. Difficult projects with extensive cascading data dependencies take days instead of months, allowing us to provide best-in-class design tools and iterate more quickly than our competitors with much larger development teams.We are seeking an ambitious and nice engineering leader who shares our passion for building a great software company. As a 100% remote organization ([read about our remote workplace at remote.co](https://remote.co/company/collage-com/)), this is a unique opportunity to define how a software team should communicate, have fun, and produce results without being confined to an office. You will join a team of managers who are excited about improving best practices, teaching developers, and delivering a great product. Our goal is to continue our fast pace of growth while creating the best possible work environment for engineers to be happy, productive, and grow professionally.[Learn more about working and developing software at Collage.com.](http://jobs.collage.com/) __Responsibilities__* Be the people manager for several engineers of varying skill levels, teaching them to communicate effectively, write excellent code, and test it well through code reviews, performance reviews, and regular one-on-one feedback.* Assign work, help developers overcome roadblocks, and oversee testing to ship high-quality software on schedule.* Develop software hands-on at all points in the stack, walking others through their most difficult tasks and pushing projects to completion by working on areas where you have expertise.* Balance product work with eliminating technical debt, establishing processes, and adjusting responsibilities to maximize your team's efficiency and plan for the future.* Work closely with product managers to establish our product roadmap. Specify technical solutions to customer needs and define our code architecture.__Required Qualifications__* Excellent full-stack developer with several years of coding experience who can write clean, well-structured web applications and push others to do the same. Must be familiar with MV* Javascript frameworks, PHP, and SQL.* Demonstrated ability to manage and grow a team of software developers.* Passion for teaching - You prioritize helping others to become autonomous above stepping in and doing things yourself.* Strong writer who can clearly explain technical issues to a non-technical audience.* Exceptionally meticulous and organized - With several direct reports working on different projects and no physical office space, you will have to juggle many responsibilities at once.* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent work experience.__Benefits and Perks__* Working from home makes it easier to focus on results and develop professionally while spending less time commuting. ([See our opinion piece on perks and work-life balance at mlive.com](http://www.mlive.com/opinion/index.ssf/2015/08/perks_schmerks_the_one_thing_t.html).)* 401(k) plan, home internet reimbursement, and $3,000 / year in free Collage.com products plus employee discount for friends and family.* Collage.com pays 100% of the premium for full health, vision and dental insurance coverage for you and your family in a high-quality Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO plan.* Flexible work schedule and unlimited vacation policy (work hard and take time when you need it).* We'll pay for any computer and home office equipment (within reason) that will help you work better.__The Interview Process__We strive to provide a transparent interview process that maximizes the chances of success for qualified candidates. Like all new members of our engineering team, you will start with a brief phone screening interview that tests basic Javascript coding ability. After that, you will speak with another software engineering manager for an hour to assess your qualifications, make sure there is a mutual cultural fit, and answer any questions you have about the position.After we have verified your background, experience, and basic coding ability, we will give you a take-home assignment. The goal of this series of assignments is to simulate real on-the-job work at Collage.com as closely as possible and assess your performance. The first part, which we also give to non-management engineering applicants, involves implementing a basic UI from scratch in Javascript. The second part is a code review test where we ask you to provide feedback on a sample pull request for adherence to general best practices like object-oriented design patterns, avoiding repetition, etc. Finally, we ask you to write a technical specification that tells a developer how to structure code given a set of high-level requirements. The whole test is about four hours long and takes the place of an on-site technical interview.Following the take-home test, you will have phone calls with a developer you will be managing, a non-technical product manager, and both founders of the company. The goal of these interviews is to develop a mutual understanding of what it would be like to work together and assess strengths and weaknesses not captured by earlier parts of the interview process. While we only plan to hire one candidate for this position, we will make an offer as early as possible after the final interview.</body></html>

items.title: Seasoned Python Developer

You have excellent Python coding skills and a strong understanding of the Django framework; you understand how to use both in building RESTful APIs. Bonus points if your background touches on marketing!

items.title: Front End Developer
items.content: <html><head></head><body>__ABOUT THE POSITION__WeÃ¢Â Â re looking for an experienced front-end developer who loves working on open-source projects, enjoys interacting with a community, and is capable of being the driving force behind some of our key open-source projects at Netlify.You should love building tools for other developers, and enjoy the balance between polishing every little piece of UI on the one hand, and shipping at startup speed on the other.Our core tools at Netlify are React and Redux with a dash of Webpack and a whiff of Babel, but itÃ¢Â Â s more important that you have a solid foundation as a developer and a good sense of architecture and clean code. Frameworks and tools come and go, but the fundamentals stay the same.WeÃ¢Â Â re based in San Francisco, and are looking for someone local, but weÃ¢Â Â re also open to remote employment for the right candidate.__OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE__* Has a strong grasp of multiple programming languages, with a focus on modern JavaScript and its ecosystem* Has experience with React and Redux* Loves a Git-centric workflow with continuous deployment and solid tooling* Understands the internals of Git (how trees, commits, blobs, and references work and relate to one another)* Is unafraid of digging into new tools, frameworks, and platforms* Thrives in an environment where experimentation and failure are celebrated* Gives and receives feedback with regard for both emotional and technical concerns__ABOUT THE COMPANY__The traditional approach to making websites is being disrupted by new technologies. Static site generators, build automation tools, and Git are leading the way.Netlify has rolled all the services needed to take your code, build it, and host it on our CDN into a single automated platform. Creating modern, high performance websites and applications is simpler, cheaper, and more secure than ever.We are devoted to building a team of people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We eagerly invite applications from people of all kinds. We donÃ¢Â Â t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, race, citizenship, pregnancy status, or any other differences whatsoever that folks imagine to discriminate against one another. If you have a disability, please do let us know what we can do to better accommodate you in our hiring process.__WE OFFER__* Equity* Competitive salary* Benefits for you and your dependents* Lunch, snacks, and drinks at the office* Your choice of equipment* A strong founding team with backgrounds at GitHub, Docker, Yelp, and more* A great office space in San FranciscoÃ¢Â Â s Dogpatch* The opportunity to help us change the fundamental way sites have been made for the last 15 years</body></html>

items.title: Django Developer
items.content:
SpiderOak is looking for a senior-level Django developer to help build out our backend web systems and our enterprise integration stack. You will need to be comfortable with building, nurturing, and deploying complex Django projects at scale. A mastery of how Linux interacts as part of the application stack and some DevOps (specifically Docker) experience is a must; as well as experience in writing queries for, deploying, and maintaining, PostgreSQL. You must be able to work with the team in navigating building and shipping complicated code on a tight time budget, with as much automated tooling and testing as possible. Finally, you should be comfortable working with the team on code review and security hardening. Our customers put a lot of faith in us, and it is imperative that we maintain their trust.


Preference for Kansas City area candidates, but remote work is possible. Significant overlap with US Central time zone required. You will be expected to communicate regularly with the rest of your team, working out problems and collaborating in a daily basis to drag projects across the finish line. The ability to take lead on projects falling under your responsibility is paramount. While we do not use a strict Agile methodology, it is important that your development be focused around a feedback loop with your peers as you work, and you must be familiar and comfortable with regularly working through the code of both you and your teammates as work progresses. We require a basic working proficiency in the written and spoken English language, and the ability to travel to the United States 1-4 times a year for team meet-ups.


Much as we believe in internet privacy for all, we do not discriminate in who we choose to be part of our team. We know no boundaries based on race, ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexuality, or other terms humans use to separate the 'us' from the 'them'. If you can do the job and communicate readily, we will be happy to work with you.


We offer a compensation package including paid vacation, holiday, and personal time for all, and US workers enjoy a full benefit package including medical, dental, vision, life, and short and long term disability insurance.


Our interview process involves a phone conversation and then work sample testing.


Still interested? Apply online at https://spideroak.com/about/careers.

items.title: Software Engineer Intelligent Routing API
items.content: <html><head></head><body>TaskRouter is at the heart of TwilioÃ¢Â Â s biggest and most complex customer deployments. In 2017 it will be TwilioÃ¢Â Â s fastest growing product, growing at least 1000%. From major enterprises like ING to multi-billion dollar software companies like Zillow, TaskRouter powers the core logic of their customer experience. We're looking for a Sr. Software Engineer/Lead to join our team and help us architect and scale the system in excess of that growth rate while maintaining a highly available mission critical service.__About the job:__You will be a key member of the TaskRouter team working with the senior leads on the team to evolve and scale existing services with points of presence globally. In addition you will also work on the creation of new services that would provide powerful additional capabilities to developers on top of existing APIÃ¢Â Â s and will require experience working with distributed SQL, NoSQL databases and caches.__Responsibilities:__* Join a small, high-impact, multi-talented engineering team with preference of San Francisco, CA but open to Mountain View or Remote.* Write high quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage.* Own, operate, and maintain your teamÃ¢Â Â s services in a distributed production environment. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.* Tackle some of the most challenging problems you can face developing highly available services in a distributed cloud environment that needs to scale.* Excel as an engineer and be a productive member of the team where leadership is a behavioral trait, not a title. __Requirements:__The TaskRouter team believes in versatility and complementing proficiencies being key to forming the best team. We are looking for senior-level talent with a variety of skills and specializations. You should have at least 3 to 4 of the proficiencies below to be considered for the role:1. Java. You are a rock-solid backend Java developer and use it regularly. You know and apply OO and best practices in Java and know how to build scalable REST services. This is a key language for the team.1. Internet-scale services. You understand scalability challenges and performance of server-side code in an environment where load sometimes more than doubles month over month. You can design and develop horizontally scalable, resilient and high performance REST services. YouÃ¢Â Â re familiar with distributed datagrids like Hazelcast. 1. Databases. YouÃ¢Â Â re comfortable with SQL databases and replication schemes to enable high availability with failover. You have expert level experience with traditional RDBMS databases.1. Cloud. You are proficient in cloud technologies and are hands-on in at least one cloud platform: AWS, Azure or GCC. You are able to both design and develop cloud-based systems and operate them in an automated fashion.1. Testing. You are passionate about quality and can engineer it at all stages of software development. You are able to design and develop a quality pipeline requiring as little human intervention as possible.1. Security. You are able to design secure distributed systems and assure operational processes around security. You understand fitness for purpose of security techniques.1. Agile. You are an expert in practical aspects of running Scrum (or other agile methodologies) within a team and in a distributed cross-team environment. You know how to ship rapidly and frequently.__Bonus points:__* Sound understanding of CI/CD build and deployment toolchains.* Experience working with Dropwizard.* Experience working with Node/React framework.* Experience with NoSQL databases.* Experience working in a DevOps environment.__About us:__Twilio's mission is to fuel the future of communications. Developers and businesses use Twilio to make communications relevant and contextual by embedding messaging, voice and video capabilities directly into their software applications. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 650 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in BogotÃ Â¡, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn.Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.</body></html>

items.title: Front End JS Developer Full Stack Competency Cambridge Family Supportive
items.content:
What We Care About


We are proud of our success in developing and maintaining continuing education solutions to medical professionals. Our solutions enable medical organisations and schools to advance their learning and continuing education programs, propelling healthcare forward in technology. This is a growth market, and we are excited to add to our expanding team.


Your Impact

At the operating level you will utilize your knowledge and understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Angular (2), as well as cross-browser differences and web standards. You will take projects from design conception through all layers of the Node.js stack from database, to server, to front end, as well as influencing the range of associated back end services.

items.title: Ruby On Rails Software Engineer

You would:

  • Work closely with our experienced team to make Leadfeeder better every day
  • Develop the Leadfeeder product and the backend systems
  • Develop new integrations for Leadfeeder

Benefits

  • Flexible hours and possibility to work remotely for everyone
  • An interesting and growing field of business

items.title: Sr Frontend Javascript Developer
items.content:
Are you passionate about Javascript SPAs, efficient client-side performance and building software for millions of users?


We need a smart developer to help entend our frontend Javascript clients for our microservice architecture of 18 loosely coupled services. It’s in production, supporting multiple brands and driving millions of dollars of revenue every month from US sales.


We are a remote-first company with a globally distributed team of 55. We’re proud of the way we get great work done. Our clients love working with us and we partner with them on long-term projects. Are you looking for a new challenge? This is fun!


What do we offer?



  • Work as part of a talented, globally distributed, successful team

  • A focussed adherence to our agile/scrum processes (we really believe it helps getting good work done)

  • Hard problems to solve (you won't find all the answers on Stack Overflow) - and the opportunity to own the solutions

  • A great working atmosphere where you can share and learn with other smart people

  • The best-in-class toolsets: Slack, CI/CD with Docker etc

  • Meetups in our Barcelona offices for our remote folks

  • Competitive rates

  • A long term working relationship


You'll be:



  • Building complex Javascript (mainly ES6, webpack, backbone/marionette) presentation layers to consume RESTful APIs in a performant way.

  • Working on ecommerce and back-office direct sales functionality to support hundreds of thousands of customers.

  • Helping the backend engineers in designing, specifying and implementing services to decouple functionality

  • Occasionally going full stack and diving in the the Rails services to add a new endpoint or modify behavior (and we can help you learn here too)

  • Working within a fast moving team (working 11am - 8pm Central European time)

  • Identifying bottlenecks, using tools to diagnose and refactor code for scale

  • Ensuring the robustness, performance and failure characteristics of the system.

  • Writing well tested, defect free code with CI/CD

  • Taking ownership of production applications - managing issues, releases and ensuring quality


Good English verbal and written communication skills are essential. As is production experience of Backbone.js/React/Vue/Angular framework applications.


This is a contract position with a long term outlook (12 months+ full-time project) for the right candidate. We are looking for remote workers (most of the company is remote) or have openings based in our Barcelona office.

items.title: Senior Dev Ops Engineer
items.content:
*DESCRIPTION*
Festicket is transforming the way music fans discover and book tickets and travel packages for festivals around the world. Our platform revolutionises the music festival industry by offering an end-to-end experience for music travellers through an efficient two-sided marketplace for 900+ music festivals across 50 different countries! In three short years, we have become Europe's largest music festival platform.

*YOUR ROLE*
We're looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer who specialises in all things AWS.

We've had a big funding round in the middle of last year and our technical team is growing rapidly (from 4 to 16 people so far). We need to bring our technology and infrastructure up-to-date to meet the business's ambitions for the next few years. This includes migration to the Cloud (currently in progress) and implementing a React SPA as our customer facing site (with all the architecture changes that come with this).

We are a team of 16 looking to grow to over 20 immediately. To do this we need a dedicated DevOps Engineer to manage our infrastructure and build the development, testing and deployment processes for our expanding technical team.

*THE STACK*
http://stackshare.io/festicket/festicket

*REQUIREMENTS*

*YOUR ATTITUDE*
You're someone who's smart, organised, motivated and gets things done. You want to work in a startup environment, because you like the idea of doing a bit of everything and taking ownership of what you work on. You have ideas about everything, and you're not afraid to argue your point (while respecting everyone else's of course). You're constantly thinking "how can we do this better?".

You're passionate about:

* creating robust, flexible and performant infrastructure using the latest technology and best practices
* making the development workflow as smooth and efficient as possible through automation and tooling
* creating and managing effective continuous integration & delivery/deployment processes
* being an integral part of the development process, not just a system administrator, and working in a collaborative technical team

*YOUR SKILL SET*

Must have:
* Expert in provisioning, operating and managing all things AWS (we make use of ELB, EC2, ECS and ECR, RDS, Redshift, CloudFormation and many more...), ideally 5+ years experience, minimum 3 years.
* Expert in Docker based systems
* GNU/Linux system administration and networking
* Git
* Expert in CI/CD workflows and tooling
* Experience with configuration management (ideally Ansible) and IaC (ideally CloudFormation)
* Excellent knowledge of Python, with development experience
* PostgreSQL
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g New Relic, Datadog, Sentry, Kibana)
* An excellent understanding of high availability, load balancing and service discovery concepts and technologies
* A computing or software engineering degree. In the absence of one we expect you to show that you've taken steps to fill this gap in your training/knowledge.

Nice to have experience with:

* Django
* React
* Node
* Celery
* ChatOps
* E-commerce websites

*BENEFITS*
We're a team of 70 located in an amazing converted piano factory and recording studio in Camden (NW1 8LH) a short stroll from Camden market and Primrose Hill. By joining us you will be part of one of the fastest growing music / travel start-up companies in Europe, where you will have ample opportunity for career progression as we continue to grow.

We have a company culture which is very idea orientated and driven but also very social. It's entirely normal at 6pm on a Friday for half the company to be drinking together in the office and then planning to head out for a night out.

Benefits also include:

* Cycle-to-work scheme
* Free tickets for music festivals worldwide
* Free breakfast - including cereals, bread, marmalade, etc.
* Weekly delivery of beers, food, snacks, fruits and drinks
* Weekly Friday drinks
* Fun monthly company events
* Regular internal Ping Pong tournaments
* Sales Trainings & budget for conferences
* 1 remote working day per month
* Regular team lunches
* Perks - free Festicket T-shirts, Jumpers and more
* Fun environment & great office next to Primrose Hill
* Value driven start-up culture.

items.title: Node.js Back-end Blockchain Developer - Award Winning Product
items.content:
*Node.js Back-end Blockchain Developer - Tallysticks.io*

Here at Tallysticks, we are revolutionising invoice financing through blockchain technology and are now looking for to grow the team.

Tallysticks is a young start up, around since 2015, and we have developed an exciting and industry-changing solution to a problem many SMEs that work in big supply chains face: cash flow and invoice financing. Our solution is a portal that SMEs, large corporates and financiers can access to help with this funding gap by utilising blockchain technology.

We have developed an award-winning product and now want to tweak the the product and further develop our portal based on user feedback.

*_We are looking for someone who:_*

* Wants to build an industry-changing blockchain product
* Can take ownership from the get-go and work with minimal guidance
* Ideally has experience of building enterprise applications in Financial Services
* Has experience and a proven track record building full-stack applications with JavaScript / Node.js

*_The details_*

* Immediate start but we’ll wait for the right person
* £35k-£60k & equity negotiable based on experience
* The position is London-based at Level 39, Canary Wharf with some travel required
* We offer flexi-time but cannot offer remote work

*_Responsibilities_*

* Server-side development of the product based on a revised technical architecture and current client feedback
* Work with the technical and commercial team to make technical decisions and consolidate product delivery
* Primarily, to deliver the product a number of clients ranging from SMEs to large corporates

*_Required Experience_*

* Min. 4 years experience with Node.jd
* Has understanding of security and cryptography
* Has experience of web paradigms such as REST, WebSockets
* Linux command line
* Good knowledge of modern JavaScript: ES6, Babel
* Build, testing and automation tools
* Cloud computing platforms: Azure, AWS
* ElasticSearch, Redis, SQL databases and NoSQL databases
* Experience in distributed ledgers, decentralized applications and blockchain platforms such as Ethereum and Hyperledger
* DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Continuous integration & delivery, site reliability



_NO RECRUITERS_

items.title: A London based startup is looking for a lead back-end developer
items.content:
Company Introduction
GreenRide Sharing is UK’s only dynamic carpooling mobile applications. We allow the drivers to share empty car seats on their journeys as they driver; and the passengers to get door to door at the price of the public transport.
GreenRide is founded by 3 co-founders in February 2016. We have recently won Shell’s award for future cities and mobility. We are soon to soft launch our mobile applications in 3 targeted London boroughs. You can check our website for more information: www.greenridesharing.com
We are currently based at Google campus near Old Street station. As we are a fast-growing start-up, you have the unique opportunity to make a real and direct contribution.

Job Description
We are looking for a Back-End Server Developer responsible for improving and maintaining our back-end systems. You will directly work with our founders, particularly our CTO.
Your primary focus will be on development of all server-side logic and APIs, definition and maintenance of the database structure, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end.
A basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.

Responsibilities
Optimization of the back-end Python code for maximum speed and scalability
Update/maintain the back-end algorithm where necessary
Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developer with server side logic
Building reusable code and libraries for future use
Skills And Qualifications
Proficient knowledge of a back-end programming (Python and Django; MySQL; PHP).
Experience with AWS infrastructure
Basic knowledge with GIS data
Experience with OpenStreetMap and routing server is a bonus, but not necessary.
Experience with algorithms is a bonus, but not necessary.
Basic understanding of front-end technologies and platforms, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 will be a bonus.
Time to Start: As soon as possible

items.title: Working Student JavaScript Developer (m/w)
items.content:
Do you already have experience in using Frontend JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React or Ember.js? You have a strong interest in working with Ember.js on Single Page Applications? And in addition you have a good knowledge of HTML/CSS? Then we are thrilled to get to know you!

About the job
You will work with an existing Ember application and be responsible for implementing new features, polishing existing features and improving frontend tests to integrate more closely with our RESTful API
You will work with modern browser APIs to record video across multiple browsers and platforms, and work closely with Node.js, Django and Flask applications in a Docker-driven environment
You will work in an agile team alongside an experienced Ember developer and 3 experienced Python developers

Requirements
Experience with single page applications using Angular, React, Ember.js or similar
Strong interest in working with Ember.js
A good feel for delivering great user experience and design using HTML5 and CSS3
Very good communication skills and business fluent English (German is not required, but would be an advantage)
Finally, we appreciate great team spirit, a sound business understanding and the motivation to build fantastic products

Our offer
Interesting and challenging work on market-proven products that already positively affect the future career decisions of tens of thousands of professionals in various countries
Nice, down-to-earth and experienced colleagues who have big ambitions to make a dent in the recruiting universe
Working in a nice and bright office in the middle of Berlin-Kreuzberg and all the latest equipment you need to be super productive
Several perks & benefits, such as free drinks and food in the office, Telekom hotspots, monthly travel pass (BVG ticket), regular team events (from basketball matches to TEDx conferences), lots of free (or heavily discounted) vouchers, leisure activities, etc.
And finally, after a probation period, every team member can participate in our stock ownership programme

About viasto

viasto is a Software-as-a-Service company, based in the center of Berlin. Our product, the interview suite, allows companies to get to know their job applicants via video in order to avoid wrong selection decisions, mainly in high-volume recruitment processes. Our service is used by large corporations, such as Beiersdorf, Microsoft and Telekom, as well as successful startups like Goodgame Studios, Lovoo and Trivago. If you want to make a difference in your work and are convinced that recruiting can be made a whole lot better, then you’re in the right place. We’re always looking for talented and motivated team members with a hands-on approach and an ambition to succeed.

Interested?

We look forward to receiving your application including your CV, your tech stack, references and if possible code samples or a link to your github profile. In case you cannot provide code samples we would happily invite you to a little challenge.

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
We are looking for a senior full stack developer to join our team and help us finish building, and then refine our suite of AdTech products.

There is a range of products that you will be working on across the adtech stack, from campaign tracking and reporting software, to a Demand Side Platform and Data Management Platform.

The work is pretty varied and we always try to keep ourselves working on something interesting. We have an open, collaborative culture and work within an agile project management methodology.

We mostly work in python and node at the moment but we are platform agnostic and happy to try out new technologies. Key Skills Required are:

- python

- nodejs

- HTML/CSS

- Backbone.js

Ideally you will have several years experience building for the web, preferably in an adTech environment. We have a relaxed culture, encouraging flexible working, regular team lunches, private health insurance, and EMI options.

The salary is between £40k and £50k depending on experience.

items.title: Statistics/Optimization Software Developer (m/f)
items.content:
We are looking for a Statistics/Optimization Software Developer (m/f)

Adspert was founded in Berlin in 2010 and our innovative technology launched just one year later. Based on trading systems used in banks to do stockmarket trading, Adspert automatically organizes and optimizes online advertising. Bertelsmann Digital Media Investment and the Bell Group's support Adspert as strategic partners and investors.

Today, around 20 Adspert employees are hard at work in the heart of Berlin, passionately Implementing the vision of developing bid management of the future.

We offer:
We develop our solutions with Python, Go, JavaScript and PostgreSQL and mainly work on Linux and Mac. Distributed version control, test-driven development and automated deployment processes are basic working methods. With us, you can expect a friendly atmosphere and a healthy attitude to the balance between work and leisure.


Your profile:
– Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline or equivalent practical experience.
– Professional knowledge of relational databases (ideally PostgreSQL).
– Experience in implementing solutions to statistical problems, preferably with Python and SciPy.
– Version control and automated tests are essential to any software project for you.
– You try to find simple solutions to complex problems and find ways to objectively assess the quality your approach.

Your tasks:
– Build statistical models for different effects in the online advertising market.
– Implement robust estimates that provide plausible results even in difficult cases.
– Evaluate the result quality of existing implementations.
– Use efficient algorithms to achieve results on large amounts of data without causing excessive resource consumption.
– Develop automated tests for complex optimization problems.

Have we sparked your interest?

Apply now! Send your application including your salary expectation as well as the possible starting date.

items.title: Web Developer/Designer
items.content:
Creative Cores is a small media company and brand consultancy firm, specialised in creating websites and apps for innovative clients, from ambitious startups to established corporations.

We’d like to expand our in-house development capacity so we’re looking for a skilled web developer/programmer to join the team. The role would especially suit someone with a few years experience who is now looking for a new challenge as part of an ambitious and fast-growing team.

Here are the things we’re looking for:

• Solid knowledge of HTML 5, CSS 3, PHP, Java Script/Ajax/JQuery, MySQL, and able to build static, responsive, dynamic, CMS based and e-commerce websites.
• Able to use ready solutions as well as frameworks (i.e WordPress (important), Magneto, Shopify, Bootstrap, Codeigniter, Laravel etc)
• Good knowledge of configuring web apps/websites in a production environment
• Able to integrate different known APIs
• Able to accurately translate designs into code (Pixel perfect).
• Excellent attention to design and layout details (Extremely important)
• Knowledge of UI/UX best practices.
• Willingness to work independently and take the lead on projects
• Good standard of written and spoken English
• Good eye for typography and layout
• Excellent problem-solver with an ability to learn quickly
• Entrepreneurial working style, comfortable with constantly changing priorities
• Has excellent time-management and organisational skills.
• Has an eye for detail, likes to do things right first time, and gets a real kick from solving a problem.


Any of these would be a bonus:
• Preparing web development proposals for clients
• iOS, Android, app development
• Knowledge of NOD and Angular
• Knowledge of Adobe Photoshop
• Search Engine Optimization skills
• Knowledge of social media based marketing solutions
• Sketching and wire-framing
• API development


What we offer
• Competitive Salary
• Small, tight-knit team so you’ll have a key role in the design/development of our products, and will have bright chance to become a team leader/manager because we will be expanding our team
• Fast-paced, varied work on websites and for a wide range of interesting clients
• If you work late, we buy your dinner and have it ordered to the office
• Coffee, tea, water
• Great location, 5 minute walk from Canons Park station. (Jubilee line)

Position available:
As soon as possible

How to apply:
Please send us your CV along with a covering email explaining why you’d like to come and work with us. Also, please add web links of some of your recent work if possible.

items.title: Front-End Developer – 1 month – London
items.content:
Front End Developer – 1 month – London
Location: London
Duration: 1 Month
Start Date: 25 April

Daily Rate: circa £325 (please quote expectations)

We are an art tech start-up looking for a front end developer to join our team on an exciting time in our journey.
We are looking for a front end developer to assist alongside the CTO on our existing web application, and on bringing a new SaaS product to the market.

To date we have:
* Assembled the largest database of art.
* Successfully participated at Ignite Accelerator.
* Closed three rounds of financing from respected angels.
* Put together a team of thirteen working across our London, Athens and Berlin locations.

Key Specifications
* 5 years plus experience.
* Proficiency with JavaScript and HTML5.
* Professional, precise communication skills.
* Angular 2 is what we are using so it is essential to have prior experience with the framework.

We use Git, version control and pivotal tracker. Please reach out to us with a brief resume and portfolio, and possible start date.

Application process is:
- Application (resume, portfolio)
- Brief Skype Call (15 min)
- Brief coding challenge (estimated completion time 1 hour)
- In-person meeting

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer (50/50 London & Remote)
items.content:
Want to work on a web application used by hundreds of thousands of customers? We're looking for a senior frontend developer to join us from *mid-April*. You would join our existing team of 8 developers. *This role requires you to be in Central London for 3 days a week and remote for the remaining 2 days*. This is a *contract role and will run for a minimum of 6 months*. Based upon performance, this can be extended. Please note, no travel expenses are paid for this contract.

Every other week we conduct sprint planning with our client. Your input on frontend here would be vital. Tickets are then assigned and the coding commences. Designs are provided by the client’s in-house design team. We then peer review our commits and hand it over to the client’s in-house QA team.

Mediating between the client’s requests and desired timelines will be important in this role. For example, imagine that you spotted some simple changes to a proposed design which could reduce the delivery time. That’s the sort of input we’d be looking for.

On a typical day you might:

* Take part in morning standup with the development team
* Implement designs based upon user feedback to improve the checkout flow
* Implement temporary changes to the application based upon seasonal sales
* Conduct application wide reviews to determine iterative improvements to the overall user experience

*Role responsibilities*

* Work in an agile team, taking part in standups, and retrospectives (Via Google Hangouts)
* Understand the structure of existing applications and how to work with them
* Interact regularly with our client’s team
* Review commits of other team members

*What we look for*

Our ideal candidate has a great and demonstrable track record of delivering exceptional user experiences. Your very strong interpersonal skills would enable you to confidently interact with the client. When you think a better approach could be taken, you'd share that knowledge and your reasoning with the rest of the team. You would be autonomous and by that, we mean that when you encounter problems, you gather the relevant information to make an informed choice and then move ahead with the optimal decision.

As a Purepoint developer you would work in a small and close-knit group. Our mindset is focused on constant iteration and improvement. *Above all, we deliver quality over quantity.*

*Team & tools*

As part of our team, we will give you all of the tools necessary to excel at your role. We use:

* Zeplin
* InVision
* Github
* Jira
* Trello
* Slack
* Google Hangouts

*About Purepoint*

Purepoint is a remote-first software development agency. We help businesses build better bespoke software. Clients range from rising startups to household brand names.

The projects we do are incredibly varied but they share one overarching theme – putting great minds together to build better software. You’ll have the opportunity to help businesses embrace the newest technology and bring better services to market.

If you like the idea of continuously improving, working at Purepoint is a great decision. We provide everything you need to excel at your role and we’ll do our best to keep interruptions and meetings to a minimum.

*What we offer*

* Competitive pay
* Work remotely
* Flexibility with your working hours
* A minimal approach to meetings

*Requirements*

* *HTML5 & CSS3*
* *Javascript*
* Experience with modern web frameworks (Javascript & CSS)
* Experience with version control (Git)
* Capable of building with web performance in mind
* Strong cross-browser compatibility understanding
* An inclusive approach to web accessibility

items.title: Front End Developer (JS/React) (m/f)
items.content:
_This job is not available via recruiters/agencies – sorry!_

Headquartered in Berlin, MEDIGO is a curated marketplace that simplifies the complex process of booking medical travel. We facilitate the searching, booking, and arranging of treatment abroad, offering personal assistance along every step of the way. MEDIGO helps patients who desire affordable treatment, access to higher quality facilities and doctors, or who want to cut waiting times, through over 900 health providers in 36 countries. MEDIGO is supported by leading VCs such as Accel Partners, and employs an international team of 50+ people from 25 nationalities.

For a permanent position to be filled as early as possible and located in Berlin, we are looking for a Front End Developer (JS/React) (m/f).

_“Whatever good things we build end up building us.” – Jim Rohn_

*Your Profile*
* You enjoy creating complex web projects with modern libraries and tooling
* Your portfolio contains single-page as well as traditionally-navigated websites
* You are up to date with the current state of front end development and modern Javascript frameworks
* You enjoy minimalism and mobile-first
* You have already worked for one or two companies and have a healthy startup-attitude
* You are a good team player because you also have a good understanding what working server-side entails
* You are open-minded, take pride in your work and, above all, value learning and result-driven team work

*Our Team & Stack*
* Javascript/react, Go, python
* HAProxy, Postgres, MySQL, Solr, Redis
* API-first, Service-oriented architecture
* unit-& integration-testing, everybody-is-devops
* Gulp, Docker, Jenkins / circle-ci
* Loggly, Datadog, Slack
* We love open source and we give back whenever we can
* We subscribe to the principles of Calm Technology and you can check out "our core values":https://www.medigo.com/de/careers?gh_jid=236223

*Your Tasks*
* Help steer an iterative process to transform MEDIGO into a highly reactive “web 3.0” site
* Use the best selection of CSS & JS patterns/frameworks
* Work with our UX- and UI-Designers to build seamless interactions and “user delight”
* Tune and extend our front end stack with a healthy balance of new features and performance increases
* Help us automate all the things
* Train and teach others about the fine arts of year 2015 Browser tech
* Extend a world class docker based development pipeline

*Our Offer*
* Enjoy a modern and light office loft (with a 100m2 rooftop terrace!) in Berlin-Mitte. Join us for knowledge-sharing workshops, free German classes, sports activities, and regular team events
* Be part of an innovative, international company which is passionate about disrupting the medical travel industry
* Be integrated in a solid start-up ecosystem and get support from well-known VC's who have backed companies such as Facebook, Soundcloud, BlaBlaCar, KAYAK and Slack
* Develop your skills within an ambitious, professional, and supportive team, in a company where independent-thinking and responsibility are encouraged
