items.title: Frontend Engineer (JavaScript with React.js)
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

**No recruiters please

We’re searching for a proactive Frontend Engineer who is able to write high quality web apps and that is passionate about delivering a great user experience in both desktop and mobile. You’ll take responsibility for building Zeelo’s consumer app which will be the main channel for our customer’s booking process.

This is an opportunity to be an integral part of a small team with huge ambition.

----------------------------------------------------------------

What you should know about Zeelo:

* We’re on a mission to build a global pop-up transport platform that will transform inter-urban travel, by intelligently using data to generate unscheduled and direct coach routes

* We’re a small young team of do-ers, finding a balance between thinking big and getting stuff done. Our team culture encourages people to be:
- Ambitious - anything is possible with a can-do attitude
- Empowered - make intelligent and informed decisions. Ask for forgiveness, not permission
- Cheeky - don’t accept anything because ‘that’s the way it’s always been’. Be cheeky and challenge the status quo

* We’re a well funded startup with transport and technology experience. We’ve identified a huge opportunity

----------------------------------------------------------------

REQUIREMENTS
You should be/have
* 6 months of work experience using React.js
* A proficient JavaScript developer, using existing frameworks to build dynamic data driven interactive web experiences
* Experience in working with Frontend technologies like HTML5, CSS3, DHTML, javascript
* Experience with REST, JSON
* Experience in using version control systems as GIT and comfortable working with branches
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* Outgoing - able to communicate well externally and also with the rest of the team
* Creative, driven, proactive and motivated to try new things
* A versatile, practical, pragmatic worker capable of working autonomously and as a part of an interdisciplinary team

We'd really like it if you
* Send us projects that you feel proud of along with your CV
* Have worked in a startup or worked on your own projects

----------------------------------------------------------------

BENEFITS
* Great culture. Humble. Creative. Friendly. Talented. These are the people we hire and this is our working culture
* Flexible working hours
* 22 days holiday a year
* Zeelo team socials every couple of weeks
* Commitments to training and development opportunities every quarter - just ask for what you need and we’ll do our best to make it happen

items.title: Junior Front-End Developer
items.content:
*ABOUT US*

We are a diverse team of engineers, entrepreneurs and teachers, who believe that every child, irrespective of background, wealth or location, should have individual access to teaching that will inspire a love of learning and help them reach their potential.

We build intelligent technology that connects a global community of online tutors to thousands of students in schools across the UK, to provide extra help for children at risk of social or academic failure.

Having proven our model, raised £2.5m and worked with thousands of pupils delivering over 100,000 hours of 1-1 tutoring through our platform, we are pursuing very ambitious plans to expand both our scale and scope. We’re looking for top talent like you to join our team and help us achieve our vision.

*WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR*

We are looking for a true team player who is passionate about building great user experiences for our customers. This includes children so a creative nature is key!

We want a person who has a hunger for learning and is keen to make progress individually, and to improve team, product and business performance.

*REQUIREMENTS*

+ Expert in HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript
+ Strong interest in design, usability and UI
+ Excited to create products that customers/children love
+ Knowledge of technology and processes to build consumer facing high quality interactive web services & applications
+ Proactively research and take pragmatic technical decisions (framework selection, refactoring etc)

*BONUS EXPERIENCE*

+ Ruby on Rails
+ TDD & BDD
+ Previous background or academic training in design (degree, work experience etc)
+ Experience of mobile app development: iOS / Android / Cordvova
+ Experience/interest in building UIs for education and/or children
+ Contribution to OS projects

*TECH CHALLENGES OVER THE NEXT 12-24 MONTHS*

Mobile virtual classroom – Having built our own virtual classroom we are expanding this to fully support mobile touch based devices. We are exploring Native iOS/Andriod, web (HTML) and hybrid (Cordova etc) development options.

PaaS – we are moving our platform architecture toward micro-services to provide automated scaling, and a PaaS to support external clients

*SALARY: £26,000 – £35,000 per annum*

*BENEFITS*

+ Join one of the fastest growing ed tech social enterprises
+ Office in London’s tech hub
+ Beanbags, social events, beers every Friday
+ Perkbox; free tastecard, mobile phone insurance, discounts, cinema!
+ 25 days holiday

items.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer
items.content:
*ABOUT US*

We are a diverse team of engineers, entrepreneurs and teachers, who believe that every child, irrespective of background, wealth or location, should have individual access to teaching that will inspire a love of learning and help them reach their potential.

We build intelligent technology that connects a global community of online tutors to thousands of students in schools across the UK, to provide extra help for children at risk of social or academic failure.

Having proven our model, raised £2.5m and worked with thousands of pupils delivering over 100,000 hours of 1-1 tutoring through our platform, we are pursuing very ambitious plans to expand both our scale and scope. We’re looking for top talent like you to join our team and help us achieve our vision.

*WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR*

We are looking for a true team player with experience of building consumer focused applications. We want a person who has a hunger for learning and is keen to make progress individually, and to improve team, product and business performance.
 
We constantly evaluate technologies, often with spike (prototyping) days (Node/Phoenix/Elixir current candidates) so your ability and desire to rapidly adopt and adapt, applying previous knowledge, is more important than specific language/framework experience.

*REQUIRED SKILLS*

- Ruby on Rails
- Javascript
- SQL
- Familiarity with MVC frameworks
- Understanding of Object-Oriented Design principles
- Automated testing

*PREFERRED SKILLS*

- TDD & BDD
- AWS knowledge
- Understanding and ability to implement SOLID principles
- 3+ years experience

*TECH CHALLENGES OVER THE NEXT 12-24 MONTHS*

Mobile virtual classroom - Having built our own virtual classroom we are expanding this to fully support mobile touch based devices. We are exploring Native iOS/Andriod, web (HTML) and hybrid (Cordova etc) development options.

Learning via Big Data - partnering with Institute of Education, UCL, and Edinburgh University to understand the interactions that take place within our classroom to automatically & intelligently determine best teaching practice. Includes data processing, AI, machine learning, voice analytics.

PaaS - we are moving our platform architecture toward micro-services to provide automated scaling, and a PaaS to support external clients

*SALARY:* £40,000 - £60,000 per annum

*BENEFITS*

+ Join one of the fastest growing ed tech social enterprises
+ Office in London’s tech hub
+ Beanbags, social events, beers every Friday
+ Perkbox; free tastecard, mobile phone insurance, discounts, cinema!
+ 25 days holiday

items.title: Magento Back End Developer
items.content:
*DESCRIPTION*

ExpoCart is an ambitious tech start-up in the exhibition industry and we’re on a one-way mission to reinvent the way people discover and hire equipment online, for their exhibitions. We aim to make it quicker and easier than ever to organise equipment whilst providing an unrivalled customer experience.

Our curated marketplace with thousands of products from furniture and props to audio visual equipment and printing allows users to seamlessly order everything they need for their event from our trusted network of event suppliers.

It’s an exciting time to join us as we’re experiencing rapid growth and have recently transitioned to our brand new B2B booking platform.


*THE ROLE*

We are looking for a Magento developer who is truly passionate about building great products and who is hungry to make a huge difference to an industry that has not changed for years. You’ll want to make your mark and we will give you the opportunity to consistently push the boundaries of what is possible in order to make ExpoCart an industry leading platform.

You will thrive on building new features, iterating it until we get it right and working with a talented, close knit team. You will be at the heart of the product building it alongside our small tech team!

We’ll offer you the chance to have ownership of work and to not wait for opportunities to come, we’ll give you permission to use your own initiative and think outside of the box.

*REQUIREMENTS*

* 1+ years of professional Magento experience - Preferably Magento 1.9 but not essential
* Excellent knowledge of PHP 5.5+ and object oriented programming
* Design patterns
* Very good code quality and lots of passion!
* Version control with GIT
* Strong knowledge of JavaScript/jQuery
* Good understanding of CSS2/CSS3 and SCSS pre-processor
* Good knowledge of MySQL 5.6
* Good communication skills and time management

*BENEFITS*

* £30,000 - £55,000 competitive salary based on experience
* Your choice of kit and tech
* Vibrant, relaxed working office complete with sofas, coffee on tap, fully stocked beer fridge and team table tennis games!
* Challenging role with fantastic personal growth opportunities
* Office located in the Olympic Park, next to the canal with skyline views of central London.
* Discounted membership at the Olympic gym, swimming pool and velodrome.
* Friendly, close knit team – team lunches and Friday beers & drinks

If you are awesome and want to be part of a successful start up story, we would love to hear from you!

items.title: Full Stack Junior Developer at BNBHelper
items.content:
*Job Title:* Full Stack Junior Developer

*Hours*: Full Time (part-time can be considered on case-by-case basis)

*Joining*: Start Immediately

*Location*: Shoreditch, East London

h2. About the founder - Sam Ghosh

I am a city-based professional in my mid-30s. I co-founded a company called Earthmiles as a CTO, that focuses on health-rewards and incentives ("https://earthmiles.co.uk/":https://earthmiles.co.uk/) and now working on a new business that will be launched in summer 2017.

Prior to this, I have been working in banking/hedge fund for over 10 years, and then started a city-based fund with a couple of ex-colleagues ("www.voltairecap.com":http://www.voltairecap.com/).

I am well connected in the finance and startup scenes in London. I am also a property investor and focus on holiday-lets/short-term rentals and construction/conversion in certain areas in London.

Here is my Linkedin profile - "http://bit.ly/2hPRV1l":http://bit.ly/2hPRV1l

I have built production quality systems, supporting total users of more than 100,000, from scratch – ground up and with 80%+ of codebase written by myself.

As the CTO of Earthmiles, I built the entire backend and front-end Android codebase from scratch, in Python/Django and Android respectively and also the current website. It supports over 80,000 users
Fashbae – another site I built from scratch (Django Backend + React/Redux frontend) has over 20,000 users


h2. Technology Stack

Below is our tech-stack and we want someone who knows some of it, and has the enthusiasm and capacity to learn the others very fast

*DJango Framework and Python.*
Django Rest Framework
Python Social Auth – and integration with Facebook, Google+, Twitter
AWS EC2 deployment, using several AWS services
Celery; RabbitMQ or Redis Queue
Django testing framework - – unit, functional and integration testing (Jenkins)
Test driven Django
Logging systems – Logentries, sentry, opbeat
Django-viewflow – an esoteric package that is really useful and I have talked about in several Django conferences in UK
Scraping using python scrapy
Sample "txt":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2e8e45cff86be22d30c0eea4791333b3 - "https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2e8e45cff86be22d30c0eea4791333b3":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2e8e45cff86be22d30c0eea4791333b3


*React JS/ Redux framework*

React JS + React-redux framework
React-redux-router
Redux-saga
I use "https://github.com/react-boilerplate/react-boilerplate":https://github.com/react-boilerplate/react-boilerplate and adhere to general framework.
Sample "json":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/a65552923a631911e569264404cc52f9 - "https://gist.github.com/somghosh/a65552923a631911e569264404cc52f9":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/a65552923a631911e569264404cc52f9

*Java and Android programming* – with demonstrable apps on the Play Store if possible

REST API and asynchronous programming techniques, some working knowledge of backend systems that servers data to front end
Working with UX designers in the past – should have good UI/UX skills that can be used to continuously improve the product
Database – I use Realm.io
Integration with Facebook, Google+, Twitter SDK
Knowledge of various third-party packages that can be leveraged upon – we use Retrofit, GSON, Lombok, Parceler, Cardslib, Android Annotations, Picasso, OKHTTP,
Unit and Functional testing
Sample build.gradle dependencies - "https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2a081f42e1d59ed26a7519d8a5c25099":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2a081f42e1d59ed26a7519d8a5c25099


*Objective-C and/or Swift iOS programming* with demonstrable apps on the App Store

REST API and asynchronous programming techniques, some working knowledge of backend systems that servers data to front end
Working with UX designers in the past – should have good UI/UX skills that can be used to continuously improve the product
Coredata/Restkit/AFNetworking
Integration with Facebook, Google+, Twitter SDK
Knowledge of various third-party packages that can be leveraged upon
Unit and Functional testing

*Knowledge of these technologies would be useful but not essential*

Git and continuous integration systems
Analytics platform like Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Keen.io, Segment.io
Push Notifications architecture (GCM and APNS)
Mailing systems – MailChimp, Mandrill and their integrations with Django
Helpdesk systems like Zendesk and integration with Django

h2. What will you be working on - BNBHelper

BNBHelper and its core product Zerlock is a suite of tools to help different players in the short-term holiday rental market streamline their business. The sharing-economy in real-estate has been a buzz word for the last few years and will only be increasing in its reach over the next 5 years and with increasing players in the market, there is a need for technological tools to help such market participants. BNBHelper is creating a suite of such tools

This startup comes out of my experience in the real-estate market for last 3 years to simplify pain points for hosts in the short-term rental market in UK and abroad. It is being backed by some high net-worth property investors in UK and by BOK Construction (http://www.bokconstruction.co.uk/) a London based construction company focussing on high-end construction

Different coding/development streams include:

* AI engine / chat bot for replying to guest enquiries and post-booking questions faster
* Scraping of quasi-open data to infer market competition analysis
* Home automation in several different ways to have total picture of when guests check in, which rooms they use and when, improved security and improved customer-service messaging. We will play around with various Internet of Things technologies available today and pick the best ones and integrate them in our project and improve upon them
* A guest-composite score analysis using heavy use of scraping, machine learning and other algorithms to separate good guests from bad guests.
* Scaling up all of the above to a production-ready level

There is existing code-base for all of these above but a lot of ongoing work is still necessary and in the business roadmap.


h2. Who a we looking for:

A junior developer with “stay hungry, stay foolish” mindset, who has proven track record of “hacking” from his bedroom/dorm-room for a considerable period of time.

You love knowing and learning new technologies and using them towards practical applications and solving real-life problems and making cool things

Solving that nagging bug, or learning that new intricate package to fit into your codebase keeps you up till late night.

You can think and build things from first-principles when necessary, but also know how to use existing packages and join their dots and integrate them well to the desired end.

College-programming degree is great, but not essential. I have mentored and helped junior developers in the past to the point that they single-handedly maintain full-stack (front end + backend) code bases for actual commercial apps for well-funded startups currently, and I will be helping you out in a similar manner and you will work very closely with me (at least 3-4 hours of face to face time each day)

You should be able pick up things fast as you will have a lot to learn. I encourage you having an aim to perhaps starting your startup within 2-3 year’s time from all the knowledge gained (tech/marketing/fund-raising) from this experience.

If you are keen, I will be happy to expand your role to more than a developer (to help in marketing/business/fund-raise) in the near future, given your enthusiasm and ability. It is in fact encouraged.

The job requires a good attitude towards problem-solving and debugging, and working under tight-schedule.

You should aim to work 5-5.5 days a week, sometimes under tight schedule but when there are no pressing needs, you are welcome to work on your own projects for 1 day a week – which I will happily work with you on/mentor/advise/invest into if appealing.

h2. Compensation - £27000 per annum equivalent

Probationary period: 2-5 months depending on your current experience – GBP 1000 / month (net in hand)
Post probation – GBP 1500 / month (net in hand)

You would have a probationary period of 3 months, post which we will have a longer term permanent engagement agreement.

Bonus – after completion of 1 year – GBP 3500 minimum contractual (and more depending on you performance and business performance)


You can expect periodic revisions in compensation every year at least (if not earlier) and being assigned stock options after the first fund-raise of BNBHelper. Also you can expect very healthy increase after the completion of 1st year.

If you have present commitments, for the right candidate a part-time agreement for an initial period (at a different compensation level) will also be considered till you free up to become full-time

items.title: Full Stack Developer (Python)
items.content:
*Loughborough based in-house role for our first full-stack software developer*

*Who are we*
We are the pioneers in cricket simulators for entertainment and training. We have developed the world’s first portable, IOT ready and fully automated machine that allows the batsmen to watch the bowler on the screen and also play the ball after it's delivered. We have gained significant traction in the past year with the English Cricket Board, Gary Kirsten's Coaching centres and several County cricket centres currently using our product. We also ran 65 events last year and we are on track to have our simulators installed in some of the high profile tournaments worldwide. We have made installations in Canada and South Africa with looking to expand to Asia and Australia. Our products have gathered great interest from both local and international markets allowing us to expand our core research and product development team.

We were founded by a pair of childhood friends from Kenya that were passionate about cricket. We have recently been backed by some of the world’s leading technology investors and entrepreneurs.

*Who we are looking for*
We are looking for our first full-time stack developer who is enthusiastic, self-motivated and is passionate about developing software for IOT enabled embedded devices. The successful candidate will part-take in research and development activities within the cricket simulator and other sports technologies we have in the pipeline.

*Job Details*
Refine existing cricket simulator software and address bugs and UI/UX issues. Work with a contractor to develop the next generation UI/UX interface. Work with the simulator team to develop the next generation in the family of cricket simulators.

Part-take in Design, test and build of a novel scoring system working with electrical engineers on-site and independent contractors. Develop control algorithms to be deployed on off-the-shelf or custom embedded hardware.

Key accountabilities will include:
* Maintain and improve existing software (C/C++, Python, HTML, Jquery, CSS)
* Provide remote software support to international clients
* Integrate UI/UX interface for next generation of our B1 cricket simulator
* Undertake basic electrical prototyping of embedded hardware
* Source system components
* Manage software repositories and deployment/update schedules
* Develop robust software architectures in C/C++, Python, HTML
* Develop signal detection algorithms
* Develop cloud-based and local SQL databases
* Develop custom products for clients

*Benefits*
* Work in a highly dynamic and innovative environment within the Loughborough Science Parks
* Great career progression opportunities
* Flexible working hours
* Competitive salary and meaningful equity options

We are happy to accept applications from anyone who has a right to work in the UK (i.e. EU nationals).

N.B. Please No 3rd party recruiters

items.title: Javascript Developer
items.content:
Who we are

Altus Analytics, a business of Altus Group, is the leading global technology partner to the commercial real estate industry and is poised for significant growth and expansion over the next three years.

Altus Analytics brings together the collective expertise of ARGUS and Voyanta as the leading provider of Commercial Real Estate (CRE) solutions worldwide. Our technology and industry expertise empower CRE clients and partners to work collaboratively to enhance decision making, drive performance and optimize transactional efficiency. From property budgeting, making strategic decisions about acquisitions or working with different teams, different organizations and different data, we can bring it all together.

Our tech, our stack.

Voyanta is a revolutionary software platform that gives real estate investors and lenders effective tools to capture, validate and analyse commercial real estate information.

The system is built on Amazon AWS cloud infrastructure, using Agile processes, Java, Angular 2 and PHP alongside specialist data and BI technologies running on primarily Linux platforms. It combines carefully crafted advanced user experience with in depth data modelling and manipulation and advanced business information and data analysis tools.

The opportunity

To stay at the top of our game, Voyanta is consistently exploring new technologies to improve our products - and our customers’ experience of those products. To that end, we need a new creative and dedicated Javascript Developer who wants to use Angular 2 and CSS with SASS or LESS to implement our front-end product experience.

We need a Javascript Developer who is seeking a meaningful and challenging change. Someone who wants to jump into a virtual playground, get to know our products and rebuild them in a way they envision it. This is a move for someone who wants to have the freedom to make design choices and introduce modern, responsive user-friendly processes and models.

What’s in it for you?

You want to be part of a team that is involved in project direction and has a chance to bring their ideas to fruition. A team that is respected and highly valued as having insights into what users need and want. You are seeking a chance to increase your expertise in Angular 2 and you are excited by the opportunity to rewrite existing code; rebuilding the front-end in new and modern ways.

This is a chance to work closely with the rest of the Development team and the Product team. To collaborate with Systems Architect, BAs, UI/UX, QA and the CTO to improve the customer space and push forward the customer-focused experience and engagement with our Voyanta product.

Where are you now?

You are working as a Front End Developer for a small-to-mid-sized organization using Angular 2 and Javascript. You might be in the early days of your career there and you want a chance to prove yourself. Or, you might be more experienced but stuck working in older technologies, siloed off from what the architects, backend and product teams are working on. You are enthusiastic about the user experience and excited to try new ideas and concepts. You want to join a team that will allow you the freedom to take risks, learn as you so and drive your own deliverables.

What will your career path look like?

The experience you gain here, working independently yet as part of a tightly knit scrum team will result in greater exposure to new technologies, processes and people across the greater organization.

As we grow, your role will be pivotal to the product suite we are working on. It is a chance to directly impact the design and the direction of our product front end and to grow with a rapidly developing team.

Here’s what our Javascript Developer will do:

- Build. You will work as part of a scrum team on full lifecycle front-end development for the Voyanta product.
- Champion. You will introduce original ideas and best practices to Improve the front-end functionality and user experience.
- Quality. You will conduct code review and testing
- Create. You will be responsible for estimation and design of new front end features and upgrading existing ones.
- Collaborate. You will be part of an Agile team and work closely with Development and Product team.

How do we know that’s you? You have:

- A Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related numerate discipline.
- Three years experience as a Front End Developer as part of an Agile scrum team.
- Hands-on experience using one or more of the following:
- Angular 2
- Backbone.js with Marionette.js and Require.js
- Wijmo
- CSS using Sass or LESS
- An innovative approach. You insist on keeping up with industry standards and trends. You are adept at thinking of all possible answers.
- A strong sense of ownership. You thrive in an autonomous yet collaborative environment. You are committed to doing your best work.
- Enthusiasm. You have a GitHub account or other personal projects on the go.
Initiative. You are highly capable of meeting deadlines. You are customer-focused and self-motivated.
- Outstanding communication skills. You are able to clearly present ideas and concepts within and across a multi-functional team.

Need any more reasons to want to work with us?

As we continue to grow, the possibilities for the people that join Altus Analytics are huge. From professional growth to innovation to collaboration we are committed to continuing to foster the right environment to help our people realize their full potential. We give our people the freedom and responsibility to take charge of their career path, bring new ideas to the forefront and work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients.

We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus Analytics a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn.

items.title: DevOps Lead
items.content:
*DevOps Engineer*


_Want the environment of a start-up within a FTSE 75 company? Want to be led by hands-off management?_


Chances are you’ve tried to change supplier for your television, phone, broadband or energy services before.

Did you have a memorable experience as a consumer? We’re here to make it a ‘yes’



We're a high growth technology and retail business. We develop deal comparison SaaS for triple play: TV, Phone and Broadband. It's a complex industry with over 5,000 products, each with several variants - we're here to offer customers the right option.


*Right now, we’re in the midst of some big changes which we want you to be involved in, including:*


* Migration of our new and existing applications to AWS

* Planning and building out our new Omni-channel integration

* Integrating into Dixons Carphone


*What’s it like working here:*

We have a small DevOps team that reports directly to the Director of Development – helping to truly automate and make our software development as efficient as possible.

* We work in a collaborative, Agile team environment on a range of different projects from e-commerce websites to SaaS enterprise solutions and tools.

* You’ll automate, automate, and automate – delivering a modern, lean approach to “smoothing the path” our software takes from a developer’s workstation, through develop and test cycles, all the way to Cloud hosting.

* We encourage our developers to voice their opinions on any new technologies and solutions that might improve performance.


* Sounds good? You’ll do great here if you:*

* Are comfortable with all things AWS

* Have the gravitas to inspire your team, helping to coach & mentor less experienced members.

* Have great knowledge of container systems.

* Are a great communicator within tech teams and with non-technical groups

* Are an advocate of best-breed practices including test-driven design, code reviews, continuous integration…

* Have a degree in a technical discipline like Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics…




*If that sounds like you, here's why you'll enjoy working here:*

* We aren't corporate and don't wear suits.

* We're backed by Dixons Carphone , a FTSE 75 company.

* Great team and company-wide events: Escape rooms, hackathons, junkyard golf, bowling, team lunches....

* We promote flexible working.

* Yearly bonus!

* We're hands-off managers

* Staff encouraged to stuff themselves with free fruit, velvet cake and takeaways...

* ... But we have a subsidised gym membership to counter that (we also have a free onsite gym at Acton HQ)



*A few of our awards include:*

- One of Europe's fastest growing technology businesses in the 2013 GP Bullhound Media Momentum Awards.

- We've been awarded the Sunday Times Tech Track 100

- The Deloitte Technology Fast 50 awards for the past three years in a row (2015, 2014 & 2013)

- Innovation in Analytics 2016

items.title: Backend Software Engineer (PHP)
items.content:
We’re looking for a backend engineer to join our team in London. You’ll have a track record of solving difficult engineering problems across all parts of the business. You should be as at home performing regressions across complex cohort models as building and designing APIs for our front-end team.

You’ll work as part of a talented team responsible for innovation with the freedom to research and implement solutions using cutting-edge technologies. We spend our time split between working with PHP (Symfony2, Magento, Laravel and Lumen) and Python (particularly the ERP system Odoo). Prior experience with these technologies would be ideal, but we’ll also consider candidates with all strong programming backgrounds that want a new challenge. We’re a small, dynamic, language agnostic team that’s looking to revolutionise a $100 billion industry.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Developing solutions for key business issues in relation to demand prediction, LTV modelling and cohort analysis
* Helping us scale traffic and revenue, and improve business processes through innovative use of technology
* Contributing ideas on how to solve the complex issues that the team face
* Building scalable solutions capable of quickly processing large amounts of data
* Deploying production systems on Amazon EC2

REQUIREMENTS:

* You are capable of building web applications using LAMP architecture. This will require knowledge of PHP5+ & OOP, and MySQL5 and its surrounding technologies.
* You have API experience, including integration and API design
* You understand server-side MVC frameworks (Synfony2 / Laravel)
* You can develop applications in Python
* You are able to dig deep into business requirements and having a sense of ownership over your work
* You have a desire to learn and share new practices
* You’re a really nice person

You'll score bonus points if:
* You understand Open Source technologies and are an active participant in the Open Source community
* You have a broad interest and knowledge of other programming languages, including Python and Ruby

items.title: Frontend Developer D3JS
items.content:
We are looking for Frontend Developer to come in and joining our rapidly growing team. A Frontend developer to come in alongside the designers and back-end developers to be involved in a really exciting project, to start as soon as possible.

The key factor would be to work on an Data Visualisation project using D3.JS.

Required Skills:
1. HTML5, CSS3
2. JavaScript - Angular 1.5 - 2.0 and D3.JS (must).
3. Experience in building large JavaScript / Web applications
4. Ability to take psd, illustrator designs and slice them up in to responsive html and css layouts

6. PHP and Node.js Skills are a bonus
7. Must be in the UK and eligible to work in the UK.

Must have a portfolio of work to demonstrate the relevant skills (ideally Data Visualisation examples).

items.title: MEAN Stack Junior Developer
items.content:
AMPP Group is well established technology company with a client base of FTSE 100 and Fortune 500 clients. AMPP is seeking an exceptional individual to join our rapidly growing team as a MEAN Stack Junior Developer.

AMPP Group’s engineering team works on multisided collaboration platforms and seeks an individual who can participate in developing a project from the ground up to assist the existing team and allow the development of several features in parallel.

The candidate should be prepared to work in a fast-paced environment, not being afraid of being involved in tough challenges and prone to Front-end Development.

The role involves working within agile methodology, and the successful candidate will have the ability to problem solve and find new creative solutions to tough logical problems. A keen interest in social platforms and content management systems is preferred.

Salary: £25.000 per annum + bonus + benefits

Skills and Languages:

+ Deep knowledge of web languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
+ Deep knowledge of the AngularJS framework (version 1.x and possibly version 2).
+ Experience with UX and UI design.
+ Minimum knowledge of relation database functioning, especially SQL and PostgreSQL types.
+ The candidate should have excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a keen interest in both front and back end development.
+ Candidates with knowledge of NodeJS and the Express framework are preferred, although this is not necessary.
+ Candidates who have experience of designing an entire application are preferred.
+ Knowledge of graphics editor softwares, such as, the Adobe products, GIMP or other are preferred.

Duties and Responsibilities:

+ To work within the Software Development team to ensure that project and overall targets are met.
+ To set up a back end connected to our already existing platform.
+ To provide creative suggestions and ideas to improve user experience and the development of new features.

items.title: Web Developer (f/m)
items.content:
*Delivery Hero* is building the next generation global online food-ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in 40 countries worldwide to ensure hungry customers get the fastest way to their favorite takeaway food. This is an exciting time for Delivery Hero with a huge and rapid amount of growth in countries, market size and opportunities. We’re looking for a passionate and devoted *Web Developer* who’s motivated to push his/her own boundaries. Working in a team of designers, you’ll be exchanging ideas and developing concepts on a large scale of projects. Our Development team already operates in countries worldwide delivering a million meals a year, which implies that we get a good variety of projects to work on and many challenges. You get things done, you question everything and you like to play in a team. You are going to be sitting in the cockpit of Delivery Hero’s global operations.



*Your mission:*


Conception, design and implementation of responsive websites, landing pages, but also newsletters, banners and other online collaterals
Building and maintaining our different internal platforms of communication (styleguide, intranet, galleries, etc.)
Involved in concepting, wireframing and developing web pages that make ordering with Delivery Hero an exciting and engaging experience
Working in our design team and with other designers to ensure all our projects are done on time and according to our standards
When not coding, providing support on design projects and working on innovative solutions for our different websites and apps

*Your heroic skills:*


2-4 years of experience in web design
Very good HTML and experience with CSS pre processors (SASS,LESS or other)
Good backend and CMS knowledge
Javascript experience (Angular or React would be your bonus points)
Experience with Wordpress (PHP, SQL Databases are a plus)
Good knowledge in UI/UX (mobile is a plus)
Good design skills
Structured and methodical working methods
Good experience with Adobe Creative Suite
Able to multi-task and deliver projects on time
Interest in new web technologies and design trends
Fluent English skills
Proactive and creative

*We offer you:*

International working atmosphere and cross-cultural teams
Goal oriented environment
Flexible working hours
Great career opportunities
Nice work environment and English as working language


Have we caught your attention? Then please send us your application including cover letter, CV, salary expectations and earliest starting date. We’re looking forward to your application!

items.title: ✮ Marketing lead ✮
items.content:
*About Patch*
Launched in May 2016, "Patch":http://patch.garden is helping more people to discover the joy of plants, inside and outside their home. Backed by leading VC firm, Forward Partners, and a number of ecommerce experts, we’re pioneering a new way for the millennial generation to get into gardening. After a successful first year of establishing the business in London, we’re looking ahead to our next of stage of growth.

*About the role*
We’re now looking for an experienced and enthusiastic digital marketer to join the team, working directly with the CEO and COO to continue the business’ excellent momentum and help scale it rapidly across its key indicators of performance, namely revenue, cost per acquisition and lifetime value.

Specifically, this role will expect its successful applicant to:

* Set up, manage and optimise paid search and social campaigns that align with our revenue and CPA goals
* Manage the creation and analysis of a CRM strategy that supports our targets around conversion and retention
* Lead a content strategy that brings to life the excitement of plants and helps to convert our community of online followers into customers and advocates of Patch
* Inform product strategy, supporting on efforts to improve on-site conversion rates
* Explore other exciting growth opportunities, especially in direct mail, referral and SEO.

*About you*
* You have at least 3 years’ experience of managing paid search and social campaigns, with demonstrable impact on revenue and acquisition costs
* You have experience of working in a fast-paced and innovative environment
* You’re commercially creative: highly analytical and influenced by data but, equally, you believe in creativity and its power to drive results
* You have a passion for startups and you’re the go-to person for innovations in the world of growth hacking
* You work well within a team: you’re organised, you communicate and delegate effectively and you inspire people around you to work better

*What we offer*
* Highly competitive package
* Weekly team lunches
* Quarterly team events
* A unique opportunity to lead the growth of one of London’s most exciting startups

*STRICTLY NO AGENCIES PLEASE*

items.content:
Deliveroo | Software Engineer (Backend) Mid or Senior Level | London | Visa Sponsorship | http://deliveroo.engineering

Deliveroo, one of Europe's fastest growing startups, are looking for Software Engineers to join us full time in our London office. Our tech stack is Ruby-on-Rails and React, although we're happy to look at candidates from all over.

We're revolutionising the food industry and making poor quality takeaways a thing of the past, allowing you to enjoy restaurant quality meals at home, in the office, or wherever you'd like to enjoy good food!

We're a startup, we work collaboratively and in feature driven product teams. We do our best to make sure our environment suits the people in it, so flexible working, occasional remote work, childcare vouchers, subsidised gym membership are just a few of the things we have in place to make sure working here is convenient for all.

Engineering Blog - http://deliveroo.engineering

Interview Process: 15 minute phone screen (not in the least bit technical), a task is then sent out for you to kick off in your own time whilst we schedule an onsite. You'll talk us through your method and do some pairing (2 hours) and then on the same day have a chat with a senior member of the team (30 minutes) to find out if we work in a way that's suitable for you.
